Reviews.Title: “Gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure I could find a good, not-so pricey hotel in midtown, during spring break, but I did... Rooms are small but neat, breakfast is plentiful, and the location is fantastic. Two blocks from Penn station, easy walking to Times Square, theaters, Central Park...Now I have a hotel to go to when I visit New York again!

Reviews.Title: “Just about a four...”
Reviews.Author: Flooj12
Reviews.Content: Just returned after four days in the NYMA. Pros: Excellent value Staff very helpful Free breakfast (although we didn't take it) Coffee available from vending machines in lounge 24 hours a day Rooms very clean Cons: Rooms on small side (we had room 704 for 2 people) - but not a problem for us as we weren't there for most of the time Rooms at front of hotel suffer from noisy garbage trucks from 6am - 32nd St is in Koreatown with loads of restaurants. The noise gets funnelled upwards. Lots of trash in street too in black bags - so not the most salubrious of surroundings Where hotel is narrow but tall (17 floors), the rooms are quite close together. This, coupled with the garbage trucks and unbelievable lack of thought for any other guests by ignorant Americans shouting at the top of their voices at ungodly hours of the day (yes I include you, the 13 year old or so girl who just had to scream in her phone that she'd meet so and so downstairs in 5 minutes - at 7am) meant that it was difficult to get a good night's rest. So in summary, excellent value for central Manhattan, but be prepared to be extremely tired!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - crowded breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: kwesth
Reviews.Content: Pick this hotel for its location. Close to Penn station and a strikingly well situated in Manhattan. Rooms are relatively ok - size is adequate compared to other hotels in the area. A nice touch is, that breakfast was included. But the two breakfast rooms tend to be terribly crowded and the amount of foam mugs, paper dishes and plastic forks and knives amounts to terrifying quantas of waste. Have stayed there twice in 2011 - both times the staff was relatively helpfull - but don't expect smiles and friendlyness. Hot complimentary drinks are available at all times in an area close to the lobby. Quality is so so, though. Wifi connections are very good. All in all this hotel hotel is not that bad compared to others. Manhattan hotels tend to be terribly overpriced. This one faces the competition relatively well. Be advised, that the hotel routinely adds extra (tourist) taxes and stange conference fees to your bill. Something that comes as a surprise when you do the reservation through Booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at NYMA. The hotel is a great place to be in midtown Manhattan. Very close to subways, with a stop to the west at Broadway/Greeley Sq that connects to Herald Sq and PATH station. Penn Station is 2 blocks west at 32nd and 7th. To the east the subway stop is at 33rd and Park. You can be almost anywhere in the city in 20-30 mins or less. There are many attractions within walking distance(Times Sq, Empire State Bldg, 5th Ave, Macy's, FlatIron district, etc). The rooms were small but clean and quiet, and beds were very comfortable. Free breakfast was a great perk; fruit, oatmeal, boiled eggs, muffins/donuts, yogurt, coffee and juice. There is a decent amount of space to sit and eat also. The location is in Koreatown, which was very crowded at night, but not a problem for us. The hotel staff was courteous, and held our luggage after checkout. If you're looking for a nice, clean, inexpensive place in midtown Manhattan, NYMA is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean”
Reviews.Author: LoriandMike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for midtown Manhattan. We were pleased. It was clean and adequate for the few hours we spent there sleeping. The breakfast was adequate, especially for being included in the hotel rate. I was also pleased to witness the manager assertively ask some questionable lobby visitors to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly okay for the $”
Reviews.Author: ever_wanderlusty
Reviews.Content: The challenge in Manhattan (when one does not have the luxury of one's employer picking up the hotel tab) is finding a decent room that 1) doesn't break the bank and 2) isn't dirty or creepy. It's easy to find hotels that fit the first category, but hard to identify the ones that also fill the second. NYMA is not at all luxurious, but it's well priced, clean, staffed by friendly people and conveniently located near the subway and within walking distance of many things. The location in Koreatown is not to everyone's taste, but as we're addicted to Asian food, it worked for us (try the Mandoo Bar for a quick bite). We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mcannaro
Reviews.Content: I would pretty much agree with the reviews I read of this facility. Staff was helpful, BEDS WERE GREAT (foam, Tempurpedic type beds), breakfast was adequate, location great. The rate is great for what you get. We were not disappointed. The bed linens are a bit old, but ok. We were placed on a smoking floor, so would definitely make sure you request to be on non-smoking floor if that is important to you. The heating in one of the rooms was working 'too well' and the room was hot. The hotel is old and needs some updating, but was comfortable and a great value. We would stay there again and would recommend to friends. The lobby lounge is a nice touch - my kids really liked the hot chocolate. It was really quite good!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: waitintoretire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here several times. It is very clean, nice rooms, great continental breakfast, excellent location, all for a reasonable price. Experienced no problems whatsoever. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Asian food then this is perfect”
Reviews.Author: D795
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the heart of Korea Town. We loved the location for the food. Many restaurants there are open 24 hours. It is also very close to several subway lines and within walking distance to many attractions (Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, 5th Ave, etc.). The hotel room was ok. Nothing special at all but it is clean enough. Compared to other hotels in downtown Manhattan, the price is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and in great location!”
Reviews.Author: GMarisol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with two young children (4 and 7 years) - stayed in a room with 2 double beds. The room was small, but not too small - we stayed for 2 days and had plenty of room/drawers for all of our stuff and the suitcases were not in the way. The only wish I had was for a better airconditioning/heating system. The blankets are not very warm on their own and the heater blasted air into the room. I think I was the only cold one though. The bathroom was small - but designed well to allow for room for toiletries. I enjoyed location - right off of 5th avenue - we walked to Rockefeller Center from the hotel and the kids were able to handle it. The hotel is very close to Penn Station as well - (we walked from the train station to the hotel). I would definitely stay here again -it was worth it & allows me to spend more $$ on entertainment/food/shopping!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lruizm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the nyma after staying at yotel, so definitely it is not as nice and perfect as the other one, but this one has an excellent location. If you are looking for a hotel in a good spot to sleep and have breakfast, this is all you need. PROS location is absolutely perfect, at the heart of the korean neighbourhood, one block away from empire state and you have the biggest macys in the corner! breakfast included. bagels, bread, cereal. not much but you can live with it. free wifi tv with several channels good sized bathrooms fridge in your room 24/7 restaurants and cafes nearby bed is amazingly comfortable CONS smells like cigarrette A/C is horrible. It was cold in december and whenever i turned it on, it was very very hot, so i had to turn it on and off non stop again in december, a lot of people, so we had no place to sit during breakfast service is okay, not as friendly as id like depends on your room, but can get a little noisy at night

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RAH-AtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the abundance of positive reviews and were not disappointed. The nyma offers a great travel value and is centrally located for a fun visit to New York City. Our kudos to the management and staff of this fine property!

Reviews.Title: “Mother-Daughter Visit”
Reviews.Author: SaraTheGreat
Reviews.Content: Double room was good size, clean and surprisingly quiet given location is buzzing. Very central location. Good value. Few frills.

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose: value for money, clean, spot on location”
Reviews.Author: amigadelmondo
Reviews.Content: Early December, we spent 4 nights at the NYMA. The very courteous AppleCore agent who took our telephone booking ensured that our requests were honoured: a king-size room in a quiet part of the 14th floor, with a full view of the Empire State. I'm a light sleeper so being high up, we heard no street from Korea Town/ 32nd Street. The morning we checked out, we were up at 4:30 am; we could hear the garbage trucks operating on the street below - but the noise didn't wake us prior to that. Most importantly, our room was very clean, especially the bedding. The mattress was protected with a solid, sterile mattress cover, and the area around and under the bed was spotlessly clean. The room is farily small, but there's enough room to walk around, work at the desk, have 2 suitcases open, and to hang come clothes in a small closet. The bathroom is small but manageable for one person at a time; it's also very clean. The hotel staff were always very friendly and helpful. The inclusive continental breakfast served daily from 6 am- 10 am is more than adequate: yogurts, apples, bananas, cereals, oatmeal, gently-boiled eggs, croissants and pastries in addition to bagels, toast, and the usual hot and cold beverages. What impressed us most was the fact that the breakfast room staff worked hard to keep the very busy breakfast room clean, tidy and continuously stocked up until 10 am. The lobby is very pleasant with 2 new Macs for guests to use. The Mezzanine lounge has comfy chairs, flat screen tvs and a 24/7 self service hot drinks 'bar'. The 2 newer elevators work well. Considering that the hotel was fully booked, the wait times for elevators, reception, breakfast were good. We also liked the fact that the hotel has designated parking out front for a couple of cars to drop off/pick up guests, and it's so close to the Subway! The only real frustration we experienced was that the WiFi reception was not good/non-existent in our 14th floor room. Reception tried several times to re-boot the server for our floor but it didn't work. Management later reassured us that they would look into improving this service. We'd stay at nmya again, and recommend it to friends. The Midtown location is perfect, and it's great having all the restaurant /cafe options in 32nd St for convenient snacks/meals.

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: meekmol
Reviews.Content: Hello stayed at the NYMA for 4 nights in Dec 2011 and its great, so convenient hotel with a breakfast. you can get every where from here on tube bus train all right out side, one block away from Empire state building right in the heart of the shopping on 5th ave would def. stay again if in New York

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: getupdosomething
Reviews.Content: Needed a relatively inexpensive place to stay for a long weekend without breaking the bank--3 nights totaled $665 for 2 double beds, breakfast and wifi included. This was convenient to the subway, in the middle of Korea town with many cheap food options in the neighborhood and a short walk to Macy's. Met my expectations- not fancy, clean, and reasonably priced for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: keisha73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NYMA (formerly Red Roof Inn) for a Friday to Monday weekend stay in July 2010 and it was perfect for what I needed... a place to lie my head after shopping. I was steps away from that very cool women's accessory store called Accessory Palace and another block form the Macy's compound. Also on the street of the hotel was a very cool yogurt/specialty cold tea drinks place called Red Mango (this location now moved down to 11 W. 32nd Street), which was also competing with Pinkberry Frozen yogurt. The hotel room was a good deal for the location plus it was very sizeable with plenty room to move around and a decent sized closet with a king size bed. The plus for me was the small microwave and fridge in my room. Also, the hotel lobby area had 2 computers with internet service and I had a couple packages delivered to the hotel, which were handed off to me without a charge. The NYMA was a good stay and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “By NYC Standards a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorCharles
Reviews.Content: In a city where hotel prices seem particularly insane, one can book this hotel, at times, for a reasonable price. The rooms are a bit cramped but they are clean. The lobby was redone to update it; the breakfast room (breakfast is included in the room price) is still the same dreary place it always has been. If you're travelling by rail, this is just so convenient to Penn Station--literally a five minute walk. In any other context, there would be nothing to speak of about his hotel, but in NYC this qualifies as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient base to explore to NY”
Reviews.Author: Belgianz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYMA for four nights in December 2011. The best thing about the hotel is its very reasonable rates for its location in Midtown. It is within easy walking distance of tourist attractions such as the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, the Flatiron building, Bryant Park, the New York Public Library and the Rockefeller Center. It is also close to four major subway lines, making getting around a breeze. Also, if you are a fan of Korean food, then the hotel's location in Koreatown is a bonus. Special mention ought to be made of our bed, which was extremely comfortable - the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Our room on the 15th floor also had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. On the downside however, there are only two lifts and getting down to street level can involve considerable waiting. The only other quibbles are fairly minor. The complimentary wifi can be a little hard to access at times, and the water pressure in the shower was also a little variable. Finally, the breakfast rooms are too small to allow for a comfortable breakfast. However, overall the NYMA hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “International Experience”
Reviews.Author: tshook80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYMA for four nights (Dec. 1 - 4). We arrived early on the 1st and the front desk staff was very accommodating. They stored our luggage until our early check-in (1:30 pm versus the posted 3 pm). The rooms were very neat, clean, and fashionably decorated. The bed was to die for. It provided some great sleeping. The continental breakfast was filling with quite a bit of variety. The housekeeping staff was very friendly. This hotel caters to the international traveler. We heard German, French, Italian, and Spanish in the breakfast room. Overall, a wonderful find and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “First NYC Visit”
Reviews.Author: dlynn46
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose this hotel for our first NYC visit. It's within walking distance of Penn Station, so getting from EWR to Manhattan via the train was a breeze. It's also an easy walk to Times Square, and we are senior citizens. There are several nearby subway stops making public transportation a great choice for exploring the city. We appreciated this during the surprise October snow storm! The room at the NYMA was larger and cleaner than I expected, and the bed was comfortable. As several reviewers pointed out, breakfast is crowded, but it is also complementary and filling! The staff was helpful and friendly making our stay at the hotel pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: janipants
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nyma from Nov25-27 for some Black Friday shopping. Arrived in the city at 6am, and went right to the hotel. It was fully booked, so we weren't able to check in then, but we could check our bags, so we could head out right away to start our shopping. We came back around 1pm to see if we could check in yet (check in is at 3pm) and we were good! We were thrilled, as our feet were already starting to get sore from the many many blocks we walked that morning. The room was clean, bigger than I was expecting for NYC, 2 double beds with a desk, and a big tv. We were expecting a fridge, and were disappointed there wasn't one in the room, but not a huge deal. The bathroom is also a good size, although you have to have long arms to reach the TP. I was surprised to find a hairdryer in the bathroom, I didn't see it on the list of amenities before I went, so I brought my own. The location was great, right near the Empire State building and 5th avenue shopping. Also some delicious Korean-Chinese restaurants nearby that are open 24 hours. The complimentary breakfast room was PACKED when we went in both mornings. The first morning we just left, and the second we brought our food back up to our room. Check-in and Check-out went smoothly. Our room had a view into the apartments next door which was kind of funny!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaSockman
Reviews.Content: Took the family up to view the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade and decided to try this hotel out due to its location to the parade route. Not bad! The overall appearance was excellent and very clean. Help was very friendly and attentive. Reserved a (2) Queen room and asked about a better view other than the back of the hotel - was informed that the 32nd Ave. view was reserved for "single" bed accommodations. This hotel is located on "Korea Way" so, if you are looking for good Korean food - you are staying in the right place. Now, the only downside I would say would have to be the size of the rooms. I'm guessing that from the end of the Queen bed to the front of the dresser would be no more than 3 feet (a little tight to say the least) and the beds would take up app. 85% of the room. With that being said, if you are looking to stay at an affordable, clean, and comfortable room and don't plan on staying "in" your room for long periods of time (other than sleeping) - then this is an option that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: Frutta00
Reviews.Content: I and a friend stayed at the Nyma, November 11-13. I was very apprehensive upon reading the negative reviews, but I am happy to say our stay was excellent. Front desk: Check in went very smoothly. We arrived at 2:00pm and were given a room immediately. A temporary $50.00 charge was placed on my card (deposit in case of damages). The pending charge was removed upon check out. **Just as a tip, New York City has several unique taxes attached to hotel fees. When booking make sure you are looking at your after tax amount, not your before tax. In my case, taxes were roughly $30 per person. Room: The room size fit two comfortably. It is large compared to other Midtown hotels in the same price range. The room was clean, plenty of towels that were changed daily, in room safe, good water pressure in the shower, and no bedbugs. Elevators also were not a problem. The longest wait was around 5 minutes. Complimentary continental breakfast: Located on the second floor. They offered danishes, bread, bangles, yogurt, fruit, coffee, and juice. The area was always kept clean and the food's mentioned above were plentiful. Location: Fantastic location in the middle of Midtown which is close to a lot of shopping (5th ave). A subway stop is also located a short walk on 6th ave. 32nd street has only one lane of traffic, so it is much more quiet than other streets. Our room was on the 7th floor and we did not hear a sound. Check out: Went smoothly as well, we held out bags at the hotel until 4:00pm without a problem. The staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: SparklingDiam0nd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NYMA hotel with a friend for a week in September and was really pleased. It's in a great location, on a buzzing street a short walk from Penn Station, Times Square and the Empire State Building, but there was no traffic noise once in the room and we slept really well every night. The room and ensuite were a decent size (I had read horror stories of box rooms but no need to worry here) and very clean, and they had everything we needed for our stay. The free wi-fi in the hotel was a great 'extra' and came in very useful when planning days out, as was the buffet breakfast. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Highly recommended for a city break with friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “First time in NYC - good choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: hippychick62
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late, but better late than never :-) I stayed at the NYMA Hotel for 5 nights in May with my daughter, the trip to New York was for her 21st birthday. I spent an age on my laptop trying to find a hotel as I had heard so many horror stories about pokey little places where you can't swing a cat. I happened upon this hotel and after looking at reviews etc booked it. It was a good choice. First plus was the view, I had contacted the hotel before arriving to say we were coming for my daughters 21st and could we have a room with a view of the Empire State Building. We were not disappointed as what a view, we were on the 13th floor with the empire state building outside our bedroom window. The room was also very nice, much more spacious than I expected in New York and the bed was very comfortable. You couldn't open the window, but then you can't in a lot of hotels and yes the air conditioning unit was a little noisy, but not unbearable. Knowing that New York is a 24 hours a day city, I had brought ear plugs and slept really well as did my daughter. The position is brilliant. Macy's around the corner (3 hours in shoe department with my daughter, but thats another story!) subway stations close by, 10 min walk to Times Square and as the hotel in in the middle of the Korean district, lots of lovely restaurants on the doorstep offering amazing food. The hotel offers breakfast which was very welcome. It was quite basic, but more than adequate with bagels, donuts, cereal etc and tea and coffee. We did go to a traditional diner one morning as my daughter wanted pancakes with bacon and syrup, but the other days stayed at the hotel. I do intend visiting New York again next year and would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: tilt00
Reviews.Content: Because we tried to find a NYC hotel as reasonable as possible, I was concerned this one would be a dive. But to my delight, the nyma has rooms larger than most in NYC; a breakfast that is upgraded from the usual; a Cappuccino machine 24/7; a helpful, friendly, concerned reception staff; clean rooms, great location right near Penn Station and it was quiet. Next time I am in NYC, I won’t shop around, I’m going to the nyma!

Reviews.Title: “they are identity theft”
Reviews.Author: true88
Reviews.Content: this NYMA really has problem, my friends check in by used their VISA card n when they back to their country, the bank statement shown some online shopping transaction records. My friends never shop anything online in the States. So everyone, be careful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: dikthegeeza
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th time staying at the Red Roof Manhatten (now nyma) and have never had a problem. It's basic but you have all the things you need in the room for your stay. The location is the best part as you are over the street from the Empire State Building, Subway and Penn Station down the street, Macy's around the corner and 10 minute walk from Time's Square. The hotel has been refurbished since my last visit 3 years ago and looks very nice inside. The breakfast area (bagels, coffee, juice etc.) is on the 2nd floor and gives you a good kickstart in the morning before you work day or sight seeing. The street the hotel is located on is called Little Korea and has many Korean restaurants and is quite safe. I have never had a problem walking around Manhatten even at night. The highlight of the stay had to be the Yankees game where the Yankees beat the Red Sox. Great day out and was my 5th Yankees game and my first at the new stadium. There are loads of other things to do and see of course but too many to list here. If you would like to know more, please contact me. Can't wait to go back again and would definately stay at this hotel again.. My favourite city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: deerjeff
Reviews.Content: Needed a place on short notice, the rates were good and other reviews as well. The hotel is on a narrow street in Korea town which was a plus especially if you like sushi. They payed for half our parking in a Central Park Garage less then a block up the street and also offered a very nice continental breakfast.Tha staff was pleasent and the property clean. We had a king size be but the room was "very small". Overall it was above average, not necessarly very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a relatively good price (for Manhattan).”
Reviews.Author: MarkStef
Reviews.Content: The New York Manhattan has pretty much everything you need at a relatively less expensive cost than most hotels in Manhattan. My wife and I spent 6 nights here in May 2011. The hotel is just around the corner from the Empire State Building. It is within a block of the yellow subway line and just a couple of blocks away from the green line. Macy's is just a couple of blocks away, as is Madison Square Gardens and Times Square is about a 10 minute walk. Our room was clean and quiet and breakfast is included. The breakfast room is a little small but there is a good variety of food and you are able to take the food to go. Hotels in Midtown Manhattan are expensive and nyma is a great option in a great location at more affordable price. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills ... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SailAway53
Reviews.Content: For first time visitors to NYC, the area could be intimidating. Trash is put on the street to collect, but that is common in the city. The location, however, is perfect for a tourist since it is pretty much smack in the middle of New York City. Don't count on the offered concierge service for much information ... the answer to a couple from the UK about how to get to Penn Station was a "it's over there" and a wave of the hand. Do your research using the lobby computers. The rooms are small ... good for two people, but plan on doing a dodge/weave/bump to get by each other with three or four in the room. Do not accept a room on the second floor if possible. The breakfast room is on this floor and I witnessed one man in his pajamas at the front desk complaining about the noise level just a few feet from the door of his room. The A/C units are loud and the windows do not open, so bring earplugs if you are a lite sleeper. Staff in this hotel could use a little training in friendliness. They tend to be very curt and a bit dismissive and the man working the breakfast room was downright rude. Overall, NYMA is a good tourist hotel. If you need a large room, stay elsewhere. Stay here for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience, I am coming back”
Reviews.Author: Ellen B
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of this hotel before, but a friend recommended it. I was staying by myself and visiting friends in NYC. GREAT location, subways are just two short blocks away in either direction, excellent restaurants within walking distance. Rooms very clean, bathrooms up to date, free internet, continental breakfast more extensive than most. Good sized closet and drawers to store clothes. Friendly staff. They have an arrangment with a parking garage in the same block for discounted overnight parking which was great for me. Got a great rate, am coming back in January with my husband. Hint: for best rate for this hotel, go to www.redroof.com, which is the corporate parent of this property. On a very busy commerical street known as "Korea Way" with lots of Korean restaurants. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great price in a great location with clean rooms. All of your basics are covered, and then some!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: momsheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with 2 kids, so by the time I showered and realized that the bathtub was backed up, as was the bathrm sink, it was impossible to switch rooms. Kids were sleeping soundly. Disgusting. I paid up front upon checking in, in good faith, but they refused to give me a refund of any kind upon checkout, even though I argued the point. All they offered me was a "late checkout" which we could not use, as we had to catch a plane. So they offered to hold our bags for the day, post-checkout, a service they provide anyhow. Ridiculous. Then, to top it off, they ASSURED me that NO MONEY would be deducted from my credit card for the deposit. It was. And it screwed my trip up. They are seriously lacking in the customer service department. You get what you pay for. The rates seem great, but keep this review in mind when booking! FYI, location is not great either. Tiny rooms. Dirty area of town. If I ever go back to nyc, I will be staying at Trump Tower.

Reviews.Title: “In the thick of it!”
Reviews.Author: Scottishlady1962
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in NYC and stayed at the NYMA hotel on 32nd Street. The hotel is in a great location just round the corner from Macys, Empire State Building, and easy access to everything. Hotel is well priced, clean, comfortable, some rooms very spacious, price includes an extended continental style buffet breakfast with two rooms of seating, bags are securely taken care of until departure, Wifi and two computers in reception area free of charge. Would recommend this hotel to young and old travellers and definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: giddyTipperary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner in march, we were nervous of the room size due to some reviews here but found it very reasonable and adequate. Fantastic location coupled with helpful staff and a breakfast included in the package, made our stay enjoyable and comfortable. We stayed for four nights on the fourteenth floor, water pressure for the showers was excellent at this level and no noise from the street and the big plus was the view of the Empire state building from the requested room. only drawback was the waiting time for the elevators, but what would you expect when every building is the height of a mountain

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne1956
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at NYMA for 9 nights in June after reading the reviews and we were very pleased with our decision. We requested and got a room with a view of the Empire State building, which was great even though you had to crane your neck a bit at the window! We also requested a fridge and microwave - but used the fridge only. The bed was very comfortable and the room was a good size for New York standards. We changed rooms after the first night as we were right next to the lifts and it was too noisy (rooms ending in 01). This request was no problem at all for the friendly and helpful reception staff. There are only 2 lifts and they are quite slow. Breakfast was included in the rate (we booked directly on their website), and it was more than sufficient to start the day. A real bonus to get breakfast included in Manhattan! The location was excellent for sight-seeing, and a bus-stop for the hop-on hop-off bus tour was just around the corner. Subway and Penn station were 5-8 minute walk away, as well as Macy's and JC Penny. It was an excellent choice to stay there considering the price paid and the excellent location, plus you get breakfast also. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMysteryCustomer
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 3 nights in April 2011 and was a little disappointed. The hotel decor and rooms seem dated and a little tired and the colour scheme made everything seem dark and a bit dreary. Having said that, the room was clean and reasonably well equipped. Breakfast was a let down. We went on day one and it was awful so didn't bother for the remainder of the holiday. It was like a free for all in a transport cafe! As a result we ended up eating out for the rest of our stay. On the plus side, the hotel is in an excellent location literally a block from the Empire State - we had a view of it from our room. The staff were also very helpful, the safe in our room didn't work and we were therefore able to use a lockbox in reception whilst it was fixed. Not ideal, but good service in the circumstances. In short, a good location and service but the staff are let down a little by the actual hotel itself

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: lucy1038
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this property, I previously reviewed in 2007 but visited it again earlier this year. I was very impressed with it the first time I stayed there but it has been completely renovated and it is even better now! The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. The bathrooms have been completely re done and are beautiful. We had a superior room which had a fridge and microwave which was handy for storing water etc. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is basic but as it is free it does the job. The major plus of this hotel is the very budget friendly prices, especially for manhattan, and its great location at Herald Square. I never stay anywhere else when I'm in NYC and I don't intend to in the future! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Paz I
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, in a GREAT location (short walk from times square, right above a subway station) and the room were clean and pleasent as well. The fact that it's situated smack in the center of Korea town is really no bother at all as long as you keep the windows shut and just use the AC. Breakfest was average but well enough.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in mid-town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: john33br
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NYMA from Sept. 7 thru 12, 2011, and was very impressed. The hotel is located on W. 32nd at Fifth Avenue in mid-town Manhattan and there is a subway stop right down the street. The location could not be better. Check-in was quick and professional even though I arrived a few hours ahead of schedule. My room on the 13th floor was clean and pleasant. The view of the Empire State Building (which is one block away) is impressive. The room is small, but is larger than most rooms in Manhattan in this price range. The AC was fine. The bathroom was very clean and water pressure was very good for showers, plenty of hot water. Housekeeping did an excellent job during my stay. One good thing, they did not start knocking on the door at 8AM rushing me out (that is a pet peeve of mine). The only two negatives I can think of are the continental breakfast, which was just toast and stale bagels, and the horribly slow elevators which take forever. There are tons of street vendors and other options available for breakfast so take advantage of those. The mezzanine area has juice and soft drinks available and is a pleasant place to take a quiet break after being out in the city. There is also a CVS pharmacy right across the street where you can purchase bottled water and snacks to keep in the room. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms and this is somewhat inconvenient. However, overall, this is a great choice at a great price in the horribly over-priced Manhattan hotel market. I will absolutely stay at NYMA next time I am in NYC and highly recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JayKay90
Reviews.Content: Four of us - two adults and two children, 15 and 13 - stayed here in August. It met our expectations based on what we read in previous reviews . The room was typically small but comfortable to return to after a long day of touring around. Whether you are travelling by taxi, subway or walking it is in a good location for getting to most of the major attractions. Despite a couple of relatively minor annoyances, namely the breakfast experience (small and crowded), and the elevator delays, we would go back. That said, we would look around first for a better alternative in the same bracket. One bonus for us was the proximity to Penn Station. After checking out we walked there in a few minutes to catch our train.

Reviews.Title: “Old Standby”
Reviews.Author: D_Roamer
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good. Air conditioning can be quirky (they are "centrally controlled"). This used to be my "go to" hotel in Manhattan, when it was the Red Roof Inn. Even then, redeeming my points was clunky (lots of black out dates, need to use two vouchers, etc.) For some reason, they changed their name (although you can still reserve at the Red Roof website). I was told by Red Roof operators that I can still get Red Roof points and to just let them know at the desk. When I asked at check in, I was told I had to submit my receipt to Red Roof to get the points. Now I just shop around for the best rates when staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xmailsa
Reviews.Content: Great location, wounderfull service and nice and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: emily_h_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 7, 2011 for 3 nights in a double room on 6th floor. The checkin process was easy and quick. The bellman helped us with our bags from the curb to our room. The room was clean and the bathroom was stocked with fresh clean towels, soap, and shampoos. The room has a desk and a flat screen TV. It is pretty small. Just enough space for one person to walk from one end to another. But it is NYC. It does have a closet to keep clothes and suitcase in. Breakfast was included. It is pretty basic, bagels, pastries, yogurt, and fruits... but it is decent enough. There is a lounge where you can hangout and watch TV. Pretty well decorated. It even has coffee and hot chocolate machine. The location is pretty good as well, right in the middle of Korea Town, one block from the Empire State Building and only a few blocks from Times Square. It is a short walk from Penn Station. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice: perfect location, great service, nice decor, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: VanCityG
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 4 girlfriends in June for 5 nights. It was an excellent stay with no complaints. The price was amazingly cheap for NYC and the location and service couldn't have been better. I highly recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel,centre of the Universe”
Reviews.Author: averagejoeGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Clean,tidy ,no nonsense budget hotel.Slap ,bang in the middle of Manhattan's Koreatown.I took my son there for his 21st and we both would return anytime.The Empire State building,2 blocks away,seemed touchable from our bedroom window. Myriad choice of Asian restaurants everywhere you looked,everyone we tried was superb and reasonably priced,relatively speaking.I would not recommend it for any one looking for a quiet trip,as the locale is extremely busy 24/7,but it is NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, super value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AdoreMyHols
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time looking for a hotel for our stay in NYC. I picked this one as it was a reasonable price in a central location and had free wifi, complimentary breakfast and a fridge and microwave in the room. We thoroughily enjoyed our stay and it met all of our expecations and more. The bed was very comfy and there was a flat screen tv. We also had a view of the Empire State Building from our window! The breakfast was good quality and there was plenty to choose from. Best of all the hotel is a short walk from Times Square. Walk one way along the street from the hotel and you're near Macy's, walk the other way and you're on 5th Avenue. The hotel is also a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building. FANTASTIC LOCATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop worrying and book!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQUKEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great in its price range, and probably exceeds it. We had a deluxe king size and the room was great. the bed was fabulous, the bathroom excellent, the shower superb. All in all we were not disappointed at all. the staff were very helpful, especially the cleaning staff and the breakfast was more than adequate. Its not the Astoria, and neither is the price. Once you get your head round that, you will love it. it was so close to everything, including Times Square, Empire, 5th Avenue shopping, central park, Broadway amongst everything else. Everyone was very friendly and nice to us. We did an open top bus, which is very worth while, we had a horse and carriage thru central park which was lovely and a helicopter tour. Fab! This place was recommended to us by a friend, and we forward that recommendation to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Wabos
Reviews.Content: We found this to be an excellent value. After reading numerous reviews online we were expecting much smaller rooms than we received and we found this one to be plenty spacious for the little time we spent in the room. The staff was courteous and attentive. The breakfast buffet plentiful (cold foods only!) with extended hours (0630-1000). We had no problems with the speed of the elevators as some have mentioned. The FREE WI-FI worked great and they readily accommodate your luggage for early arrivals and if you want to catch a few more sights after checkout but before your flight. If we are ever in NYC again we will certainly include NYMA in our plans.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Rivonia
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (kids aged 3 and 6) stayed for a week. It was good value for money and had everything you needed. It is a little tired but is very very clean. It's a perfect budget option for NYC. If I were to return to NYC, I would probably stay closer to Central park, we spent a lot of time traveling uptown to see museums, broadway shows, children's zoo etc but you might like the location of Nyma literally around the corner from the Empire State building.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the reservation system!”
Reviews.Author: ElleBee100
Reviews.Content: Beware that using the "cancel reservation" link at the bottom of the web site for this hotel apparently doesn't actually "cancel your reservation", even if you have received a confirmation email from them. In spite of canceling my recent reservation a few weeks in advance (well within the cancelation policy), I was charged a "no show" one-night fee. After being passed back and forth by phone between the front desk and the reservation staff for the hotel chain, they are refusing to remove the charge. Will never make another reservation at this hotel or chain, and will never recommend them. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Copenhagen123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the website it was booked on (Red Roof Inn) gave a lower price than other hotels in the area. The website didn't specify the age of the child, and upon check-in, was told that a child over 13 must pay an additional $15/day. A little misleading, I think. The room had a very strong mildew odor, we ended up buying our own air freshener. If you're shy, this is not the hotel for you! The bathroom door is clear glass. What is up with that? We figured out if you kept the light off, you'd have some sense of privacy. Continental breakfast was adequate- instant hot cereal, assorted cold cereals, yogurt, pastries, bagels. The location is "Little Korea," and is 10 streets plus 3 avenues away from Grand Central Station (20 min walk). Very good restaurant on this street is Haru Hana -beautifully presented Japanese cuisine. French Bakery next door to hotel, also very good. Elevators were a bit slow. Front desk people perfunctory at best, not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for value and location”
Reviews.Author: NickyOm
Reviews.Content: I found myself returning to Manhattan a month after a trip in which I stayed at the La Quinta hotel across the street from Nyma. I loved La Quinta but unfortunately it was booked up for the first 5 days of our trip so I booked at the Nyma for 5 nights. This is a very nice hotel in a great location. For more details about the street and location, see my May 14th 2011 review for La Quinta Manhattan. La Quinta and Nyma and three other hotels close by are all owned by the same company (Apple Core Hotels) and have similar offerings. We had a room with two doubles; it was a bit cramped for the four of us, but not tiny. I wanted two Queens but they didn't have any. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Also very quiet, probably because we didn't have a street-view room; no view at all. The air conditioning worked well and the hallway was positively arctic (which I liked in the middle of a summer). There was adequate hot water in the shower, although the shower curtain rod was loose and needed repair and the towels seemed a little skimpy and not very soft. Also, no grab bars in the bath/shower and no bathroom vent/fan. Large flatscreen TV with good picture and plenty of channels. No problem with the wifi for our laptops except the night when reception went out for the whole hotel, and even across the street at La Quinta. But I was surprised there was no in-room complimentary pens, paper, etc. and also no bed-side table with drawers - not very helpful. The in-room safe is big enough for lap-tops and locks and unlocks with your own credit card which is super-convenient. The complementary breakfast was well-stocked, although the layout is dumb with all the cups for drinks stuck back in the corner which causes a big and unnecessary bottleneck. Amarjit, (I think that's his name - an excellent breakfast staff-person!) did what he could to create a more rational set-up but on days he wasn't assigned to this room, it was back to difficult access and waiting to get a cup. The breakfast is identical to La Quinta's. It is very good I think - bagels and cream cheese, toast, donuts, pastries, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, hot hard boiled eggs, coffee, tea, real orange and apple juice, and apples and bananas. It can get crowded especially toward the end of the breakfast hours. There is an overflow room with a couple tables and lots of counter space. I found this room had more effective air-conditioning. We enjoyed our stay here very much, but even though the nightly rate was more expensive than at La Quinta we got only double beds, not queen-size beds like at La Quinta. Also, Nyma's two free huge-screen computers and the printer are right there in the front lobby. I felt very exposed using them. The lobby itself is not a warm or inviting place - lots of polished surfaces and functional seating - not great for meeting people. La Quinta has much nicer and more comfortable lobby seating, and a TV. Looking at the website after I came back, it seems that there is a mezzanine lounge which I totally didn't know about. Another Tripadvisor reviewer says there are hidden stairs to this level, which is above the front desk. If they have it, they should let people know with decent signage! So overall, I was happy with this hotel, but I have a preference for across the street at La Quinta. Nyma gave only a 5% AARP discount while La Quinta gave a generous 10% discount - which over a long stay makes a difference, and La Quinta's daily rates were a little better anyway. But for location and value, I can easily recommend this hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “One time experience”
Reviews.Author: Red_Flashpacker
Reviews.Content: To begin with the street outside is very dirty and has bad smell. In the room, I didn't like the noisy air conditioned and the uncomfortable bed and pillows. I also think that bed sheets need to be replaced more often. But the real bad thing is the staff. They are extremely unfriendly and have bad manners. The front desk staff simple doesn’t care about the guests needs. This really was one time experience. You will never see me again at nyma.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, adequate price.”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: I would really recommend this hotel since I needed to book at last time and was a little worried about the quality I was going to see. Getting there - very close to the 34st herald square metro station. Lobby- lobby is small but very nice and clean. Concierge - they even have a concierge table. Room - very pretty and clean room. Really liked it. Breakfast - continental breakfast lacked of some food i am used to but it was good. Overall - i would stay here any time again for sure. Location, price and quality was good. I could see the empire state from my room.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: drjoe38
Reviews.Content: midtown location, no long lines, quiet, nice folks, Korean food Nirvanna, small room but fine

Reviews.Title: “Great location& nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: buketi
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay in this hotel. The entrance area is clean and welcoming. The staff was helpful and polite. (especially the lady in the reception when we checked-in 10th of july in the evening) The location is great! in korean street which was always crowded and we really felt safe. It's also a few min. walk to penn station. You can easily walk to times square, and madison square park. subway is just few steps away. The room was clean, with a view of Empire State Building. The bed was comfortable. It was a little bit small and the air conditioning was noisy though it was not really a problem for us, because you don't spent much time in the room in manhattan. Nice breakfast with fresh fruit, bagels, donut...I would definitely stay in this hotel if i come back to manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and adequate location”
Reviews.Author: Slymie85
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to visit NYC for the first time and have a budget, I recommend this hotel. The location was perfect if you're looking to tour all of Manhatten. If I do visit Manhatten again, and IF I can afford it I would spend an additional amount for a more prestigous hotel. But none the less, I would stay here again. Our room was quiet, I had a good night sleep each night. The room was spacious enough for what we needed, it included a flat screen tv, a desk, a lough chair, and a drawer. The front desk gave us a courtesy call after our first night to ensure everything was going well. The continental breakfast was adequate (basic continental breakfast you'd find at a comfort inn) and included a variety of options including cereal, donuts/bagels, boiled eggs, and yogurt. Location was great! if you forget toiletries or in need of snacks or beer, a grocery store is located a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: agulvin
Reviews.Content: While travelling from ME to NC we decided it would be a nice surprise to make a quick stop in NYC to take our daughter to MMOA for her 16th birthday. Random luck (and a great rate) put us at the Manhattan. Not being very familiar with the city I was unsure about staying in the Times Square district. What a great surprise! The hotel was nice - clean and comfortable. Best of all it was in a great location, centrally located and very safe. Getting to the museum couldn't have been easier - just a short walk and a quick bus ride. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for a great place to stay in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OakuraSue1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with friends for five days. Could not fault it. We picked this hotel for the price and location. was not disappointed. Right behind the Empire State building. walked to all major attractions. Value for money. Rooms are not large but big enough. Very clean and beds are really comfortable. Would recommend and would stay again if i return. Shopping and restuarants all around. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Everything looks good but...”
Reviews.Author: Aquasky2878
Reviews.Content: The review i'm posting is not about the place, or the cleanliness, or the service...actually i didnt have any problem with all these at all...The review is about the huge amount of money they blocked from my debit card during my stay (almost 1/2 more, from my total charges). Even after 4 weeks from my check out, the amount is still blocked although the manager of the hotel emailed me that it would be updated to my account a week ago...Anyway the hotel is not mentioning it anywhere and all international tourist should be very carefull. This proccess should have been mentioned by the hotel staff from the first day you book in order to help customers estimate their financial needs...

Reviews.Title: “First Time in NYC Hotel pick a Winner”
Reviews.Author: mikenco
Reviews.Content: My sister,my daughter and I went for the first time to NYC for my daughters 12th birthday.After a long search for the right hotel at the right price,we chose Nyma. We arrived at 12 noon,and to our surprise,they checked us in immediately ! Lobby area is small,but adequate,with helpful staff and concierge.Elevators smallish as was the room,but it was just enough space for the 3 of us.It was clean,with comfortable beds,and adequate cont.breakfast in the a.m. . Korea town area is safe,and bustling,but we never heard a peep at night in our room. Subway locations at end of street and very close to Macy's,and the Empire State Bldg.Mostly chain restaurants nearby,but several Korean choices on street.Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “As RRI it was good, now as NYMA it's even BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: DCTim
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel numerous tiimes when is was a Red Roof Inn because of the value and always enjoyed it. Now as NYMA it's gotten better, and still a great value. The lobby has been completely refurbished (very fresh and upscale), and they've added two Mac workstations for complimentary use, plus free WiFi in the rooms. Breakfast opens earlier now (How many NYC hotels offer free continental breakfast?! That's common in Europe, but not so much here, in my experience.) Location is excellent - literally in the shadow of the Empire State Building. The rooms in front offer a view of the ESB, but at a cost of street noise below. If you want quiet, ask for a room in the rear; mine was there this time, and while I missed the view, I slept like a baby. Three blocks from Penn Station, one from the subway, three to Macy's flagship store on 34th Street, steps away from 5th Ave. Also, discounted parking down the block ($26/day - another terrific value for NYC). Hotel staff was very pleasant and accommodating; I brought my bike with me and they cheerfully offered to store it in the baggage room and retreived it for me throughout my stay whenever I wanted to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the $ & Location”
Reviews.Author: MadhatterFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NYMA June 15 - 17. Needed a hotel relatively close to the Garment District that wouldn't break the bank. Decent sized rooms, nice people at the front desk. Not fancy, but worked. Its in Koreatown, so there are restaurants and bars up and down the block that stay open most of the night with reasonable prices . . . some are admittedly only for Koreans, but for the most part, they are all fine. Make sure you have your parking ticket stamped for the discount. Would saty again, great value for the $!

Reviews.Title: “Great For My Time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JerryofMPLS
Reviews.Content: Check In was smooth and issue free. The 9th floor room was perfectly clean and even had a view of the Empire State Building. By being just a couple of blocks from Penn Station, it is easy to use public transportation, plus there is much within walking distance. I took the train in from Newark Airport and the subway/train combo to JFK for departure. The breakfast is fine for hotel buffets -- good variety and well supplied. Its not fancy, but you are not paying for fancy. It is served on the 2nd floor and adjoining rooms might be a bit noisy because of it. The elevators were slow at times, as I expected from other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: BlackOnyx333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location that was central to everything and close to subway lines. The service in the hotel was fantastic, not one unfriendly employee. The room was comfortable and surprisingly quiet (we were on the 10th floor at the back). Very clean, no complaints here.The elevators are extremely slow however, so do expect to wait for these. The breakfast is a great add on, but be sure to get there early as it does get busy and elevators get full travelling up and down to there. 8ish and earlier is best. Mainly all dry food (toast, bagels, cereal) but good enough to get you started on your day. Some fruit (bananas, apples) as well as yogurt and some pastries were available as well. They were working on installing the business centre when we were leaving but allowed us to use the business centre at a neighbouring family hotel, which was good to know but we only found out after we inquired about the business centre from reading it in their room guide. Also free wi-fi was an added bonus and the signal was great. Great experience, would stay here again. Great value for the money, especially since it included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: smoke8
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at Nyma (formerly Red Roof Inn); you won't find better value in manhattan; great location, clean rooms, above average breakfast, friendly support staff, pleasant greeting, renovated front desk....it's no longer a hidden gem as savvy travellers have caught on (it was sol out the weekend of may 20) - only downside was ventillaion issue as some rooms do not permit the windows to be opened - bit overall a cant miss hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: joshlyn99
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits in the center of Korea Town. Its just a few blocks away from the train, the fashion district and Madison Square Garden. The staff was friendly and ready to accomodate my request. Our room was clean and quiet. The concierge was very knowledgable and ready to assist. The continental breakfast was good (Bagels, toast, boiled eggs, cereal, milk, juice, yogurt) and the area was kept cleaned. The staff was always present replenshing food/supplies. You can't go wrong for the price, the location and the service.

Reviews.Title: “BARGAIN! we're coming back”
Reviews.Author: pennypoopoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location was in the heart of Korea Town? i think it is, and short walk to the closest station and to MACY'S. CLOSE TO EVERYWHERE! and we got an awesome view of the empire state building from our bedroom window. It was clean and definitely value for money (residing in Melbourne). The only down side is we're moved twice until we found a room with wi-fi because we were relying on wi-fi and some rooms didn't get any service from their wi-fi. (it could be our device's strength?) It was also nice to be greeted very warmly by the cleaners all the time, reception was not that approachable, they seemed irritated that we wanted to move rooms because we didn't get wi-fi. OVERALL: love the hotel, every hotel has it's flaws and flaws are inevitable, some are acceptable some are unacceptable in every aspect. This hotel did it's job in good standards. will be making this our go-to hotel every time we stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler01010
Reviews.Content: this hotel should not be considered a "discount" hotel, as it offers everything you would expect in a full-priced hotel! lovely, very clean, very comfortable rooms with new beds and linens; very helpful staff; and close to everything. great for a trip with friends, family or for a couple. the included breakfast was also great. overall, just a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hote l& affordable”
Reviews.Author: KateH18
Reviews.Content: Spent one night with friends, small room, staff was helpful, beds were comfortable...short walk to shopping, short cab ride to time square. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: fredparesque
Reviews.Content: Our first time in NY, it couldn't be better! Great location (metro in the corner), in the shadow of Empire State. The room (11th floor) is large, silent, clean and comfy ( King Deluxe) with microwave, refrigerator, coffe maker, free wireless... Excellent breakfast with fruits, juices, cereals, bagels. The staff were very helpful. Remember to ask concierge a transfer from/to JFK, it's the best choice. So, our stay was very nice and we will come back to Nyma, certainly!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 5starbudgetguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days over a weekend just last week. I was here before about 4 years ago and liked the place so I wanted to try it again. I found the front desk staff pleasant, but not overly friendly. Who cares? It's the room I care about not the front desk staff (everyone has a bad day, isn't alway 'on', etc). The room was clean, well appointed and a decent size for New York (probably as big as most normal people's bedrooms). No it's not the Four Seasons but it's a nice room and I had asked for a non-smoking room with a coffee maker, microwave and small fridge and got it. As soon as I got in I checked for bedbugs. There were none. The mattress is entirely wrapped in a fitted sheet (top and bottom). It was very comfortable. There are also blackout blinds on the windows to stop the light from coming in. Here are my really nitpicky comments which could make this hotel even better than it already is. Breakfast was great with lots of options (fruit, cereal, toast, pastries, coffee, etc) but the coffee was really weak. When I complained to an employee he said it was fresh and then took off to talk to a friend for 20 minutes. I ended up buying one next door. The clock radio does not charge an iPhone, but does an iPod, since the clock radio is an old version of the iHome clock radio. I had to pull out the night table to access the receptacle to charge my phone as I slept (and to use it as my wake-up alarm). They should have a more accessible receptacle beside the bed (or one in the base of the lamp as some do), but most hotels don't. The light at the desk is way to dim for doing any reading. The bathroom should have a fan. One has to keep the door open so it does not fill up with steam, which was okay because I was staying there alone, but might not be if you are sharing the room with someone. The gym/fitness centre is very poor as all they have is treadmills and elliptical trainers. But, you can easily get aerobic exercise by walking or running outside. They need a few sets of free weights and a couple benches as you can do every strength exercise known to man with free weights. I had to pay to go to a gym in NYC (not cheap!) to exercise which I shouldn't have had to. The location is great and there are tons of restaurants in the area including a great pastry shop right next door. There's also a wonderful little Korean handmade dumpling resto/take out a few doors east. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, reasonable price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HwanIsHere
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Koreatown, this hotel can be easily missed but is worth seeking out. Our room (2 standard beds in a smoking room) was tiny but otherwise comfortable. There was a clog in our bathtub drain but it was attended to after we mentioned it to the front desk. Two other quibbles -- the heating/AC unit was noisy, but that didn't affect us as the temperature was already comfortable. And the bathroom didn't have an exhaust fan. Also the elevator was pretty busy so there were a few long waits, especially during the breakfast hours. Speaking of which, the breakfast was decent -- cereal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, toast, oatmeal etc. On the plus side, the HDTV was a good size, internet (wifi + cable) worked well, staff were friendly. Note: It's easy to miss the lounge (which was invaluable for us while we waited for the bus), which sits above the front desk area, the stairs for which are hidden to the side.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in New York!”
Reviews.Author: mom53
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC where my adult daughter and I spent 4 days seeing the sights and visiting my son (who lives in Brooklyn). We spent 4 nights at the NYMA. Couldn't have been more pleased with our choice of a hotel. The lobby is under a little construction, but that didn't bother us. We arrived after a "red eye" flight at about 9 a.m. and stopped by to drop off luggage--but lady at the desk said the room is ready--we can check you in now! Fabulous. The room was spotless, 2 double beds (comfy) and very quiet (12th floor might have something to do with that). The free breakfast is enough to get you through the morning--fruit, yogart, bagals, juice, toast, cereal, milk, hardboiled eggs, all served in a nice little room on the 2nd floor that always had a table available. The hotel is a few steps away from the Harold Square subway stop from which can catch 6 or more different trains. All of this for $170 a night (through Hotel.com) which a quite a bargain for a nice, clean hotel in midtown (with breakfast!). The absolute only complaint is they need a fan in the bathroom--it gets a little hot and misty in there, but we just cracked the door. . . .Really, a wonderful place to stay for a wonderful price. Free Wi-Fi was also helpful so we could use the laptop to look up hours and adresses of the next days activities. Next vist--I'm not even shopping around--I'll be going here!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: hennypenny10
Reviews.Content: The room was small, as expected, but very clean and pretty quiet. The beds were fairly comfy, but the pillows were like bricks. Don't expect much from breakfast, there are not any hot items, just bread, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, and yogurt. There is coffee, tea, and juice, as well, but only during breakfast. The service was sub-par. There is no business center, so if you have to print out boarding passes, forget it. Also, the staff did not give us any directions to our room or make any mention of the fact that there was a bar or fitness center. Housekeeping was good, however, they often only gave us 1 fresh towel to replace the 2 that they took away. Overall it was a good home base, but next time I would stay somewhere different. There is a fantastic Parisian bakery right next door, Paris Baguette, with delicious pastries and deserts. The subway entrance is at the end of the street and the hotel is an easy walk to Herald Square (Macy's) and the Empire State building.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel, outstanding value!”
Reviews.Author: Pustilnik
Reviews.Content: At booking I have requested a refrigerator, microwave and a street view window. All my requests were granted. On top of that, the room also had a coffee maker machine. The hotel is very clean, all hotel personnel were extremely pleasant and polite. Breakfast was good with a selection of pastry, breads etc. The location is located strategically, 10 minutes walk from Penn Station. Twenty minutes walk from Times Square. Great location and very quiet hotel. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the apple's centre”
Reviews.Author: julieBarnsley
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from an amazing holiday in the big apple. this hotel is just a few blocks away from times square, and empire state building. The room is large, bright, very clean and the bed is just so comfy (a blessing when you have done 9 hours of walking). The breakfast is continental, but has a good varity of things to eat. The paper plates and cups might not be to everyones taste but the food makes up for that. The staff at the hotel are very nice and helpful.just one tip if you have booked on line make sure you print off the discount vouchers as the staff require these, they seem to be very important to them. We hadnt been sent these but all was resolved the next day. There is a beautiful pastry shop next door if you want it. The hotel is going through some renovations at the moment BUT this doesnt spoil the hotel at all. We would definately go back. Added bonus the view of the empire state building out of your bedroom window.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and value!”
Reviews.Author: BBBtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location; close to Empire State Building, a few minutes walk away from the nearest subway and surrounded by restaurants and newsagents. Additionally, I felt it was in a safe area and was comfortable walking back to the hotel late at night by myself. The people at the front desk were fairly friendly and after checking out they were happy to let us leave our bags there and collect them later on in the day. Room was small, as expected, but clean. Didn't hear much noise coming from the street which was good and our view from the window was just of another building. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel, if I remember correctly, is that they only have ice machines and vending machines on every other floor which is slightly annoying if you're on a floor without one! Great value for money considering the price of other New York hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Polite,Friendly Staff, Good Location, A Nice Little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: obiwuz
Reviews.Content: A well run, good little hotel with a great location (walking distance of the Empire State!). A nice complimentary continental breakfast served between 7 - 10AM. Get there early as the room is quite small and fills up quick. The rooms are clean and tidy and are adequitly kitted out. 32in LCD TV with cable, comfy beds and an alarm clock which you can use to play and charge your ipod. Plus free WiFi to boot. Lifts can get a little tedious when busy, for example it'll go past your floor and pick you up on the way down. Apart from that we cant honestly say anything negative. If you find yourself on a short trip to NYC, Business or pleasure try and get in there. You can do a hell of a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: lakecitytraveler
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC last weekend for a girls trip. We found the hotel exceeded our expectations with what we were charged for the room. The hotel is really nice and in a good location. The subway is at the end of the block. I felt safe walking from the subway at night and the street is kept really clean. At night it was quiet in our room that faced the street and is amazing considering we were in the middle of Manhattan. They also have free continental breakfast which is unusual in the city at hotels at this price range. It is within walking distance to Macy's and the Empire State Building. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone that is planning a visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ally2244
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic and perfect for someone who is going to do all the tourist things in Manhattan. Its in a fantastic location as it's only a few blocks away from Macy's and other shopping centres, Empire State Building and Penn Station for the subway. I travelled with my friend to which we both were quite green at the whole experience and really did not know what to expect for the price we paid, but we were pleasantly surprised and relieved at the quality & location of the hotel we chose. We stayed over New Years and again, the price we paid we thought it was fantastic as other hotels were quite unaffordable for us. Would recommend this hotel to anyone as it made our trip easy and worry free.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: hotelshopper13
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel, i returned home with bed bug bites! Hotel manager is rude and should be fired (Shafiq). Hotel use to be called Red Roof, seriously pay more to stay in a hotel that you are safe and clean in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and it will be even greater after the face lift !”
Reviews.Author: Sophietje
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 6 nights at the NYMA hotel, we had a King size room on te 15th floor with view on the Empire State. The room was big enough and clean. The hotel is ideally located, just 2 blocks from the Empire State, near the Library and Bryant Park, a walk away from Times Square. The rate is economical and I would recommend this hotel to everybody. Breakfast isn't that special but it's what you can expect in every american breakfast area. Great find ! When we were leaving we saw the the hotel will be undergoing a facelift within some months so I guess prices will go up....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: katealexUK
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to New York on business for 10 years, this hotel has become a home from home for me whilst away from the UK. The staff are incredibly efficient and friendly and though the rooms are simply furnished they are roomy with King sized beds, very clean and best of all very reasonably priced! If you request a room at the front of the hotel all you can see is the Empire State Building two blocks away.... a great New York view if visiting, even for regulars like me. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: tbk4200
Reviews.Content: I had researched various places to stay for the New Year holiday, and found nyma to be the most economical. Check-in was wonderful - I requested a lower floor, and was given a third floor room, away from the street. Very quiet all weekend. The front desk also accommodated our request for a room with a refrigerator, without problem. The room itself was a typical NYC room in terms of space - not much extra, but certainly acceptable. The bed itself seemed to be memory foam, and was very firm and comfortable. The cleaning staff were very friendly, and responded quickly to our request for extra towels. The breakfast was solid - excellent, fresh bagels, fresh donuts, and drinks. There are a variety of restaurants in the immediate area, and the nearest subway is a block up on 32 street - very convenient. We may make this an annual trip to NYC, and intend to stay here again. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID”
Reviews.Author: DavidBenjaminC
Reviews.Content: AVOID AVOID AVOID There was homeless people crashed in my hallway. 3 of them. When I complained to security they said they do rounds and that there were no homeless people and that I was lying. I have pictures of them, it was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome facility, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: GVWStonegate
Reviews.Content: We are pleased to report that on our recent trip to NYC the New York Manhattan Hotel on 6w, 32nd street proved to be a worthwhile investment. The facility was immaculately clean and well cared for, the staff most curteous and helpful. Everyone was accomodating and a pleasure to speak to at all times. The location is superb, centrally located to absolutely everything. seconds to a subway, bus outside the door, but most importantly walking distance to all the central attractions. For those who have been to NYC numerous times as us, it is closer to all the Chelsea, Gramercy and Murray Hill districts. Amazing Korean foods outside the door and of course, right off 5th ave. What more could you want?! Great rates and flexibility if needed. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be stranded/snowbound!”
Reviews.Author: rbr0wn
Reviews.Content: We took a "spur of the moment" trip to NYC for Christmas and ended up staying a week at this hotel due to the blizzard on 12/26. It's not fancy, but the location is perfect for tourists - Empire State Building is right around the corner and Times Square is a quick subway ride away. Macy's is practically across the street and there are lots of inexpensive places to eat nearby. I stay in this general area every year and really like it. It can get too crowded at times, but I like being close to the subway, sights, shopping, etc. This hotel is on 32nd Street which is also known as Koreatown. There are numerous Korean restaurants, bars, grocery stores, etc and lots of young people at night. I have always felt very safe and comfortable in this area so I would also recommend it for women traveling alone. We had a non-smoking king with a small refrigerator and microwave. Room was very clean and comfortable and faced the street. There's quite a bit of noise at night and in the early morning due to the restaurants and bars lining the street, but I love the city and had no problem with it. My husband is a light sleeper and complained a bit, so keep this in mind when staying here. There is free wi-fi and it worked well. I was able to stream Netflix videos without any problems. If you need to check email or print anything, there is a computer in the lobby, but you have to pay to use it. You can print boarding passes for free, but that's it. The rate was unbelievably economical during Christmas - just $139 a night! We ended up staying through New Years and it went up to $259, but still very reasonable for NYC. Only small issue was the heating system. You can't control the temperature from your room and it can get pretty warm. Overall, this is a great value if you're visiting the city and don't want to spend too much. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC, excellent base”
Reviews.Author: FutureNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, I couldn’t actually believe we were looking into the Empire State Building from our bedroom. Rooms were clean and for a base is great, which is generally what you need when staying in New York. The breakfast has a good selection, the only thing I would mention is the room where breakfast is served is very small so if the hotel is full and you hit it at the wrong time it can be a bit hectic.
