One particular day there were so many people all trying to fight for tables, hot tea being spilt with people pushing and shoving so wasn’t the best. Having said that if you are just looking to grab something quick and get out it serves its purpose but if you are looking for a nice breakfast/chat over coffee to start your day you are probably better off heading out. I did notice some people taking plates back to their room due to not being able to get a table, although I am not sure if this is encouraged. On the whole we found the hotel good value for money, great for location and clean. If you are just looking for somewhere to base yourself it is perfect but if you want something a bit special you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations with professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Hopi_FL
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned (Dec 23,2010)from our first trip to NYC. Prior to our trip I had searched the internet for hotel accomodations and actually booked a stay at another hotel. While surfing the internet for NYC events, etc. I ran across reviews for New York Manhatten Hotel and was impressed by the fact that managemnet actually took the time to not only read the reviews but to also respond to the reviews. That was impressive. I looked at many, many hotels online and read hundreds of reviews but had never seen any hotel respond to anything written about them, until NYMA. Because the reviews were so positive and management so attentive I canceled my prior booking at another hotel and booked a room directly through the NYMA website. After I booked our room, I sent an email to NYMA explaining I was bringing my daughter to NYC for her 21st birthday and asked if we could possibly have a room with a view of the Empire State Building. I was told they would do what they could to provide such a room. We arrived at NYMA and were greeted by a very pleasant staff at the front desk. When we arrived to our room I was very impressed that the staff and management had gone above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay a comfortable one. I was in tears at their compassion and caring.We looked out the window and just as we had requested there stood the Empire State Building! The room was very clean with modern amentities such as LG flat screen TV, free WIFI, free phone calls, free breakfast, great closet,and you could choose to be green by requsting your sheets not be changed everyday. We could not have asked for more. The beds were comfortable, the room had plenty of space for the two of us, the halls were quiet at night. Location was awesome, walking distance to everything! We were in NYC for 5 days and we will return to this hotel when we are lucky enough to return to NYC. Kudos to NYMA!

Reviews.Title: “Refused to give a refund because flight to New York was cancelled”
Reviews.Author: traveller446446
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel as soon as i had news that flights to new york were cancelled. Refused to issue a refund and i had to pay when i am not even in New York. When trying to talk to the staff or manager, they hang up to me before i could finish my sentence. Never seen such rude staff before in my life. Thanks to this hotel my Christmas/New year mood is ruined. I am sure any other hotels in New York is better. Very unreasonable and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: dgarbacki
Reviews.Content: I was just one of the many people who were stranded in NYC during the December blizzard of 2010. After trying to book several different hotels, a bell clerk at The Pennsylvania Hotel told us about this hotel. It is ideally located about two blocks from Penn Station right in Little Korea. It was a really great find. The hotel was clean, reasonably priced, the staff very friendly, and the room was equipped with an iHome Ipod Dock and a flat screen LG TV. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all of my friends and to anyone who is looking to stay in the city for a night or even a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Reasonable Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LJG78
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel since it was quite reasonable, but I had read some good reviews. It actually came as a lovely surprise. The room, although not gianormous could easily fit in the following without being cramped - king sized bed, fridge, microwave, flat screen tv, desk, chest of drawers, 2 bedside tables - also had a cupboard with ironing board and of course the ensuite. We even got a view of something - okay so only a nice looking building over the street, but it beats a standard brick wall! The room was also quiet - a huge bonus! My husband claimed out of the 4 hotels on this trip that the bed was the most comfortable - no complaints from me either. There is also a complimentary breakfast - bagels, toast, cereal, yoghurt, apples and bananas, tea, coffee, juices. I noticed that a lot of people would grab and go since the breakfast room does get a little crowded between 9 and 10 (it closes at 10), but we never had a problem getting room for 2. There is also a small fitness centre, but since most people don't seem to use it no real problems getting space and it has enough to keep you 'ticking along!' The travel desk was also very useful and friendly too! The only complaints I would have had is more coffee supplies - we never ran out, but if you need more than 2 cups a day you'd need to buy extra supplies or just go up to Starbucks (or better still the Korean coffee shop up the road). Location - 2 blocks from the Empire State Building and close to Times Square. Close to the subway also and if, like us, you're happy strolling it really doesn't take long to get to Central Park and even a stroll downtown - we walked back from the Statue of Liberty ferry terminal back up through Little Italy etc - you get to see more! All in all I would recommend this hotel and would come to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamUK0
Reviews.Content: Firstly what the hell is Sales Tax? City Tax? Occupancy Tax? Javits Convention Fee? All this was added to my bill when we checked out? I stayed in this hotel with my daughter and granddaughter and to say I was disappointed is an understatement. On checking in the lobby is nothing like website portrays it to be and the first room we were in smelled of onion rings and we had a view of a roof. I went to reception and asked to be moved and gave my reasons why and the receptionist thought it was funny. The second room had a slightly better view but the room smelled even worse, this time of curry and very bad body odour, when I told reception this she said she would get housekeeping to sort it out. On returning to our room later that evening nothing had been done if anything, it smelled even worse. As time went on we realised it was the carpets that smell so badly. Then the hairdryer didn't work! Breakfast was a battle with the other guests as the breakfast room was no bigger than one of the bedrooms and there wasn't much selection either! The lifts were a nightmare, with 18 floors and 171 rooms that isn't good. Often only one lift was working and at a snails pace plus the cleaning staff use them which doesn't help. One of the days housekeeping didn't even bother to make our beds they only replaced the towels in the bathroom and most days we caught housekeeping watching the TV's in the rooms! The rooms are very cold during the night and the bedding is inadequate, you can't call a sheet and a throw on the beds "bedding". On our last day the car service arrived to take us to the hotel and the concierge tried to put the wrong baggage in the car and he didn't pick up everything out of reception so that when we got to Newark International we found one of the bags was missing which had my mother Christmas present, a photo of my granddaughter taken at Macy's with Father Christmas and my granddaughters hat, gloves and blanket. Of course when we phoned the hotel they didn't find the bag and claimed they spoke to the driver who said it wasn't it the boot of the car but how would he know when he was still driving. Never will I stay at this hotel again, it was a very unpleasant experience and has left a very bad taste in our mouths and left my granddaughter in tears that her "Dora" blanket disappeared!! I'm sure management will have some pathetic excuse as to how all this wasn't the hotel's fault and that the staff are constantly trained to keep up with changing times.... NOT GOOD ENOUGH!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: popcrnluvr
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, excellent location. Slow elevator is the only problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Schiller83
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't about fancy lobbies or luxurious rooms. However, if you put value in location and will spend most of your time outside of the hotel this sure is a hit for the relatively low cost. The hotel is very centrally situated in the midst of Korea Town, don't get scared, this is a small enclave that is just a few metres away from Empire State Building, Macy's, Time Square and Madison Square Garden. The rooms aren't large, but they do the trick if you unpack smartly. We lived at the highest floor (17th) and the shower beam was the weakest we've ever experienced. So if you book, make sure to stay in the lower/mid part of the building. From what we have heard, this is common in high buildings in New York. The breakfast and internet is included, very good value indeed! The breakfast isn't fancy or anything, but again, it'll start your day pretty well with the limited (but well tasting) options. We couldn't find any eggs, maybe the hotel management should change that.

Reviews.Title: “affordable hotel in NYC - much better than expected and nice staff too”
Reviews.Author: rawaspecial
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NYMA for 3 nights. Booked via phone for 2 people in one room with 2 beds and mentioned I am AAA member. Res. agent told me to show AAA card at check-in and deduction would be made from the rate only then - if card was not shown at check-in they cannot honor it later. Upon checking in the rate shown to me was higher, so I mentioned I am AAA member and showed my card. The check-in agent explained that this was the AAA rate already and no further discounts so I discussed with her that this was not what the res agent had said! Finally she said ok and gave me the agreed rate & discount! I was pleasantly surprised as I had read in previous reviews that staff was not too friendly or accomodating! The room was a good size and clean - I have seen much smaller rooms in NYC ie. years ago the Milford Plaza - rooms like a shoebox! Also the bathroom was a good size and had a bathtub and showerhead. We had the A/C on for a short time once and it worked fine. Too bad though that windows cannot be opened (in any NYC hotel I think). There was not too much noise - the occasional siren and noise from upstairs guests but we both slept very well! Breakfast was continental, nothing fancy but just right for us - if you like eggs, bacon etc. this is not for you! The breakfast room door was closed at 10am sharp but you could still enter from another side door around the corner, help yourself to some food & drink and sit in the other room. We also booked a taxi to return to JFK and it worked out fine - the young lady at the desk was very nice & helpful re prices, times etc. The cleaning lady on our floor was also very friendly. The hotel has imho a very good location - I walked (alone) to and from Times Square after midnight and felt safe! Also for shopping closeby go to Duffy's, Macy's etc. There was only one negative thing that some have already mentioned: due to the many restaurants on the street, a lot of garbage is left in huge piles before each restaurant before garbage pick up next day - I imagine in the summer this must generate an awful smell! Considering everything, I would stay at the NYMA again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JodyBelle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at nyma October 4-7. We flew into Newark, took the train from the airport to Penn Station, and walked two blocks to the hotel. Check-in was handled efficiently. The room was large enough for two or three adults (we had a king bed) without feeling cramped at all. I am very particular about places I stay, and the hotel met my criteria for lodging--safe and convenient location, must include breakfast, have an in-room safe, and be a reasonable price. A staff member was always at the front door. We were also given a late checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: JC279
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof INN aka NYMH last week because they had pretty good rates online .The Location was not bad and the rooms were pretty good for the price. I have to say though that my last day there , 100 dollars was stolen out of my bag in my room . Luckily, the rest of my money was in the safe. I went down and told the front desk as soon as i realized it was gone and they seemed not to be concerned whatsoever. That was the final straw because along with that situation, the few times that i went down to ask the front desk a simple question such as location of something etc They were not pleasant and made it seem as if i was bothering them. The other complaint is that the elevators are unbelievably slow for the volume of people they have going in and out of them . Not to mention that the maintenance and cleaning staff use the 2 of them also which slows them down even more . Also, in the morning for the free breakfast, there are so many people trying to jam into the room and into the nearby elevators that it is quite the cluster. I travel very frequently for work and have rarely complained about a hotel . I would stay in this hotel again , but not with the staff they have operating it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...Great Value....Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: shamy08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location being 5-10 minute walk from Times Square. Less than 5 minutes to Empire State Building, Macy's, Herald Square and a lot of shopping. Subway station within 2 minute walk. We had booked a Non-Smoking Superior King Room with Fridge and Microwave. Upon check-in, front desk staff said our room was held, however, when we arrived in our room it was a Queen Bed with no fridge or microwave. Upon reporting this to the front desk staff she said "not all rooms have a fridge and microwave". They were able to move us to a Superior King Room with Fridge and Microwave as booked, however, it was on a smoking floor. Rooms were clean and modern and in pretty good condition. Complimentary Breakfast of Cereal, Bagels, Toast, Fruit, Coffee and Juice was convenient. Be sure to get there early as the Breakfast Room gets crowded.

Reviews.Title: “RIPPED OFF!”
Reviews.Author: rickwriter
Reviews.Content: BEWARE this hotel! i booked 13 nights at $152 (after AAA discount). upon checkout, they conveniently increased my nightly rate from $152 to $190 for the last three nights! this was not something i either saw or agreed to - obviously. and it was not a weekend rate hike or anything like that. they're slimy people - DON'T STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: ree472
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel's direct line at about 8pm looking to make a last-minute booking for a friend with small children who was arriving in New York City that same night in transit to another city. I was quoted a rate of $139+tax. I went over the terms twice with the receptionist and everything was made clear. There was still a chance that my friend would be able to make a late-evening airline connection that would make the hotel stay unnecessary. The receptionist, a friendly-sounding young woman, said that the hotel had plenty of room that night and that although she was leaving soon, it would be no problem to wait a bit, I could call back or my friend could even just walk in. I called back not fifteen minutes later, wanting to finalize the booking. A man had come on shift. He seemed to know about my earlier call, although I might have misunderstood him. He quoted me $155+tax for the same room, same configuration. I protested that I had been quoted $139 on the previous call, honest and fair square. He said “Yes, she can tell you anything she wants but that was then and now I am in charge here.” I said I wasn't very happy. Then he offered me $147+tax. I said no and called the La Quinta across the street and got a room for $139+tax. The hotel business is tough, and I am used to bargaining and making quick commitments, but these tactics crossed the line as far as I am concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Odojoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at NYMA. Perhaps due to late booking, the best rate we could get was the $185 AAA rate. The hotel is centrally located, literally in the shadow of the Empire State Building. We were on a road trip so we drove into Manhattan. The traffic was not as bad as Washington DC. I was expecting the worst. The hotel has a deal with a garage on the corner for a 24 hour rate of $26. Not bad for the location. Breakfast was always busy, but there was always a couple seats. There was toast, bagels, cereal, yogurt, donuts, and juice as well as coffee. We walked everywhere except for one trip down to the Battery. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for exploring Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: WaterMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights in blazing hot NYC and would definitely book it again. Very clean, nicely redone, decent size for NYC. Tucked into Korea Town, expect lots of people and vehicles on the street at all hours--but with no bother to you if you have the A/C going. Our room faced 32nd street with the Empire State Building towering over us and we rarely heard noise of any kind. We walked from Penn Station when we arrived and found the short walks to the two closest Subway lines made the location great for exploring the island. The staff was fine, though we're pretty low-maintenance anyway. The elevator was usually pretty quick, but the two elevators serviced a number of floors so you just have to be patient. The breakfast was bare bones but did the trick. Again, it's about expectations. (A bagel with cheese and something to drink gets me through 'til lunch.) Lots of Asian restaurants along the street. Easy access to shopping at Manhattan Mall down the street, Macy's on 34th, etc. We stayed in a King room and were promised a fridge, but that never materialized. But oh well. We were just glad for the A/C that got nice and cold. Bed was soft but not too soft for my finicky back. For the exit from NYC, we booked a car downstairs with the concierge. Cost us $40 or so, but was worth it for the convenience. If you're looking to spend about $150/night, stay here. We'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mjparaguay
Reviews.Content: For the money and location, you can't beat it. Plus, for at least the room I stayed in, the mattresses were MEMORY FOAM! I couldn't believe how well I slept. No street noise, no nonsense at the front desk, helpful bellhop and concierge, and GREAT PRICE! Would choose this hotel again and again if it stays the same way it is.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but price changes when your plans change”
Reviews.Author: rbdglj
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We booked it because we got a very good price for a 2 night stay (only about $350 for the two nights). But then our plans changed and we had to leave a day early. We notified the hotel at checkin and the price then went to $240 for the one night which we subsequently negotiated down to $200. It was a friendly negotiation and they did move, so I can't really complain too loudly. I'm sure had we asked ahead of time about their policy on early departures they would have told us, although it would have been nice to have the policy posted on their website. The hotel itself was ok. Adequate rooms, no view even of the street (looked across a light well to an office building). The icemaker on our floor was a bit noisy but we were so tired from having come in on the red eye that it didn't bother us. Breakfast was simple but adequate although a bit cramped and chaotic. Mostly tourists in this hotel, not business travelers, many, probably most from outside the US. Elevators ran pretty slowly especially at breakfast time when everyone was going up or down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for budget seekers”
Reviews.Author: mom1982
Reviews.Content: My 11-yr old daughter and I stayed for a week in a Deluxe King, husband joined for weekend; avg. rate was about $175/day plus taxes, with AAA discount. We upgraded at the last minute from "superior" to "deluxe" to get a bigger room which included microwave and fridge. We found the room to be spacious by NYC standards. We fit a cot in the room when we needed it and it still did not feel cramped to us. We've stayed at up-scale hotels elsewhere but this fit our budget for NYC. There were some minor things I would have changed, but overall, we were extremely satisfied and would recommend highly to other travelers. The location, really, could not be better!!! Located in Korea Town (1 block stretch of W32nd St.) with welcoming lights strung above the street. Proximity to subways (all lines are 1-2 blocks away), Herald Square for shopping, Empire State Building, and walking distance to Times Square (we walked there every night for the fun of it and to see a show). The entire area felt safe at all hours for my daughter and me. "Korea Way" is filled with restaurants and eateries so on garbage pick-up nights, the piles of bags of garbage on the sidewalks can seem intimidating. We were prepared for this based on the reviews in tripadvisor so it did not bother us at all. Details of the room (the good and the bad): Room was very clean; bathroom was modern and spotless (no mildew or off-odors). Furniture and decor of room were not special but they were fine. We had plenty of room to walk around bed, etc. We were surprised how nice it was - simple but nice! Bed was very comfortable (memory foam?) and we slept well every night. Sheets, blanket and bedspread were thin but adequate. The 5 pillows in the room were all a bit strange (not down or fluffy poly - more granular!), but we didn't notice when we went to sleep. Excellent room soundproofing. We were on the side of the building so the view was not great. A/C worked but adjustment was weird - maybe just our room. We needed to call the front desk to have A/C adjusted up or down; there was no working thermostat control in the room. We were in NY in summer with 90 degree days so a/c was essential. Short on amenities - no little bottle of hair conditioner.:-) Hotel did not have any, but CVS was right across the street. Instead of real glasses, a stack of individually wrapped plastic cups was provided in the bathroom. We bought bottled water so we didn't have to drink chlorinated tap water. Deluxe room has fridge and microwave which came in handy with restaurant leftovers! 32" flat-screen great for occasional tv viewing. Two cordless telephones were more than enough. Desk, bureau, and closet were spacious. The two nightstands had fake drawer fronts (real drawers would have been handy). Plenty of lights in the room to control. Loved the adjustable reading lamps -- a very nice unexpected touch. Iron and board were supplied in the closet. Rolling desk chair and upholstered arm chair completed the furniture in room. Door to bathroom is patterned etched glass so lacked privacy! Lobby is very plain but neat and clean. Elevators were slow and small, but not a problem for us. We used the fire exit stairs if we were in a hurry -- good option if you don't mind passing some bagged trash at the ground level (fire exits do not lead to lobby but go to sidewalk directly). Might be a little gross but if you're in a hurry.... Free, ample continental breakfast was available but we preferred alternatives outside. Business center - I needed to use it to access internet one evening. Computer is located in balcony off lobby; $3 minimum buys 15 minutes. No problems encountered. I was never able to access the free hotel wifi on my iPhone but used 3G network instead. Maybe if I had a laptop, the wifi would have been fine. The doorman was fabulous, helpful, and very friendly! Outside the hotel: We went to the Empire State Building after midnight on the first night we arrived --because we could and it was just around the corner -- the view was spectacular; NO LINES and we felt we had the place to ourselves. The staff was super friendly because there weren't crowds to manage. Cheap postcards and souvenirs - 40 postcards for $1; I Love NY t-shirts ($1 kid size, 3 for $10 adult), just to the right at the corner at 5th Ave. Food - Korean BBQ - we really enjoyed bibimbap at Miss Korea next door to the hotel (excellent food, friendly service, reasonable prices). Don't miss the "frogurt" dessert across the street at Pink Berry - delicious fruit flavored frozen yogurt with fresh fruit toppings! The lines were long but the treat was worth it! In Times Square, check out the delicious choices at the gelato cart in front of Sbarro restaurant (we had refreshing coconut gelato). Do not miss Chinatown Ice Cream Factory - gentle, exotic flavors your mouth will thank you for - try lychee, red bean, "dan tat" (custard - yummy!). All in all, an amazing trip to NYC that we will never forget. Because of NYMA's excellent location, we could go anywhere very conveniently -- especially the nightly walks to Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “It's just a hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: shieri55
Reviews.Content: It used to be Red Roof Inn and we got this reservation through Red Roof Inn's website. I thought it would still meet the standard of the Red Roof Inn, or better. Well, the decore got changed a little better in a sense but still cheap and fake. The room was so tiny, though I know it could not help considering it is in Manhattan. It still has Free WiFi but the first night we lost our two hours getting help from tech-support only to fail to get us a signal. I booked a room with a microwave and a fridge but now after new company taking over they made business king rooms "some come with them but some don't". We got the one without them for the first night. It is in Korean Town and stinks with sewage and garbage, though for Korean restaurant go-ers it would be heaven. What made us dissapointed most, though, was the attitude of the front desk. Not quite helpful, with no smile no applogy for the inconvenience they caused for us to lose two hours of our time over WiFi and having to move because we didn't get what we have reserved for the first night. One of the agent even looked at us like we were wrong. One night, we called them from outside seeking help of getting direction to a certain restaurant becuase we couldn't find it where we thought it was, and the answer was "no, I don't have the address". We know hotels in Manhattan are expensive, so we wouldn't expect too much for this hotel with the room rate less than $200 in the middle of Manhattan, but employees' attitude does not have to be cheap.

Reviews.Title: “great value, good quality clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: lauren28Sydney
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 4 nights in a queen room. excellent room. not huge rooms but definitely big enough for one person! if you're going to be spending most of the day in your hotel then you might want a bigger room but if you're out sighseeing and only spending part of your time there then its more than sufficient. staff very helpful. good location. clean rooms. good location, close to subway. in the next block from the empire state building. the street the hotel is on is also known as Korea way, in Korean town. lots of korean restaurants on the street. while i was there the street was very smelly, maybe a problem with sewerage? it rained on the second last day and the smell was gone after that. they were also doing road work while i was there so that may have had something to do with the smell? great internet connection. very comfortable stay. i would definitely stay there again! they did manage to add a lot of taxes onto the original price but this might just be New York. overall an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value and location.”
Reviews.Author: keleivis
Reviews.Content: We received an excellent AAA rate of $147 for the NYMA in July (booked through Red Roof a couple of months in advance). The room was small but clean and quiet with an excellent mattress on the bed. We stayed four nights and had an excellent sleep each night. Compared to a previous stay in NYC where we paid more and didn't receive these basic necessities, we were quite thankful for finding the NYMA. There must have been a shortage of facecloths in the hotel, as we had to call down for some each day after the room was made up, but these came up promptly. A small fridge would have been nice in the room to hold a few beers or restaurant leftovers. The location on 32nd St near 5th Ave was excellent. Exactly 2 blocks south of the Empire State building, we could look up and see its summit from our bedroom window. The subway at Herald Square was a block west and for shoppers, Macy's New York, JC Penney and the garment district are right there. We purchased a 7-day MetroCard ($27)for unlimited access to NY subways and buses and often used the Park Ave and 5th Ave buses to get uptown to the museums and galleries. We also recommend buying the CityPass for $79 (http://www.citypass.com/new-york) if you have time to take in more than a couple of attractions. Breakfast of cereals, breads, fruit was included but the breakfast room was small, noisy and frenetic. If you need protein to start your day, go to Herald Square where you will find the Martinique restaurant for a traditional sit-down breakfast. Or you can buy buffet selections by the pound at Speedy's Deli or Macy's lower level. We would stay at the NYMA again on future visits to NYC, if we were able to secure similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “THE BIGGEST LITTLE SURPRISE”
Reviews.Author: bossnana
Reviews.Content: found this hotel to be clean, comfortable and has the most pleasant staff i have encounted since i began traveling to new york 5 years ago. many great places to each and shop. romm was small but extremely pleasant and just about perfect for a short stay. will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alastair1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the nyma and had a superb time. The hotel was clean, the room was well kept and new, the staff was friendly and helpful, the free breakfast was fresh and replenished frequently. The hotel has an excellent location - 15 minute walk to Times Square and 20 minute walk to Grand Central. We didn't stop the whole time we were in New York and the hotel simply made everything easier and more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location, rooms - will be returning on my next stay”
Reviews.Author: canadian_shamrock17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the July 4th weekend 2010, during my first visit to New York. Read great reviews here, and for the price (@ 159 a night), I couldn't find a better deal. Things to note: Location: - Located walking distance from Empire State Building, Madison Square Gardens, Penn Station (you can walk from your hotel to the station and visa versa if you take the subway from the aiport. Very economical!!) Also a subway station (34th Hearld Square) a block away that will link you to the rest of the city if you're tired from walking. - Located in Korea Town. This was a con for me. If you are sensitive to smells, you may want to reconsider this location. Although NO smell from the street whatsoever enters the hotel - restaurants from the street lay out their garbage each morning on the sidewalks and let it sit in the 100 degree heat all day until collection at night. Walking to a from the hotel was quite smelly and dirty. This is the only drawback to location. Rooms - We had a king size bed. We wanted a double room, but they were all sold out. All the could do was give us a king bed and charge us an extra 20 dollars a night for a cot. The king size ended up being large enough for two people to spread out and not even touch, so it worked out in the end. - NO BED BUGS. Thankfully, as other hotels in the area were being closed at the time for infestations. Very clean. Hotel staff did a great job cleaning and restocking the rooms - although you have to make it very clear if you want bottles or garbage removed. If we left them on night stands they were left, but when we put them together next to the TV, they were removed. - Air conditioning worked perfectly. I didn't find it too loud at all. Actually, it quite nicely drowned out the sounds of honking and sirens from the street below and slamming doors from other guests in the morning. These are the only sounds I managed to hear, but I had a great sleep, and I am a very light sleeper, so this is saying a lot :) Breakfast: - Very basic, but to be expected from a continental breakfast. Toast, bagels, oatmeal, yogourt, apples and bananas, coffee and juice. Never changed, same every day, but much needed sustinence for travelling and did the job. Available from 7 - 10 am. Closes exactly at 10 am, so make sure you get there at least bt 9:55 because they will lock the doors, but not kick you out of the dining area. Service: - Hit or miss. One lady was very helpful, and another gentlemen not helpful at all. For example, one night we needed a corkscrew for a bottle of wine. The gentleman at the front desk just looked at us blankly, then shook his head no. We thought, considering they have a bar (closed temporarily), they would have one. The next day we asked the lady, and she said abosolutely, we'll send one right up and you can keep it for the rest of your stay. It appeared at our door within minutes. Later, when we needed forks and knifes, the same gentleman denied us again. When we made a bit of a polite fuss, and ended up having a whole set nearby, which he thend lended to us. Overall though, the staff were helpful. WIFI - Just a note - wifi DOES NOT WORK anywhere in this hotel. At least on my smartphone. I could connect, but the signal was poor or fair in our room (which I requested to be wifi accessible). Even when I tried in the lobby, my phone could not connect. There is a paid internet computer in the bar which accepted my money, but would not connect. Luckily though, the concierge refunded my money and told us to go across the road to the business centre at La Quinta Inn (also owned by red roof) and use the free internet there. This worked, but was quite a hassle to go back and forth across the road to use the internet. Also points of interest: - Elevator is incredibly slow - if you're not too high up or don't mind the exercise, use the stairs. - Subway is incredibly confusing (and I'm from a big city myself) - grab a map from the concierge before using, or you may end up horribly lost as we did. Overall the hotel was a perfect place in terms of location, price, and quality for 2 young girls on a budget. Would definitely stay again, and recommend to any friend visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter24
Reviews.Content: Love, loved, loved it. have stayed here twice and LOVE IT! Its sooo close to all the shops and time sq is just a few blocks away. small rooms but who cares when your in NYC because you just wanna sleep and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: gymgirlkc
Reviews.Content: Decent price for a room with 2 dbl beds in Manhattan. Check in was very easy (we even checked in about 2 hrs early). a/c wasn't working, but the desk sent maintenance up right away. room was small, but clean. flat panel tv, and wireless connection. complimentary breakfast was good...yogurt, fruit, bagels, toast, cereals, oatmeal, donuts, muffins, apple juice, orange juice, coffee, tea. hotel staff was friendly and polite. they held our bags at checkout, since our train was not departing for about 3 hrs after check out time. 2 blocks from Penn Station, 2 blocks from Metro stop. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: cathleenmarie
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were going to New York to see a show, visit museums and stay one night--but we did not want to break the bank on a hotel. We reserved a room with two double beds for $244 (that price includes tax). The hotel is located in the heart of Korea Town--complete with festive lights strung across 32nd Street. It is a bustling kind of dirty street, a half block off of Fifth Avenue--there are few streets not bustling and dirty in Manhattan. The reception area is nice, clean, and the staff was welcoming, kind and helpful. I asked for a quiet room and was told that all rooms with two double beds are located at the back of the building--the room was quiet indeed. I did not avail myself of the amenities, but there were many including free WiFi, breakfast, a fitness room (cannot vouch for it) and free calling in the US (I like that). The room was small but perfect for two friends traveling together. There was a gap and bedside table between the beds, and the other side of each was against a wall. There was a dresser, desk and flat screen TV (never turned it on). There was a clock radio that allowed the docking of a Nano. The bathroom was small but adequate--small vanity but good water pressure in the shower. There were plenty of towels and the toiletries included two each of shampoo, lotion, bath soap and face soap. Several small quibbles: the pillows were harder than I would like. I love a feather pillow but know this is a personal preference, my husband loves a hard foam pillow of this sort. We could hear conversations in the hallway--so if someone was telling friends or relatives good night you could hear every word--made me sympathize with the two rooms adjacent to the elevator, and lower my voice while waiting there. There is a Starbucks around the corner. The subway was around three blocks which was perfect for zipping up to the Metropolitan and the Frick. I personally prefer more luxury and space but have absolutely no complaints considering the excellent price and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, relatively low-cost”
Reviews.Author: Lior4NYC
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and I needed a convenient place to sleep for 1 night in Manhattan. Red Roof Inn Manhattan on 32nd street just off 5th Avenue is great choice and recomanded wormly. The room was $171 ($200 with tax) which is not bad for NYC. Location is great, very close to 34th street and many trains. There are many restaurants on 32nd street and they open until very late at night. The hotel has free WiFi and wired Internet, and free basic breakfast (coffee, pastries, cereals, etc';. nothing fancy). The rooms are fine and clean, and I was able to sleep well even though I got a room facing the front (32nd street) on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay, good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: luuluu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my daughter to celebrate her college graduation. $151 AAA rate for a good sized room with a king bed, microwave & fridge, large closet, in-room coffeemaker. I was surprised by how quiet our room was - brought earplugs along since I'm a light sleeper but never had to use them. Free continental breakfast is what you'd expect - yogurt, bananas, donuts, cereal, coffee, juice - but enough to get you going. Close to subway, CVS pharmacy across the street, Starbucks & Jamba Juice around the corner - you're good to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for leisure traveler”
Reviews.Author: GT3T
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here with my sister, a former New Yorker who also praised it. The lobby is very pleasant, with porter and tourist staff. Our room was good-sized for Manhattan, the bedding was comfortable, and the bathroom was new and quite attractive. It includes wifi or a wired connection, plus continental breakfast. It's two blocks from the Empire State Bldg., and one block from the 32nd St. entrance to the Herald Square subway stop, which makes it easy to get almost anywhere in the city. It's surrounded by Korean barbecue restaurants, but we had a great dinner at Cho Dang Gol, a country-style Korean restaurant on 35th. This Red Roof is one of the five Apple Core Hotels, and on that website, they sometimes offer discounts. I booked our April stay in March and saved 25% by prepaying in full; with that, the cost per night was $135+taxes. Prices are higher for late spring and summer.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ROD67
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel! Ive stayed in NY six times in the last two years and this is my favorite hotel. Everything is clean and works well. Perfect location for the leisure traveler. The front desk staff and the bartender we had (Alex) are super friendly. Alex helped us find a specific establishment and even got us free cover. Thanks guys, Ill be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Family NYC trip! Stay here if....”
Reviews.Author: WIfuntraveler
Reviews.Content: ...you're on a budget and are want bang for your buck. So cheap, clean, quiet ,beds and rooms are nice, (we were in room away from elevator) staff was nice. I gave only 3 stars for room because of size but hey! We're family and you shouldn't be in your room in NYC! I (mom) traveled with 10,15,19 yr old and grandparents. Breakfast was basic . Excellent location if you're coming in on Train- 2.5 blocks from Penn Station. Close to 5th ave.Interesting Korean neighborhood-I mean that in a good way! WE felt safe and Korean BBQ's resturants are great. Empire building is right around the corner.And if you want double -decker tour bus, a stop is there too. We did that and it was fun. Some Fast food places too. Cabs are numerous here (unlike Chinatown where we had to wait 40 minutes for a empty one at a busy intersection in the afternoon?) We cabbbed to broadway play, took cab back to hotel - got the kids and caught cab back to Times Square at 10:30pm and shopped. I was amazed at how NYC'ers love their city. TIP:NYC gift shops by hotel, on 32nd and 5th are cheap. Who ever heard of 40 postcards for $1? ALSO, STATUE of Liberty-GET RESERVE tickets for boat, lines are long. I saw "timed" internet printed tickets flying ahead of me in line...and plan on 5+hrs for Ells island and Statue. We would defintely go again to NYC and stay here. We are a rural Wi. family and had a great city experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent and relatively inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: cooperpd
Reviews.Content: The RRI Manhattan is a terrific place to stay for relatively little money. I've booked this hotel twice via the internet. If you think you need a large room, ask for a double or the accessible king. The rooms are clean and modern. Room 1311 has a king bed, side chair, desk w/chair, dresser, flat panel TV, safe, and internet access. The view is limited to the building roof next door. Continental breakfast - yogurt, pastry, cereal, coffee, tea, juice is included. The breakfast area is small and crowded. The photos on the Red Roof website are accurate. The hotel is in the center of Korea town at the top of the fashion district. Metro stop 34th St - Herald Square station. Times Square and the Theater District is an easy walk. Great Korean Bar-b-que restaurants and karaoke bars. Macys store and Empire State building are 2 blocks. Parking discount ($26 per 24 hrs) for Central Parking at the end of the block.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ManishaBrampton
Reviews.Content: Red Roof Inn is a nice 3 star inn located in the heart of Manhattan. Right on the subway line and friendly staff. It is located in Korean town so lots of food around the hotel and it is easy to hail a cab if you need it. The hotel lets you store your luggage if you have a late night flight even though check out is around noon. The breakfast is included in the price of the hotel...your basics like bagels, cereal, fruit , juice, tea and coffee. Worth it. The rooms were good, TV large screen. I was surprised by the amount of room we had even though they say NYC has small rooms. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: sarajessica
Reviews.Content: some people who work there are very unpleasant people behind the desk- not all of them every time when I stay there something is broken in a room or some things dont work at all this hotel is way too overpriced and theres nothing special about this hotel they are nuts...... location is good but threre are so many hotels around better than red roof inn in Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “GetAcquainted2City”
Reviews.Author: Xplore2Live
Reviews.Content: Superb location - close to all kinds of transportation (Subway/Path/Bus), malls, landmarks(Herald Square, Macys, Empire State, library, Timesquare) and what not of the City. Worth every penny for that alone. Also had complimentary breakfast + coffee in room + oven + fridge. Cannot ask for more than my 15th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: goineverywhere
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean. Staff is not very friendly especially the management. Breakfast is very basic. But for the price it is all worth it. The location is amazing and their prices cannot be beat for downtown NY

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn, Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: synchopat
Reviews.Content: Though it was a little hard to locate for a first-timer to NYC, this is a hotel I'll definitely recommend for any one who wants to check out the city. It's located just 2 streets from the Empire State, along Korean St. So it'd work like a charm for Asians. Good prompt service staff. Unintrusive cleaning staff. Simple breakfast menu, but decent enough. Near subway entrance at W. 34th Street. Walking distance to Broadway, even Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “well priced, clean and no problems”
Reviews.Author: trythisonethen
Reviews.Content: travelled to NY from Australia for the first time. Spent ages researching hotels via the internet and only getting confused more and more. A friend said to try the red roof inn chain of hotels having used them in other parts of the USA. We booked and had a very good experience. They had our online booking on check in, the room was quite big for 3 adult males, the bathroom was big enough and clean. The room was well decked out with a large screen TV, ipod dock and enough space for our several day stay there. We were impressed with the hotels central location, in the heart of Korean town and there was a lovely korean restaurant to dine in just doors away. Everything was in walking distance from our hotel. We didn't have any problems at all and on checking out the bill was in order etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that has no other idea where to stay. The three of us would stay at this hotel and try other hotels in this chain without any hesitation in the future. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than one would expect of a Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: Limulus
Reviews.Content: You know that New York hotels the weekend before Christmas are going to be expensive, but it was our anniversary and I wanted to spend it in NYC. I had a certificate for a free night at a Red Roof, so I decided to give this one a try. The coupon made the average night's cost for my two night's stay a mere $125/ night. ($250 per night was the going rate). The location of the hotel was superb for us. On 33rd Street and 5th Ave, it is literally one block from the Empire State building and a longer block away from Herald Square and Macey's. The subway station at Herald Square is a big one with many lines. The hotel's location on 33rd Street is on a block known as Little Korea, for the multitude of big, small and medium sized Korean restaurants, many open 24 hours. The constant foot traffic gives this block a very safe feeling. We ate at one of the restaurants and enjoyed the Korean BBQ a lot. Our room was small, as is standard in most NYC hotels, but not even close to feeling claustrophobic, just, well... small. Our view included the Empire State Bldg which was lit up in Blue and White lights, for Chanukkah, I guess. The bed was comfortable and the simple bathroom was in good condition and spotlessly clean. The staff was very nice. There is a free complementary breakfast, but during the weekend it is mobbed and we chose to eat outside the hotel. There are too many eating opportunities and not enough time to waste on a skimpy free hotel continental-style breakfast. We're talking Barney Greengrass (see my review) and NY diners for the epitome of NYC breakfasts. Due to a snow storm over Sat night, we thought it might be prudent to extend our stay until Monday. I asked the front desk for a discount for the night and they graciously gave me one. For great location, super clean facilities, friendly service this hotel could have have gotten 5 stars from me, it lost one star for the poor heating control that either when on cooked you, or when turned off became freezing. I had to get up several times each night to either turn the heater on or off. But that being said, I would still stay at this surprisingly nice Red Roof Inn again

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: weharttraveling
Reviews.Content: We had 4 adults staying in 1 room and it was roomy enough for the amount of time we were there. The staff at the hotel was very helpful...they allowed us check out and leave our luggage there while we took in a tour. The parking lot is very close to the hotel..it is on the right side of the street before the hotel, if you circle the block though there is another entrance on the backside of the hotel. The included breakfast was a nice treat..bananas, bagels, toast, yogart, coffe, juices. The location of the hotel was wonderful as well within walking distance to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: The reviews on Trip Advisor were misleading. Koreatown, where the Manhattan Red Roof is located, is an area in dire need of New York City Sanitation Department clean-up! Our room was adequate for a one night stay. However, there was NO heat in the bathroom, as the unit did not work. In the bedroom, a note inside the heating unit informs guests that they must call the front desk if they wish to change the temperature in their room. Needless to say, the unit worked for approximately 10 minutes blowing warm air and then it went to air conditioning. The drapes on the window were stained and in need of cleaning. The bathtub had hair in the drain and the soap dish was mouldy. The Concierge was text messaging when we approached requesting some ideas for restaurants in walking distance of the hotel. Before even asking us what our preference would be, she referred us to a steak house. We shared that we were not meat eaters. Her second recommendation was another steak place. She seemed very indifferent and ultimately gave us the names/addresses of 2 Italian restaurants. We walked approximately 4 blocks to her first suggestion only to learn that the address she provided was incorrect. The continental breakfast was most disappointing. Breakfast is served from 7-10 a.m. Arriving at 9:30 a.m. most of the offerings were depleted. The breakfast room was totally inadequate for over 100 rooms lacking in seating, food and the noise level was equivalent to a high school cafeteria. Considering the front desk shared with us upon check-in that business was off, they should have offered a considerable discount off of the $260 per night they charged. We own and run a successful and travel recommended Bed & Breakfast and feel well versed in the hospitality industry. We will not return nor will we refer anyone to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Combined with AAA, the best value for this great area!”
Reviews.Author: teaspoondee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan and we couldn't have been happier. Our original plan was to stay in Newark and commute into NYC because of the exorbitant city prices, but we found this great deal in Midtown. Only about four blocks from the 34th street Macy's, close to the subway, and walking distance to Broadway shows and Times Square, this hotel is exceptionally clean, convenient, and a great value for grad students looking to have a mini holiday in the city just before Christmas. The Mandoo restaurant a few storefronts down is quite tasty, and the hotel serves a modest complementary breakfast in the morning. The hotel offers a parking discount at a local lot, but since it was full we had to park elsewhere. The other lot wouldn't honor the discount...ouch! Next time we will probably take a bus into the city from upstate. If you a there through the end of January, check out Bryant Park for a darling little skating rink...free admission plus $12 per skate rental and a much smaller crowd than the Rockefeller rink.

Reviews.Title: “Red roof inn - Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Shoto
Reviews.Content: The only drawback is the lift. It is really slow for some odd reason. They should do something about it. Other that that, they have all the basic amenities such as wireless wifi, a mini gym and a relatively spacious room. Mediocre spread of breakfast, but then again the number of cafes and restaurants in NYC will be more than enough to suffice anyway. Location is good ; easily reach by means of subway, and it is just a stone throw to Times square.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzieQirl
Reviews.Content: i am just back from a 5 night stay in new york and stayed in the red roof inn with a large group of friends. i shared a room with 3 of them. bathroom was small enough for 4 girls sharing, but the size of the bedroom was adequate. hotel is spotless and rooms are cleaned on a daily basis. breakfast included-toast, cereal, bagel, juice tea and coffee. location is fantastic-around the corner from macy's and other major shops, broadway in walking distance. all sites close by. subway station two minute walk away. i will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: ned1234
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Room felt new, was very clean (while I'm not the type to worry about a hair in the bathtub or a crack in a tile, I have pretty high standards), and while small, it was larger than I expected for NYC (e.g. plenty of room to walk around the bed). Service was fine, nothing special but no complaints (front desk, breakfast room and housekeeping). Only drawbacks I can think of were some noise from neighboring room (could hear TV but not conversation), the small size of the breakfast room (you may end up sharing a table), and some longish waits for the elevator - both minor points. Very good value (at least for what I paid, of course). If you find a price you like I highly recommend you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in central location good value for New York would use again”
Reviews.Author: Wigbury
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn was a great find we booked it after reading trip advisor reviews and it more than lived dup to our expectations.We stayed there twice inbetween a trip to Boston.The rooms where clean,quiet and spacious,beds very cmfy and bathrooms great with complimentry toiletries and hairdryer.There was an iron, board, i-pod dock and computer access if you needed it..The first room had a view of the Empire State building(floor 15.)When we travelled to Boston and we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel for one dollar per case per day which meant we could travel light.On our return the second room we had was bigger than the first with microwave and full size fridge. Breakfast was complimentary and was more than adequate,you could take breakfast back to your room if you wanted and help yourself to fruit to take out for the day.there was a coffee machine in the room with coffee,sugar and powdered milk and you could take tea,milk and sugar up from breakfast.Staff where helpful with concierge facilities and luggage storage on day of departure.We would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for people on a budget”
Reviews.Author: KonaSeattle
Reviews.Content: I was walking towards the RED ROOF INN on 32st in Manhattan not knowing what to expect...the street was kind of dirty even by Manhattan standards...entered the lobby doors to fine a small but clean lobby..checked in and took one of the slow elevators up to my room..slow doesn't mean bad...just means when you are going to try and go to get coffee or check out on time...plan on leaving your room with plenty of time...the room was good for a solo traveler...a family would be in trouble...the bed was outstanding..the sheet and blanket were good...no static...bathroom fine..except one of your worst nightmares...shower filled with water while you try and get the filth of the city off you..soda machine outside was great because I could get a diet coke for a dollar....I recommend this hotel...my only real problem is a real one..there was a guy "managing" the breakfast that has zero manners and class....he shouted at older people in a way that actually scared people..if I was the manager he would have been fired so fast he wouldn't know what happened...I grew up in NY and I know some people believe NYers are rude...this Ahole is why..he hates his job...hates his life and he is going to make sure everybody who goes to eat there knows it..I was in the middle of trying to pure a cup a coffee and this guy moved the machine away from me so I couldn't fill it....somebody should explain to this guy traveling to NYC is exhausting...when we are trying to get ourselves ready in the morning for a day of trains, subways ,crowds, meetings, etc. we don't need his attitude...in an economy where it may take 4 minutes to fill his job I think they should...

Reviews.Title: “Wow this place is really nice,and at a very fair price!”
Reviews.Author: BoKoCats
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the RRI in NY,NY. The room was small but not TOO small. Nice,modern bathroom,plenty of clean towels,nice hot water. The staff was friendly and efficient. We had a problem with our air conditioning and they fixed it in about 7 min. Our room faced a beautiful building across the street. The neighborhood was busy and full of great restaurants and easy to get to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement Trip”
Reviews.Author: aellenberger
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn was a great central location for my future husband and I to stay. Located in the center of Manhattan, the central location made it easy for us to go to all the touristic sights. The hotel itself was not, in our opinion, a 5 star hotel by any means; however, it served its purpose for the convient aspect of it. We would recommend The Red Roof Inn for people who do not want to spend a lot of money on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a visit to New York. I am from NY and went back to visit some friends and family. Part of our stay was at the Red Roof Inn, Manhattan. Upon arriving at the Red Roof Inn, we were pleasantly surprised to see a really nice facility. The hotel is located very conveniently in Korea Town, close to the train station and walking distance to Times Square and Midtown Manhattan. It was the perfect location. The lobby is small but very well maintained and there is a restaurant that serves free continental breakfast in the morning. There is also a great concierge who is available from 8a.m.-8p.m. daily. The front desk was wonderful and even allowed us to check in early. Our room was really nice. We were located on the 14th floor and had a great view of the city below. Our room was very spacious and we had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. The bathroom was a really good size with plenty of room to store all of our stuff. There was also a nice big closet. We had a terrific stay at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring New York”
Reviews.Author: BristolStew
Reviews.Content: Having spent alot of time searching for reasonable priced hotels, we chose Red Roof Inn based on the good reviews on this site. The hotel was spotless, rooms and communal areas alike. Our room (no. 911) was a good size - king bed, armchairs, desk, and was ample for the 4 night stay. Contrary to some reviews, we had no problems at all with outside noise. The air con was perhaps a bit noisy, but worked perfectly and didn't stop us getting some good kip. Breakfast was ok, although not award-winning! It was free, and if you treat is as a bonus rather than an expectation then it's fine... when the breakfast room was busy, we just took coffee and doughnuts back to the room, then had some proper brunch later on. The location was great as a base for sightseeing. 2 blocks from Empire State building, easy walking distance to Times Square, down to Flatiron district. Really only a 20 minute walk down to Union Square and the top of Greenwich Village. For further afield, the subway station (Herald Square/32nd) on the corner of the street was well connected. The street is named Korea Way and is a bustling, yet very safe street with some fantastic Korean restaurants... try the Korean Barbeque at your table in any of these for around $25 per head and you won't be disappointed. I would recommend this hotel as a good base for your sightseeing trip to NYC, particularly if it's your first visit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a great location in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: shuffle72
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks newly renovated (not sure when it was renovated)! The registration dest employee was extremely cordial and helpful as were the consierge desk employees. We arrived before the designated check in time (almost 2 hours early) and was able to get right into our room! The room was beautifully decorated. Though it had 2 double beds, it was a bit small....but for NYC room sizes this was great. Our room was extremely clean and beds very comfortable. The room has a flat screen TV and a wonderful shower! The alarm clock was great as well - you can plug your ipod/mp3 into it. Included in the price of the room was continental breakfast each day. This breakfast suited our purposes, but wished it offered more. It offered bagels, donuts, cereal, yogurt, coffee, and juice. The day we checked out, the hotel stored our bags for no extra cost! We traveled by Amtrak to NYC and was able to walk to The Red Roof Inn from Penn Station! Great location, great, service, wonderful hotel! Worth the expense!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: robinpNh
Reviews.Content: My son (14) and I stayed here for a week this summer. The hotel was recently renovated and the room was clean, quiet, and well-appointed. There was a small fridge and microwave in the room which was great for snacks. We were very close to all of the subway lines and walking distance from great shopping and many attractions. The staff were very helpful ... the young ladies posted at the concierge were able to give good information about getting around the city and the best way to get there. There were many Korean restaurants on the block, but plenty of places within walking distance (a block or two). The continental breakfast provided a decent selection...we tended to get there close to the end of serving time and it was kind of crowded. For an excellent price (just over $100 a night) we were able to stay in Manhattan and have money to do all the fun things we wanted to do!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AntShek
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a very nice spot, this hotel is right in the Heart of NYC and in Korea Town this hotel is a couple of blocks away from Times Square and this Hotel is a nice spot i stayed on the 7th floor very nice bed had a King size bed and of course the room was kind of small but it was alright if u wanted to stay in... but its NYC who would? The only thing about this hotel is when i was checking out, The front desk clerk had to check the room for security reasons it only took a minute but it was ok so literally i would stay here again very people.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ArtCorkcity
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Red Roof Inn. The staff were warm, friendly and helpfull. Our room was spacious and comforbable and the self service breakfast was an added bonus. The hotel was ideally located near the Empire State building , Macy's , Penn Station,and Madison Square Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean room, friendly staff, great price.”
Reviews.Author: newfieSt_John_s_NL
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were at the Red Roof Inn for 3 nights in Sept. We were very pleased with the location, our room was ready and we checked in upon arrival at 1pm. Since we came into Penn station we could walk to the hotel, only 2 blocks. Maybe it was the location of our room in the hotel, but it was very quiet and we heard no street noise. We had a king bed, room is small, but that is standard for Manhattan hotels, only there to sleep, bathroom was very clean & well stocked with the necessities. We got a AAA discount and the price was great. Would certainly stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but never again”
Reviews.Author: saliannuzzi
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at Red Roof previsously and thought I would give it a go again. The hotel itself is good, handy location, nice rooms and breakfast included which makes for good value. Unfortunately for this hotel it is located next to some 24hour bars which means sleeping is next to impossible - so all value is lost if you can't get a good nights sleep. In addition there seems to be a continuous collection of rubbish on the street from 9pm thru to 4am daily - so again sleeping is impossible due to truck and other noise. We resorted to sleeping with the TV and radio on in an attempt to drown out the noise. The fitness centre is basic at best, with some of the equipment not working and towles not replaced over the weekend. The reception staff are disinterested and don't make for a nice stay. The free breakfast has a good selection, but you will need to get lucky when trying to find a table in what is a very cramped serving area. Unless they can sound proof the rooms, I won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Christmas”
Reviews.Author: sun7676
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC early December 2008. We arrived the night of the tree lighting in Rockefeller Center, but I do not remember the exact date. The hotel was conveniently located 2 blocks from Penn Station. We took the train into Manhatten so this was perfect for us. The lobby was clean. The people behind the desk were nice. There appeared to be a bar/lounge that was attached to the lobby but we didnt go.The rooms were not big, but that is normal for Manhatten. For the two of us the size of the room was fine. The bed was very comfortable. No bed bugs-I always check! The bathroom was updated nicely. We had a view of the empre state building from our window. You could hear everything happening on the street, but it is NYC and I didnt expect it to be quiet. Now to the price...The room was around 300 a night. This is the most expensive time of year to stay in NYC remember and you will pay top dollar anywhere you go. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel close to Empire State”
Reviews.Author: SameerTX
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC on Sept 5th and 6th, 2009. Positives: 1. Proximity to Empire State (5 mins walk), Proximity to Subway station (2 mins), 2. Decent Location (Korea Town) and we didnt have any problem walking through the neighborhood 3. Friendly staff (front desk and bell hops) - they hold your luggage till you check in and for several hours after you checkout. 4. Good complimentary breakfast, but the breakfast lobby gets crowded. Negatives: 1. The room with 2 beds that we were in was a bit congested for 3 people. 2. The glass door in the restroom is transparent! General: We didnt face any bug problems nor did we have any problem regulating the AC

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: FreyaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Sept 3 - 6 to go to the Tennis US Open. We loved the location. Very convenient to walk a few blocks to get on the first stop of the #7 train to Flushing. I do believe they are other subway stops closer than the one we used, but we specifically needed the #7 train. The room was very clean and had a great bathroom. There are a lot of restaurants in the area, especially Korean ones. We would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: I had been in the lobby and the bar of this hotel in the past when, attending a funeral, I visited relatives who were staying here; and based on that experience, I was not expecting much in terms of the quality of the rooms. However, the room I was given turned out to be nicer than I had anticipated. Very clean. Comfortable mattress. Nice, well-maintained furniture. Newish LCD tv. Friendly desk and housekeeping staff. I was already very familiar with the location, so it was perfect (2 blocks walk to Penn Station to catch AirTrain to JFK airport; plenty of Korean restaurants all around the hotel; near stops for most Manhattan subway lines; found an inexpensive next-day-service dry cleaners a couple of blocks away). Negatives: - paper-thin walls (I could hear every nuance of my neighbors making whoopie in my room and in the hall outside our rooms) - tiny room - room was dark (view of an office building next door -- no access to direct sunlight) - unable to adjust temperature setting of the air conditioner (choices were "on" and "off"), which was very loud while it was running - I believe the room was advertised at the Red Roof Inn website as having a refrigerator, but there was none in the room I was given I paid $140 plus taxes per night, which is a great rate for Manhattan, especially with (slow) internet, breakfast, and phone service included. I wouldn't have paid over $200 per night for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peachmb
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Red Roof Inn from August 22 - 31, 2009. The staff was very friendly and our room was very clean. Our room had two double beds, desk, two chairs, flatscreen TV, closet, in-room safe, in-room coffee, ironing board/iron, hair dryer and 3 drawer dresser - plenty of room to unpack our clothes and store in the dressers and put the luggage in the closet. We used the free internet in our room with our ITouch which was handy. When I needed to send a longer email, I would used the internet near the lobby for a nominal fee. The continental breakfast was basic (juice, coffee, bagels, pastries, bananas, apples, yogurt, oatmeal, cereal, toast) and the breakfast room can accommodate about 40 - 50 people at a time. A few mornings, I used the tray in the room and obtained breakfast for our family and we ate in the room. The location is excellent - 32nd St (very close to 5th Ave) in Koreatown which is a street full of Korean restaurants and is always busy. I returned by myself around midnight on Saturday night by bus (I'm female) and I felt very safe walking down 32nd St to the hotel because of the activity. I would stay at this hotel again; however, I would also consider the Hampton Inn on 31st St. My daughter and her three friends stayed there and this was also a great hotel - very tiny rooms (no dresser thus no place for clothes); better continental breakfast with hot buffet items and larger breakfast room; free internet in the lobby; and friendly staff. Their location was fine but their street was very quiet and as a Mom, I wouldn't feel comfortable if one of them was walking by themselves on the street - no activity on the street. Both the Red Roof Inn and the Hamption Inn offered excellent rates at $165/night and are great places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Guest can't control air conditioner; staff is downright rude”
Reviews.Author: JillJean
Reviews.Content: Air conditioner did not work properly and consistently FROZE the room. When we shut it off (turning it to the warmest setting did nothing), the room got miserably hot. Calling down to the front desk, we were told the unit operated by computer only - we could not control it. Sometimes the front desk could restart the air, sometimes not. On the last night of our stay, we woke up at 3:30 a.m.bathed in sweat, and called down to the front desk THREE times. The clerk mislead us by saying he could probably fix the problem, but never did. He never offered to move us to another room. A large clunky portable fan was delivered to our small room, and it offered no relief. When we complained at check out, we were treated rudely and suspiciously. As a former employee in the hotel industry, I've never witnessed such a total lack of professionalism. We asked to speak to the manager and requested a refund for our last miserable night. He was unavailable, ofcourse, and the staff argued with us. When we finally reached the manager, he was as suspicious and disbelieving as his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn - Try It!”
Reviews.Author: knight0137
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. Hotel staff was pleasant, courteous, and accomodating. Rooms and the hotel - CLEAN. It was a last minute plan to travel to N.Y.C. for 3 vacation days. Someone recommended to my husband that they stay at the Red Roof Inn and are very pleased every time they go there. It was a very good experience for our family of four. We arrived 2 hours before check-in time just hoping the staff would hold our luggage and direct us where to park our car. To our surprise our room was available and they brought our luggage up to our room immediately. Wow! We reserved a 2 Double bed room. The room had limited area to walk, but that was fine. Bathroom good size. Free WiFi and my kids loved using their i Touch. Also, the location of the Red Roof Inn was very convenient to everything . Great location! My children enjoyed having their late night snack at Pinkberry(Yogurt Shop) which is across the street. A perfect healthy snack to end the day.. And the hotel also provides a continental breakfast each morning. The selection ranged from bagels, cereal, yogurt, donuts, juice and weak coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: bobdylanfan
Reviews.Content: We got a VERY good deal for a room at this time of year. Our room was EXCELLENT, the hotel was EXCELLENT, the breakfast was EXCELLENT, location was EXCELLENT, view was EXCELLENT (Empire State building view). We felt safe in our room, did not see any rats, roaches, or ANY bedbugs. The room was very clean, and we had plenty of soap, towels, shampoo, and lotion. We got free complimentary breakfast (choice of orange juice, coffee, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, bagels, tea, buttered rolls, muffins). There is a fitness room, free Post and USA newspapers each day we were there. I WAS VERY SURPRISED STAYING IN NEW YORK AT A GOOD HOTEL FOR SUCH A GOOD PRICE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK CANCELLATION”
Reviews.Author: psdiva
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and bathroom. Beds take up most of the living space. Large TV. Was disappointed that we had to pay if we wanted to play the Nintendo games. Breakfast is a great plus but breakfast room is small and somehow needs reorganising to fit in a few extra tables. We had no problem with the location being 16 blocks from Times Square and 3 Avenues from Madison Square Garden. Great AMC cinema on 34th Street to keep the kids happy.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value! Too good to be true!”
Reviews.Author: teamstef
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof for the week-end! Paying that price, I was a bit scared before I got there. All my fears quickly disapeared when I got there. Location is great! 10 minutes walk to Time Square. The room was very clean and confortable! Nice king size bed, flatscreen, Ipod stereo, In-room internet access, hot water on demand (Don't laugh, it's not always the case in 130$ hotels in NYC) and I had the Empire State building in my window (could not be closer...see attached picture...I did not use a zoom). The staff was nice (I was even able to leave a desert in the front office's refrigerator). Now, it's not luxury of course but at this price, it's way more than anything you can expect! Location and cleanliness for 130$ a night! WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wolfdancer38
Reviews.Content: I want to say that this was the perfect place to stay. Its was close to Penn Station and the downtown area. Room was well stocked and staff was great. We got in a few hours early and our room was already ready and we didn't have to wait. I will stay here again the next time im in NYC and i will tell my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof - no regrets”
Reviews.Author: Markkkk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at RR with three teenagers and it worked very well. Great location, good Korean restaurants outside the entrance and good breakfast places nearby. Close to everything. Took shuttle from Newark airport to Penn Station and walked to hotel. Cozy cool little bar for a reviving drink efter a long day in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Near downtown, nice breakfast and good price”
Reviews.Author: JuneHoLee
Reviews.Content: Near downtown, near subway and inside Korea Town!!! If you enjoy korean food like me and my family, you need to stay in Red Roof! Bbq, noodles, home made, supermarket, everything near the hotel. Ice cream and korean style bakery!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and well located -- great value for what I paid.”
Reviews.Author: blondedawn
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with this hotel, especially given that we paid only $125 a night for it on a summer weekend. I thought the location was fabulous. It was only a few minutes walk from Penn Station, so it was very quick and easy to get to the hotel after I arrived in the city. A number of subway lines are located within a few blocks of the hotel, which was convenient, although we were so centrally located that we preferred to walk most places. Basically next door to Herald Square, which contains Macy's and other shops. A Pinkberry frozen yogurt stand is also across the street from the hotel, although we did not eat there. Room was very nice -- I could tell it was recently renovated. Bed was very comfortable, and I liked the flat screen TV. We were a bit put off that the bathroom door was made of frosted glass; if you are traveling with someone you do not know very well, this could be a bit awkward. Room was of a comfortable, although not overly large, size. We went down to breakfast only one of the two mornings we were there and were relatively unimpressed. We went later in the morning, so perhaps the options are more extensive if you arrive early. There were bagels and other pastries, instant oatmeal, juice, coffee, and yogurt -- but what I really wanted was a piece of fruit, which was nowhere to be found.
