Breakfast room was also very crowded, so I noticed several people taking their food/coffee back to their rooms to escape the insanity. However, given that it is free, the breakfast didn't bother me too badly, and my friend was perfectly happy with her yogurt and bagel with cream cheese. As others have mentioned, waits for elevators can sometimes be a bit long, but they were not nearly so bad as I feared. Worst was in the morning when everyone was going to/from breakfast and leaving the hotel for the day, and even then I'd say the longest I waited was perhaps 5 minutes. Front desk staff was courteous, if not overly effusive. I noticed that there was parking available for $25 a day, which is not bad for NYC; other hotels I have stayed at have charged upwards of $50 a day. The only thing that really bothered me is that the doors of the rooms are not thick at ALL. This was not a problem for 90% of the time that we were there -- the floors are small, so there is generally not a lot of foot traffic in front of your door. However, as we tried to go to sleep one night, some men where shouting in the hall (it sounded like two of them were ready to go and were trying to encourage their friend to hurry up) -- it sounded like they were in our room. Luckily, they departed fairly quickly, but I could see how noise could be a problem. You may wish to bring ear plugs or a white noise machine to be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug alert”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler082
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel regularly for business trips. NO LONGER. I just discovered bed bugs when I stayed this month (July 2009). DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL - BED BUGS!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Inamey
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn is situated in a perfect location in Manhattan. The hotel has spacious, very clean rooms. Staff is friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is far from European standards, but at least there is a breakfast! This hotel is perfect for a city break and offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Family”
Reviews.Author: AD-NH
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC. We brought our kids, ages 9&11. The hotel was very clean and modern. The rooms were well appointed with modern furnishings and comfortable beds. Our room was on the 15th floor and had a very nice view to the south east. Location was very convenient to Subway and within walking distance to many sites such as the Empire State Building. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on a budget. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Parking was available next street over for a discounted price of twenty-six dollars per 24 hours (good since parking is hard to find cheap in NYC!!). I felt very safe in the "Korea Town" neighborhood as well. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: nichollsb01
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance (he was my boyfriend when we arrived in NY!) stayed here in January - I have only just got round to writing a review. We booked the hotel when the exchange rate was at its best but even though the money went up it was still the cheapest hotel I could find in the location. The hotel was clean and the room fairly spacious, but then who goes to New York and spends all their time in the room?! My only gripe was the heating. We stayed over the coldest New Year for something like 10 years and when the heater failed to work on several occasions I did get a little cross! But, maintenance were always prompt in coming to fix it and always did so with a smile. The location is everything, right by the subway or a 15 min walk to Times Square. I felt safe walking around at night (even when my fiance left me to run back to the hotel to go to the toilet at 11pm!). My advice would be if you can get this hotel at a good rate then do it. New York has become my favourite place in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Secondcomming
Reviews.Content: I was all fatigues & jet lagged when i reached directly from a 16 hours flight from New delhi to New York. Trust me, the sight of the hotel was welcomming! I just crashed out in the most comfortable bed which reminded me of home! The hotel has small comfortable rooms which were fully equipped with internet, mini bar & a great view. The best part of the hotel is the location! its bang in the middle of Manhattan with every big building & business center in walking distance. I always stay in Red Roof. they have great deals on their website & if you are lucky you might even get the room for lass than $200! Best of luck. All in all a great food with a great location

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: elcid89tn
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my wife and two daughters, 13 and 8, to NYC. This was our first trip as a family, on vacation, to NYC. The Red Roof Inn is very functional. The rooms are small by American standards. But what do you expect? It’s NYC. There are not many amenities - but if you want a lot of amenities, you probably aren't reading a review of a Red Roof Inn. This hotel is located in Korea town. There are plenty of guys hanging out selling knock-off purses along the street. At least they were in the summer of 2008. I tried to use the concierge. The young lady was useless. I also tried to use the internet, but I had a problem. I went down to the desk about twenty minutes later to tell the clerk I had problems and I didn't want to use the internet. I asked them to not charge me. The clerk was rude. It is close to the subway lines, THE Macy's, and the Empire State Building. I forget the square that is nearby, but I think it is the subway station where the red and orange lines meet. If you want to buy trinkets for all your friends back home, the souvenir store on the corner of 5th Ave and 32nd St had the least expensive trinkets. If you are on a budget, this is a good choice. Just don't expect much. It was fine for our first trip.

Reviews.Title: “The hidden jewel of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: br0kera
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in the Red Roof in Manhattan and I am thrilled! It is really central in Manhattan (practicly in front of Empire State). The rooms and the building is really new, and furnitured perfectly well, even with free WiFi. The breakfast is pretty good even for europeans :) The price is also really reasonable and I have talked with people booking the hotel for the Nth time and they report, that the conditions have always been that good. To sum up, an excellent hotel in Manhattan, 50 m from Epire State Building, new and fresh rooms, with modern furniture, with nice staff and delicious breakfast. I would definetely recommend and book the hotel anytime again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Prefect base for visiting NYC”
Reviews.Author: designdrew
Reviews.Content: There are many things that I liked about my stay at this hotel during my NY trip. 1. Location!!!! What a fantastic location!! 3 or 4 mins away from two major subway stations. And I think its only 3 or 4 blocks away from Penn Station as well. Not to mention all the cool Korean restaurants in the surroundings....yummm~ I felt 100% safe the whole time I was there, because there are always people around on the street....even at 3 am. 2. Nice Room!!!! After reading some reviews on here, I asked for a room that is away from the elevators, and not facing the street (to avoid noises). So, the result was fantastic! Very quiet, warm and cozy. The size of the room is nice too...not too bid, but not too small......with modern TV and bathroom too!!! 3. Hotel itself!!! Although I didn't get the chance to taste their free breakfast, but their fast wireless internet was great!! Elevator is a bit slow, but it adds the fun to see other guests. There is also a free map of the city......its one of the best map I have ever used when I visit NY. So, don't forget to take one. (the maps I am talking about looks like a sheet of paper, not the regular folded type of map). Overall......I LOVE the hotel and its location. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location small rooms and horrible wait for elevators”
Reviews.Author: jodmendez
Reviews.Content: I made reservations online with Red Roof Inn in Manhattan. The hotel had superb location, right across the street from the Empire State building. Although a bit run down in general the hotel offered updated rooms, but the worse feature was the older elevators which took about 10 minutes to take you up 30 floors. http://www.joreviews.com/travel/new-york-city

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, pleasant, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Lit-traveler
Reviews.Content: This former office building on 32nd Street, just off Fifth Avenue, received a smart conversion into a hotel a few years ago and is being maintained very well by its owners, a small group of hotels in the vicinity, most of which are franchised by different chains. Especially after a confusing call with Red Roof Inn's phone reservationists, who couldn't confirm this hotel's cancellation policy (the Red Roof website was similarly vague), the efficient front desk and excellent room were almost a pleasant surprise (call the hotel itself for up-to-date cancellation info). My "all-inclusive king" room turned out to be unusually spacious for a Manhattan hotel room (at an excellent rate of only $113, though rates seem to fluctuate often and widely here) and the bed was very comfortable, with a new mattress; only the rock-solid foam pillows detracted, as they do in so many hotels these days. There was a large flat-screen television, an excellent workspace (omitted, apparently, in non-"inclusive" rooms), a well-appointed bathroom, and decent closet space--all immaculate. The 10th-floor room was very quiet, although the neighborhood is busy, and the breakfast was up to the usual standard of budget chains: "continental" with a few added extras. This hotel seems to be popular with a wide cross-section of guests, from American and European tourists to budget-conscious businesspeople. Don't expect warmth from the always-busy front desk, but your time won't be wasted, either. Note on the neighborhood: This hotel is exceptionally well-located for Penn Station (Amtrak, etc.), which is two long blocks west. It's also very close to Macy's and the Empire State Building. The neighborhood itself is businessy, more notable for being on the edge of the Garment District than for any glamour, but it's centrally located, as safe as any Midtown neighborhood, and easily reached by various subway lines. If you like Korean cuisine, 32nd Street is also famous for it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place, With a few minor probs.”
Reviews.Author: joe697890
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just too good to be true. But, it's true. It's brand new renovated from top to bottom. Everything is new. TV in the room was a flatscreen LCD widescreen, and we had a microwave and fridge which was great for travelling with children. Our only complaints about the facilites were that the hotel was underserviced with elevators. Often 5-10 minute waits, only to find a full elevator and have to wait again for another one. But thats normal for NYC. They have to build up in this city, and another bank of elevators means having less rooms.... So, I get how that works. Also, the bathroom doors are see-through glass. It's SLIGHTLY frosted but leaves nothing to the imagination, you can totally see in the bathroom when someone is in there. What the heck were the designers thinking?? Duh. We had a reservation problem. The day before we left for the trip we called the 1-800 number and changed our reservation to be an extra day longer, and got a new confirmation sent to our email, and thought all was well. But, the hotel never got this updated info and thought we were still checking out on sunday and not monday which is what we changed to. So we were out all day sunday and we get back to the hotel and this guy is at the door, and sternly asks if we were from room 1106, and we need to see the desk IMMEDIATELY. So, there I am already late for dinner reservations having to convince this woman that we are indeed reserved till monday. I had to send my wife up to the room, to get out printed off confirmation of this, before she would let me go. They were almost treating us like we were trying to dash after staying for free or something. In the end we got it worked out, but it wasted 30 minutes of our day and made us late for dinner and we weren't really please at the way we were treated. We got a quick apology and I was told that It's my responsibilty to make sure the info is correct when I check in, and blah blah blah. When I just assumed it was all right according to my reservation and I signed. So, the moral to this story is ALWAYS TAKE A PRINTED OFF CONFIRMATION to any hotel you are staying in. Don't trust that their computers have all the info that was GUARANTEED to you. Other than that. The hotel was awesome. Everything was great. Location rocked! In the middle of everything. It was quiet, didn't have any problems. Felt safe walking at night. etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JJDS71
Reviews.Content: Despite the ratings I give this, I assure you that I am in no way connected to this hotel or the management. I am a young guy from the UK but felt compelled to write this due to my experience here. I am currently writing this from my room in the hotel and have only 2 (minor) complaints since I arrived which I will get to. First the positives: 1) I am out here on an extremely tight budget and have to say that what you get here, for the price you pay, is EXCEPTIONAL value for money. Especially for NY. I have booked in for 7 nights 5 of which I'm paying $109 + tax (about £60) and 2 at $119 + tax. I flew in to NY from LA and spent MANY hours whilst in LA checking out room prices in Manhattan and this price, compared to what you get at this hotel, is exceptional I believe. - plasma tv in room, free wi-fi in room, complimentary continental breakfast (which I havent mnaged to wake up in time for yet-although it ends at 10.00am) and clean amd modern furnishings and comfy clean bed. put it this way, before here I was in the Chelsea International Hostel which for $80 a night for a private room (only about $40 - £25 less per night) was absolutely gross. tiny box of a room which had nothing but an old rusty bunk bed and a small sink, no tv, no nothing - horrible smelly shared shower, wifi in a downstairs shared kitchen that rarely worked. So arriving here was a HUGE relief. 2) The location is great I think. 32nd street is right in the hub of things if like me you are a tourist. close to the 40's and 50's and central park one way and close to soho and greenwhich the other way, so the tube journeys are never that long and cab rides are cheap. admittedly yes it is in the middle of Korea town and you are surrounded by Koreans outside the foyer and korean restaurants, but so what. Koreans are hardly threatening are they. It can be a tiny little bit noisy, even up here on the 11th floor, but where in such a good location isnt. My only 2 minor negatives 1) the air conditioning in my room doesnt appear that strong, I had it on 'High' and it didnt seem to make the room all that much cooler, although to be fair I only had it on for about 1 hour before realising that I didnt really need it. 2) the lifts take blooming ages, as someone said before, especially if like me you up on the 11th floor, These minor inconveniences seem a very small price to pay for all the positives, especially the value for money! I may even book in for another week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & comfortable and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Cantthinkofaname_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reviewing this web site and not disappointed. The Red Roof Inn is a really first rate hotel for the price and is ideally located for New York sightseeing. The experience: booked on line - no probs. Got there about 11am, way before normal check in, but a friendly welcoming reception allowed us to use the room straight away. The room itself was clean, tidy and what you would expect for the hotel rating - no frills but all the basics including internet access (both wifi, cable and via the TV (the latter would cost). Bath room was clean and with a good shower. Did not notice any noise from outside and slept well in comfortable beds. Breakfast - not up to much but it's in the price (if you wanted something substantial, just around the corner opposite the Empire State Building was a great Italian diner). Location – the hotel was a bout a 10min walk from Penn Street station (exit from the Madison Square Garden exit). It is also literally just around the corner from the Empire State Building. Also, don’t be put off by the fact it is in a street that is called ‘Korean Way’ – the Korean sector of New York. This was not a problem (why should it be?) and it made for an interesting walk to the hotel from the sub way. The acid test - would I stay there again? Absolutely yes. Okay for children? Yes. Valuable for money? Probably yes given where it is. 5 stars for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: GijonClarke
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 3 blocks from Penn Station, 1 block from Empire State and 10 minutes walk to Times Sq. Very clean, good size room, comfy bed, free wifi, basic breakfast also included in price. I don't know many hotels in NY, but on reading other reviews I think we were very lucky to get all this for 150 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ozwardies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2009 and had a great time. The location was great - just what we wanted in New York. The hotel is clean, the staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were an ok size. We had heard that NYC hotel rooms were tiny but ours was ok - a room with 2 double beds. We really didn't spend any time in the hotel apart from to sleep at night. My only complaint would be the noisy ice machine outside our room. The free breakfast is basic with bagels, toast, cereal, coffee, yoghurt, juice, bananas and apples available but was great considering it was FREE. The breakfast room is small though. We got a good price booking through the Applecore website. They also have a deal with a car parking garage a few doors down which was great - we just drove in and left the car till we were ready to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for a "Big City" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Papabear0276
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in "Big City" hotels and have had the usual experiences, noise, poor customer service, lack luster "continental breakfasts", tiny rooms with even smaller bathrooms. None of these things were a problem at the Red Roof Manhattan. No problems with reservations or check in, staff was polite and efficient. I asked for a non smoking room on an upper floor away from the street, and they delivered. Bed was comfortable and noise was minimal- although running the fan on the AC and being on the 16th floor helped. For a "Big City " hotel I would consider the room spacious. Flat screen LCD TV, Microwave, college frig, FREE wifi. Overall the room was clean and bright. I had a problem with the safe, after a call to the front desk- maintenance appeared within 15 mins. He attempted to reset the safe unsuccessfully. He returned shortly with his tools and the safe was repaired by the time I returned from dinner. The complimentary breakfast was a little better than average. Donuts, bagels, yogurt, bananas, apples, coffee, tea, cereal, milk, juice etc. On 32nd St. just west of 5th Ave. One block from the Empire State Bldg, only about 5 or 6 blocks from Macy's on 34th St, and Herald Square. Very close to several subway stops. West 32nd St. is not a glamor spot, but a 2 block jaunt puts you where you want to be. For a nice meal try Heartland Brewery on 5th Ave in the Empire State Bldg. All in all a good experience, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location for 1st visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Shells99
Reviews.Content: After booking many options on NYC hotels, we finally settled for the Red Roof Inn based on a combination of value, location and previous reviews on this site. We booked a 'red hot deal' on the hotel's website, which offered a king room for $148 + taxes per night. We stayed for 7 nights. This was our first trip to New York. Things didn't start out too well. After arriving from San Francisco at Penn Station the hotel was an easy 5 min walk. The area felt safe even though it was around 1.00am. However, when we arrived at reception the man on the desk informed me that he only had a second floor room available. I had booked a king room, non-smoking and I had requested a high floor, away from the elevator! We were so tired and decided to go straight to the room and try to get some sleep. The room was away from the elevator BUT it was right next to the ice machine and it stank of stale smoke (a smoking room). I spent the night tossing and turning listening to the clunking of the ice machine and smelling the smoky air! Plus, as it was located on the second floor it was also right beside the breakfast room which was noisy from 6.30 onwards. I thought I was being taken for a fool. Needless to say, we had an early breakfast and then went to look at the higher floors and the location of the other rooms, before going straight to reception to request a different room. This receptionist ( a lady) was very efficient and after I explained what we needed she moved us to the 12th floor (no-smoking floor) away from the ice machine and far enough from the elevators. It was also a corner room which meant we only had neigbours on one side. Although the room faced the street I was able to sleep well. Speaking of sleeping the bed was very comfortable - it had a 'pillow-top mattress' - and it was hard to leave it in the mornings! There were plenty of pillows and clean towels. Everything was very clean and maid service was efficient, always respecting the 'do not disturb' sign. Plus, another bonus, our room faced the Empire State building and we could look up each night to see the illuminated top. It was very quiet within the floor at night - we never once heard any noise from the next room. From our point of view the hotel was very well located for our first visit. As others have already said, the ESB and Macys were very close. Times Square was just one stop away on the subway - subway stations also close by. The concierge provides a good map showing streets and subway lines and a more detailed bus or subway map can be got free from any news kiosk. The hotel is located in 'koreatown' hence the many korean restaurants and take aways. We did sample some food from the 'Woorijip' a couple of doors up from the hotel and this was cheap and tasty. Although there seemed to be a lot of bagged rubbish piled up on the sidewalks at night, I think this may be the case everywhere and it was always cleared by morning. Breakfast was welcome and set us up well for the day. It's self service from 7 - 10. Probably better to be there by 8.00 as it does get crowded later. We didn't use any other services as we were out most of the time, only coming back at night to sleep. There is also a PC in the lobby with 'pay as you go' internet access, which is useful if, like us, you don't travel with a laptop. Liked; - Comfy beds - Central location - Complimentary breakfast - Value for money - Quiet rooms - Cleanliness Disliked - First room (and receptionist who allocated it)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experinece Ever - By Far”
Reviews.Author: kakapudala
Reviews.Content: By far the worst hotel service I have ever experienced. All the staff were exceptionally rude an unprofessional. The cleaning staff and management were the worst. The cleaning lady walked in twice while my girlfriend and I were in the shower - proceeded to open the bathroom shower curtain and wouldn’t leave when we told her to get out of the bathroom. She finally walked out of the bathroom and we thought she left, only to find out that she was still in the room and then decided to come back into the bathroom for a second time. Again opening the shower curtain. (She had a cell phone in her hand and may have been taking pictures. She would not show me the phone when I asked her to see it.) I had to walk out of the bathroom without any clothes on and escort her out of the room. The room door was locked from the inside and the do not disturb sign was on the door. We later found out that she called hotel maintenance to open the door. When I spoke with the general manager (Rafeeq Mohamed) about this incident he said it was normal hotel policy and that nothing was wrong. He then started yelling and swearing at me. My girlfriend and I were so disappointed. If you are planning a on having a good time in the city avoid this hotel by all means.

Reviews.Title: “too noising!”
Reviews.Author: milanox77
Reviews.Content: too noising!!! bad location, in corea way, a street full of korean restaurant, really noising during the night! nice and big rooms, good servive

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel box of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: OKmolly
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed a total of 7 nights at the hotel and loved everything about it. We expecially liked the location and the wonderful staff. Our room was nicely furnished and looked like it had been recently remodeled. Kermani, the counter man was really helpful and made sure our stay was pleasant. The on site bar and continenial breakfast was a great addition to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in NYC, good value”
Reviews.Author: krysss
Reviews.Content: Location wise, the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan is perfect. Room was quite boxy, but by NYC standards has to be considered spacious. Clean, basic and comfortable, great wifi fast internet connection in the room for free. Would go there again Only one thing is not that great: the breakfast room is too small, not enough tables for all the customers, food was quite ordinary, not bad, but ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Touristintraining
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. The staff (especially Kerman) were responsive to any request. The room was great and location very convenient. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rower1991
Reviews.Content: Made a search at Tripadvisor by ranking, selected this hotel based on location and recommendations. On a hotel web-site I found a good offer, so overall it has been the very good ratio between price and quality. As mentioned by others the location is perfect, it is easy to walk around / to travel by subway. Other comments: - MVP Bus leaves for DC in front of Penn Plaza, 7 mins walk, arriving same place. We checked-out, left luggage (for free, only tips) at the hotel before bus. Then in a few days we returned back, had a few hours before flight so I decided to go to the hotel and ask them storing the luggage again. It worked perfectly, only a few dollars was asked to be paid. Very convenient. - we stayed at the 17th floor, no really noise from outside, have to admit that you can hear all the time elevator and ventilation noise, not killing at all, but for very sensitive person ask a room at least next corner after elevator. - when we checked-in a receptionist didn't look very friendly, but when checked out and next visit storing luggage - other receptionists were OK - breakfast is simple, but fresh - wi-fi worked well on iPod - room was big enough, cleaned daily - announced free calls within the US (didn't try though) I would say it's good 3 stars hotel by European measures. Certainly recommendened to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location whit a grat prices”
Reviews.Author: Vicky142
Reviews.Content: After Search and looking a lot of hotels this was the best in price, location and amenities. The locatios is the best, in mid manhattan, betwen 5th and 6th AVE. near Macys, Manhattan Mall, a lot of restaurants, near Times Sqare and just 1 block from Empire State. Near a Metro Station. and Korea Town is a safe place The room are small, but comfortable, quiet, big bed, with refrigerator, microwave, coffe machine, security box, plasma tv, internet. the bathroom is clean and you have a lot of towels. And if you are lucky you could find a room whit a great view: The empire State building. Its one of a few hotels that bring continental breakfast, and its good, but the room is small, and sometimes you Can't find a table, but you could take the breakfast to your room. The elevators are slow, and sometimes you need a lot of patien. The people in the front desk not always are so nice, but they help you if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: richfink66
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised at how nice this hotel was given the modest price. The rooms were big relative to other New York hotels. The price was right. The elevators were a little slow and one of them smelled for some reason but our room was nice and seemed pretty quiet. The neighborhood, Korea-Town, seemed really safe (Korea-Town is just a block or two of largely Korean businesses). We liked it and would recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: callie10
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I stayed here in June of 2008 and would go back in a second. The location was fantastic. It was in a great spot for walking to the sights and there is a subway stop at the end of the street. The continental breakfast served is one of the best continental breakfasts I have ever had. It wasn't just donuts, bagels or pastries. There was cereal, bagels, fruit, hard boiled eggs etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful. One thing to keep in mind is that if you are driving yourself the parking garage is before the hotel. After checking in we had to drive around the block which took quite a while since it was around 4pm when we arrived. Its the only parking garage on the street so I would recommend stopping there first and then going to check in. It will save you some valuable sight seeing/shopping/eating time!

Reviews.Title: “HUMAN SCALE AND ATMOSPHERE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: topognosia
Reviews.Content: I was there with 35 graduating students from our School of Architecture, Aristotle University of Thesaloniki, Greece and we enjoyed 10 unforgettable days. Since I am guiding this educational trip every year for 10 years now and we have stayed in various hotels (the students themselves organize the whole trip, I am only taking them around to visit important buildings, since this is my topic) I can tell you that for the first time I felt at home : Scale of the building (only 170 rooms),Kind and smiling persons (from the check-in desk to the cleaning people), decent breakfast, clean and tide rooms and bathrooms, plus many other amenities (free wireless internet access, complimentary daily newspaper, free local calls, etc.). The location of the hotel (32nd Street and 5th Avenue) is also perfect. The proof that all the above is true comes from the fact that I demanded from students to book this hotel for the trip of this year!!! We will be there from April 21, 2009 up to April 30, 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: ashuppe
Reviews.Content: We were in Manhattan for the Big East Tournament in March 2009. After doing quite a bit of searching and price comparison we decided to book a room at The Red Roof Inn. We were extremely pleased in every aspect of the hotel. PRICE--We book directly through the Red Roof Inn website and got the lowest rate we could find on any website. ROOMS--Although the room was not large, for NYC standards it was fairly good sized. We had 3 adults sharing a room and had plently of space for luggage and to move around. The room included a microwave, fridge, large tv, and beds that were extremely comfortable. The hotel has been newly renovated so everything was clean and modern. BREAKFAST--Nothing fancy, but enough to get your day going. They had a nice selection of bagels, donuts, fruit, cereal, and yogurt. The breakfast room was big enough that there was always enough space. NOISE LEVEL--We found the hotel to be very quiet. Each floor only has 12-16 rooms that are pretty spaced out so I never heard the other people coming home. We were on the 16 floor and the street noise was at a minimum. LOCATION--We were within easy walking distance to Madison Square Garden. It was less than 1/2 a mile and could be walked in about 10 minutes. We were also within two blocks of the four major subway lines. So if you couldn't walk to the location you needed it was easy to hop on the subway. The hotel is located in Korea town and has lots of yummy places to eat nearby. I highly suggest the Mandoo Bar next door. They have homemade dumplings that were fabulous! Overall we will definitely stay here next time we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, home from home in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: DublinToddy
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the Red Roof Inn Manhattan and I was not disappointed. I found it excellent value for money. I had recommended the hotel to my family and they couldn't believe how close we were to Macy's, Empire State building, subways etc. We were so comfortable at the hotel - staff were friendly, I don't like too much fuss so I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and if there is a problem you just contact reception and it is sorted immediately. Some reviews state the rooms are small but we found our rooms comfortable, very clean and adequate for our stay. There is no big foyer but if you are not hanging around all day you don't need one. For it's location, cleanliness and value I will certainly return (when I clear my credit card!!!). Absolutely love NYC and Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price”
Reviews.Author: maryg25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we were in town for the New York Comic Con. The room was small, but hey, this is New York and was about as big as I was expecting. The front desk staff was helpful and it was nice that we could store our luggage at the hotel after we checked out since we were going to be at the con for the rest of the day. It's an easy walk from Penn Station and was a cheap cab ride to the Javits Center. The price couldn't be beat for such a nice room. It was nice that our son could stay for free (other hotels I looked at charged for kids) and they have a free continental breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value, an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: George_PConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I chuckled at the idea of staying at a Red Roof Inn in New York, mainly because I associate the brand with highway travel, and certainly nothing fancy. But this place is a gem; I recommend it highly. The fact that it has recently been renovated is a strong selling point. It's very clean, and although the rooms are smaller than what you might find in other cities, they are actually larger than other Manhattan hotel rooms at similar price points. We paid about $150, which made it an unbeatable value. The appointments are nice, but not fancy, e.g. the TV channel selection is limited and the bath products are very basic. But with extremely clean rooms, comfortable beds and relative quiet, the other things just don't matter. One thing that's important to note: although we were in a non-smoking room, we could detect cigarette smoke from the ventilation system from time to time. I can't imagine the hotel can control this any better than they already do (save for making the entire hotel non-smoking). It wasn't overpowering, and it wasn't like it invaded the sheets or anything. But it was occasionally noticeable. Koreatown isn't particularly pretty, but it's bustling... and there are lots of great Asian restaurants on the block. And from there you can get to just about anywhere without too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location!”
Reviews.Author: Analot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 days in early Feb 09, and found the hotel very nice. Great location on 32nd street, just round the corner from the Empire State Building. Reception was quite small but the staff were friendly and helpful and let us check in early which was great. Our room on the 14th floor was lovely, nice and big (unusual for NY), the bed was lovely and comfy and the bathroom was a perfect size. The room was kept very clean as was the bathroom. The housekeeping staff were really nice and friendly. We had a safe, fridge, microwave, and great flat screen TV. There also was a coffee machine, but the coffee left a lot to be desired, I preferred to get one in the cafe further down 32nd and bring it back. The breakfast was fine, usual stuff - bagels, toast, cereal etc.. I hated the polystyrene cups and plates, I suppose its a good way to cut down on staff but it means a lot more garbage! The only thing that I didn't like was the bar, we went there twice and had only one drink both times, I didn't think the bar man was particularly friendly, in fact he was a little bit rude and also the music was so loud it was hard to have a conversation. I preferred the bars around the corner on 33rd street. Overall I would say that we enjoyed our stay at the Red Roof Inn and will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. The location was great, breakfast included every morning, nice room, great rate. Have recommended to others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Went back and was pleased”
Reviews.Author: traveller1300
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review a few months ago about my stay in Dec of 2007. I liked the hotel but my problem was with the much higher prices for the rooms since my stay. Well, I was happy to see that the prices had gone down from over $300 a night to around $179, so my husband and I stayed overnight in Dec 2008. I am not sure if it is just that the price goes down in the winter or if it is the bad economy driving the prices down, but either way I was pleased. The hotel, as said before, is clean and modern and the king room we had was great for the two of us. Bathroom was also clean and a good size for 2. The heat was a bit wonky and it took a while to heat up, but once it did is was very comfortable and we actually had to turn it down because it got too hot. We were also happy to find that the elevators were much faster than our last stay. Don't know if we just lucked out, but we never waited for more than a minute for them. The staff is not the most smiley bunch, but when we arrived before check in time, the desk clerk went out of his way to get us our room right away. We were very pleased and will keep using this hotel for our little weekend trips into the city as long as the price stays right.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JohanLeiden_Holland
Reviews.Content: I took a long time selecting a hotel in NYC, but this was a really great find. It is slap bang in the middle of Manhattan, very close to the Empire State Bld (I could see it from my hotel room window). My room was not very big, but clean and I loved the free wireless internet. The room heating could have been better: either it blows hot air or it is off. But this seems to be a general problem for the US, I noticed. Although the hotel is in the middle of the city that never sleeps, my room was incredibly quiet, so I could sleep very well. The room had a safe that was big enough to hold my 12 inch powerbook, camera etc. Breakfast was included, which is increasingly rare. The breakfast room could have been bigger, but breakfast itself was quite adequate, with coffee, tea, juices, bagels, toast, cheese etc. Next time I go to NYC I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: tdottony
Reviews.Content: Great deal for NYC at $155 nightly (with breakfast and during the holiday season). Excellent mid town location. Clean and newish looking. As for NY budget accommodations goes this is very reasonably priced. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Redroof was top class!!”
Reviews.Author: Dublinman18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Redroof for 5 nights, and found it to be great...I booked a "new all-inclusive King", but I think we were given a standard king. I'm not complaining really though...I think the decor in the all-inclusive king (as advertised on their website) would've been more modern, but after staying in the room we were given on the 9th floor I was very happy. It has a massive king bed that was very comfortable indeed, and a 32inch LCD tv, which was amazing too. The location is great - it's 5 minutes walk to Macy's and Madison Square Garden, where we managed to get in an ice hockey game! Fantasic stay, great service, and great price for such a great location. I was very happy, and would strongly recommend this hotel. I had stayed here before a number of years ago before the renovations, and it was nice then, so I was equally impressed this time. Top class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Korea Town!”
Reviews.Author: Tunetina
Reviews.Content: Isn't it great that you can have fabulous Korean meal once you step out? :-)) I just loved this location, just like other reviewers. We were told that the hotel was recently renovated. We stayed at this hotel a log time ago and you can tell the difference right away. A very impressive job. I just want to recommend that you bring in your own Ethernet cable for your laptop. The hotel is supposed have a free wireless internet connection, but the signal strength was very low and totally unusable. Instead, I used their high-speed connection.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nobbysworld
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Penn Station at 13.00 and walked to Hotel 10 minutes, from the outside not a good impression but the staff were helpfull and the room on the 15th floor was clean and roomy. The breakfast was very good although very busy at times, the location is very good just behind the Empire State Building. My wife and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: bgetman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times while traveling to NY. It is so clean & the rooms are very spacious. It is a great price! In NYC, it is almost impossible to get the size rooms for this price...and they're clean & have a great staff! Roshana at the Front Desk is the sweetest! She remembers me by name everytime. I worked at a hotel front desk several years ago, so I know how many guests come in & out on a daily basis. So, it was a very pleasant surprise for her to remember me. A little "home away from home"! Thank you Roshana for your excellent service & for making me feel welcome!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: niamhAthloneIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and had to cancel again numerous months before the travel date. I cancelled via e-mail and was charged not once but twice for a double room even though I had cancelled and should not have been charged at all. Staff promised all kinds of callbacks and in general were rude and unhelpful. In the end my credit card company refunded me. Not worth the hassle, I will never book anything online again. I particularly would avoid the staff that this hotel employs particularly the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTrillium
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location in August with several of my friends and I stayed again in November with my elderly mother. This hotel is in great condition. Each visit, my room came with a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, safe, and lots of extra towels and toiletries. It also came with the usual amenities such as a LCD TV, hair dryer, iron, etc. The staff consistently provides excellent service. Breakfast is included in the hotel room rate and the food selection is broad (cereal, yogurt, eggs, toast, bagels, fruit, etc) and the volume of food is plentiful. The location of the hotel is fantastic because it is located close to several subway lines and is within walking distance to Madison Square Gardens, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall, most Broadway and off-Broadway theatres, uptown and downtown bus tours, etc. I can’t wait to go back to New York City and when I do I will be staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tripadvidor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Red Roof Inn from Sunday 9th November until Thursday 13th November 2008. This is my 2nd time to stay here & the hotel has been re-furbished since my last visit in April 2007. Got a great deal from the hotel website $688 incl. all taxes etc. Booked a twin room & all requests were met. When we arrived at 2pm our room wasn't ready so we took a short walk & grabbed a quick coffee. Checked in at 3.15 & our room was fine. Everything was clean & when we had a problem with the phone & the in-room safe, the girl in reception organised a maintenance man to come straight away. Despite other peoples posts, we found the breakfast buffet to be always well stocked & we never had a problem getting a table. Everything was fresh & certainly set you up for the day. The buffet had fruit, yoghurts, bagels, croissants, donuts, danish pastries, toast, juice & tea/coffee. I had noticed that posters on this site had said in some cases that the staff weren't very polite or helpful. We certainly never experience this during our stay. We also had no problem with the lifts even if they very full in the morning. The hotel is very central with a subway station at the top of the street. Would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. Yes it is basic & clean but what more do you need in a city that never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gigscrilla
Reviews.Content: My first time in NYC and I wanted to be in the heart of everything. This was a good spot -- not far from everything I wanted to see. Subway friendly, plenty of food choices, even 24-hour restaurants which was a plus for me. Right around the corner from the Empire State Building and Macy's going in the other direction. It was great being central to shopping. As indicated, the hotel was recently renovated, so we found a small but clean and new hotel room w/ double beds. The only downfall was that the only room w/ 2 beds left was a smoking room, but the smoke was manageable (even though the front desk clerk said it wouldn't be bad 'cause no one smokes - so not the case here!) Then again, I'm used to staying in Vegas rooms all the time. It was worth paying the $300/night to have a nice and clean room. Beds were comfy and bathroom was completely stocked w/ towels and toiletries. Flat screen TV was a nice addition. The hotel is situated on a block we dubbed "Koreatown" since it is nothing but Korean restaurants and businesses. But this added to the flair of our block, as there were always people hanging out at different times of the day and night. I never felt unsafe coming back to our hotel late at night because there were always people around. In other words, the area never seemed "shady" to me, even at night. The staff was nice and the one time we needed assistance with the TV, there was someone at our door in less than 5 minutes. They have an activity desk and when we inquired about the Statue of Liberty, she told us to go online. So that was a disappointment! Overall, this was a great central location to have brand new accommodations (since I've read so many horror stories about horrible hotel rooms on this site!) and be surrounded by so many options. At the time, they were also the lowest at $300/night compared to the rest of Manhattan at $400-$600/night. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Mozzie29
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at the red roof inn as the hotel we had originally booked became non smoking but had forgotten to let us know despite booking it 8 months previously. Our original hotel booked us into the red roof inn and we were very nervous about moving to another hotel that we had no knowledge of. The gentleman on reception (Mr Rohip???) couldn't have been more helpful he even gave us a discount. The room was very comfortable and had everything we could need for our shopping trip. The room was clean on our and arrival and cleaned daily, all the staff we came into contact with were polite and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate and a great start to the day. I have read the other posts about the location but I can honestly say we found no offensive smells at any stage and found the area to be busy, lots of people around, which in turn made us feel safe and secure. The location for shopping and attractions was excellent. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone for the service, location and the cost which was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat it!”
Reviews.Author: PhineasFogg1899
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Manhattan. Rooms are not the biggest,but big enough for 2 people. Beds are good. Bathroom is good. Tv is great. Breakfast is OK! Location is very good. We paid $160/night and you cant beat that. It's nicer than the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: jdtOregon
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Red Roof NYC for a shopping trip. We were delightfully surprised by the sparkling clean room, and the extra comfy beds. We walked non stop for 3 days in NYC, and it was so nice to have a clean, comfortable room to go back to. The location is really good, kind of right in the middle of everywhere! We walked to Central Park, (about 30 blocks) rented bikes and rode through Central Park, which was very fun. The Brooklyn Deli right down the street is a great place to eat breakfast (even though a continental breakfast is included in the room) lunch, or dinner! It's really close to Penn Station, easy to walk with suitcases, just a few blocks. We went to the Empire State Building late at night, which was a hoot, and not busy all all. It was a spectacular sight at night, and by looking at all the roped mazes, we could tell it must be very busy at times, but not at night! Empire State Building is only 2 or less blocks from hotel. I have stayed at the Hilton in NYC, it doesn't hold a candle to the Red Roof Inn!

Reviews.Title: “May be an option”
Reviews.Author: viajer0mx
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights here. The rooms are okay, they are clean. The hotel is located just behind the Empire State, in the Korean street. It was pretty hard for me to find a hotel in Manhattan with a reduced budget. This is a good option, although next time I would search something closer to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in NY - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sars4619
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in NY. Location is perfect with a capital P. Close to everything : Macys in Herald Square, Penn station, Empire State, Times Square, subway stations etc. I arrived at 2pm and was able to check at that time. The room was booked under my friends named and CC who was to arrive later and I was able to used my CC to hold it until she came. Reception said there was no problem with swapping the CC or paying by cash upon check out. I asked for a quietly located, non smoking twin room and that is what I got. Surprisingly enough we never heard any traffic from this room (709). Nice flatscreen tv and an ipod docking station/radio too. Lots of towels which were replenished daily. Very clean and comfortable.Breakfast buffet was included which was a welcomed surprise. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They even remembered the room number from memory upon check out. Baggage storage was also allowed upon check out. Overall I highly recommend this hotel. Pinkberry across the street should be definitely tasted! Great location and cheerful accomodation at the "lower" end hotel costings for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemcg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the red roof inn with my mother at the end of September for 5 nights. The location was perfect we were on 32nd st on 5th ave. It was a great base for many of the attractions. The Empire State Building was just 2 blocks away as was Macys! The hotel itself was fine. We stayed on the 17th floor. When we arrived in the room there was a slight musty smell. The rooms were small (like the majority of manhattan hotel rooms) but overall I cant complain. The lifts were slow at certain points during the day but thats to be expected when there is only 2 lifts servicing 17 floors. Breakfast was included in our rate. We were down for breakfast early most mornings but one morning we were late and found it hard to find somewhere to sit. They had a selection cereals, bread, bagels, fruit, pastries, yogurt, teas and coffees. In some reviews I had read on tripadvisor, some people complained about the staff. We didnt have any problems with them. They were pleasant from the time we checked in until the time we left. A day before we were due to leave we asked at reception about shuttles back to the airport and the receptionist reccommended we take a cab as there was only 2 of us. They wanted a $10 deposit to book this. Thankfully I had done a bit of research before I left and I knew that NYC cabs cannot be booked. We ended up getting a train from Penn Station and then connecting with the AirTrain. It cost less than $10 and only took approx 30mins I think for value for money and location I would stay in the Red Roof Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: half-pint61
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 4 nights in October 08. Check in staff were friendly and helpful when we said we wanted to split the bill between us. We arrived earlier than check in time but our room was ready. The room was on the 7th floor and contained 2 full sized beds. it wasn't a particularly large room but had enough had space for us and was always clean. The bathroom was spacious and the shower good. We had a large TV and coffee making facilities. The info lady was lovely and helpful. Breakfast was good as long as you got there early enough. The breakfast room was fairly small and filled up quickly by about 9am. Breakfast was juice, cereal, fruit, yougurt, boiled eggs, bagels, toast and preserves, tea and coffee. The bar was nice to relax in with a cocktail or a beer and had a happy hour from 4 to 7 each day. We were 1 minute from the Empire State Building. The street was bordered by Broadway at one end and 5th Avenue at the other. Metro stations were close by in both directions. Macy's was also nearby. All in all we had a fantastic break in the Big Apple and the hotel played a big part in us having a memorable experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Willsatx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days in July and it was a great stay, the hotel is not too far from the main attractions. Plus there are a few subway stations about a block from the hotel. The staff was nice and friendly, and plenty of places to eat nearby. Also the empire state building is almost around the corner, a great hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall - breakfast bar needs attention”
Reviews.Author: camby
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in NY and this hotel did not ruin my experience at all. The bed , service were great. The big tv was a great luxury to have and the bathrooms were perfect. Negatives - West 32nd st after the garbage pickup can be a rotten place to walkthrough because of the smell, it was unbearable at times. - Breakfast - first morning i walked in , i walked straight out , it really offers nothing that you could call a decent breakfast. I suggest going to the Bagel Cafe across the road for your breakfast (just dont mind the fact noone smiles in this city when they serve you, its typical)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: charlie1977
Reviews.Content: Just back from NYC and we will definitely be staying at the Red Roof Inn on our next trip. Great location on 32nd st between 5th & 6th Ave, 1 min walk to Macys and Herald Sq. Our room was quite spacious, especially for Manhattan. The room also had a fridge and a coffee maker and a huge plasma. The beds were sooo comfortable.The bathroom was a good size but was spotless and the shower was great, with constant hot water. The continental breakfast was ideal....plenty of bagels, toast, cereal, juices etc to help you start off the day! All the staff were pleasant, especially the bellboys who were very helpful. We had no problems checking in and out. We had no complaints at all and have recommended this hotel to others already. We can't wait for our next trip and will definitely booking the Red roof inn.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Midtown Manhattan - closer than you think!”
Reviews.Author: Belfast_N_Ireland_
Reviews.Content: My last stay in NYC was up near Times Square, and it was nothing compared to this hotel - tho probably the same price. The Red Roof Inn is in one of the best locations in New York - it's kinda central to everywhere you want to see. You can walk to Central Park, or Battery Park within an hour from this hotel. It is near all the amazing shops, such as Old Navy, Macys etc etc but far enough that you hear nothing of the crowds on Broadway/Times Sq. My room had the most amazing unobscured view of the Empire State Building. The hotel itself is very very clean - the rooms are excellent. People might say small but I'd say they're about normal size (and really, when you're in New York, you don't need a massive bedroom). Each room had it's own bathroom, which is very clean, and all rooms are cleaned daily. The price of this hotel is the most alluring thing. In New York there are a lot of flea infested hovels masquerading as hotels, but this is a genuinely cheap but quality hotel. Anyone who complains about it has just got too high standards for a cheap hotel in New York!!! The staff were also very friendly and helpful - almost everyone gets a tip, but that's just America for you. The bar was fairly small and expensive (in my mind) but if you fancied a quiet drink in the hustle and bustle of New York but without the noise this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Pros and Cons for this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Manhattan for 6 nights in September, 2008. There were definite pros and cons for this hotel as follows: PROS 1) Great Location for walking tours and taking the subway to get around Manhattan. 2) Clean and adequate rooms and bathrooms. 3) Comfortable beds and pillows. 4) Wireless Internet included. 5) Good flat screen TV and reception. We only watched the news in the mornings. 6) Lots of towels and bathroom accessories. We never had to ask for anything. 7) Good air conditioning system. 8) Good Chamber Maid Service. 9) Hotel room was quiet. 10) Helpful concierge and doormen. CONS 1) Small rooms and bathrooms -although this is very common in Manhattan. 2) On the pricey side for what the hotel is - again this is very common in Manhattan, so this is to be expected. 2) Indifferent Front Desk Staff. They could use a little training in customer service. 3) The hotel is located on West 32nd Street between 5th and 6th Avenue, also known as "Korean Way". There were piles of garbage outside of the many Korean Restaurants along this street each evening. Not a problem, if you can overlook the smell of garbage in the evenings. It seemed to be taken away each night. We enjoyed staying here primarily due to the location to things we wanted to see and do. Overall, I would return again. New York is an amazing city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TAIG_8
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed at this hotel from august 26 to august 31, the location is great near to subway stations and mayors atractions, i would recomend this hotel for both the location and the price. Before our trip i did a lot of research by internet i found this hotel to be the cheapest in the area that we wanted. we got there and found a very clean room and also very nice i think the size was a good one compare with others room hotel in the area. the staff was helpfull and very kind and the hotel has a subway station rigt at the corner, penn sation is only two block and the empire state is beside the hotel, the hotel is also a walking distance of time square, manhattan mall, macys, and 5th avenue. This is a excellent choice at good price, even they have a free breakfast, wich is no common is others hotels and has a good choice of food nothing fancy but good food. the only cons is the elevator that become very slow at certain times of the day, and the breakfat area in a kind of small place, but is okay

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: AvidKLTraveller
Reviews.Content: Pros - Location is close to Times Square. No shortage of food options. Lots of Korean restaurants to choose from since the hotel is located on Korean Street. Subway is just down the street. Room and bathroom is quite big. Price is reasonable for Manhattan standards. Complimentary continental breakfast. Cons - Breakfast room is rather small but we were able to find a table on the 2 days we were there. Service is mediocre at best. Overall, the pros far outweigh the cons. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever...”
Reviews.Author: smiley_sheep
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Red Roof Inn for 7 days - 6 days originally booked but we decided to stay an extra day (they locked us out of our room on the last day because they said we had to check-in again...). The hotel itself is ok - it is located in Korea Town with lots of restaurants and close to many attractions. We had a twin room booked, size of the rooms were ok for New York. There is no fridge, had a plasma tv but also bad reception for tv channels (probably to get you to pay for movies). Bathroom is small but adequately clean. What I could not understand however, is the attitude of the staff here. There was not a single front desk staff who was helpful or courteous in the entire time we stayed. We rang a few times to ask a question and we were grunted at! One night we came back to our room to realise we had both left our access cards in the room. When I went to ask them for another one, I was told I had to have photo ID. When I said I had them in the room, I was told by the man that 'there is nothing I can do then'. He then turned to serve someone else! We are not fussy people and were not expecting first class service...but we were expecting staff who were polite and helpful. Obviously the customer service training program the manager was referring to in response to another reviewers experience is not doing its job. Breakfast was ok - had cereals fruit, pastries, juice, coffee, bread and bagels. Eating area pretty small and often no space to sit down to eat between 8am-9am. There are TWO lifts to service 17 floors and on the last two days at least one of the lifts were not working which meant people had to wait at least 15mins for a lift or as we did walk up and down 10 flights of stairs! The wireless Internet is free but very patchy (drops in and out all the time). There is a computer in the bar area which you have to pay to use and where you can print from. We thought that was great....until we tried to use it. We spent all of the time we paid for trying to install Adobe Acrobat Reader so we could actually open the attachment in our email that we wanted to print. The girl at the bar gave us some extra credit, but then the internet stopped working! Apparently it happens all the time....yet they don't fix it... For $230 p/night I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place will stay again”
Reviews.Author: hockeychic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Roof Inn Aug 9 - 11th , my husband and I brought our daughter to New York City for her 16th birthday. This was all of our first trip to New York. We stayed at teh Red Roof in based on hubby's co-workers recommendation and it was great. Everything was very clean, our room was alot bigger then I was expecting with a micro wave and bar fridge. Hallways and lobby was also kept very clean. Breakfast area was always stocked and had a pretty good selection of items, one of the toasters was broken on the 2nd morning which backed up people waiting to toast stuff but nothing horrible. I was a little disappointed we could 't get a early check in but no biggie they stored our luggage with no problems. I would say I only had 2 complaints 1 was that the breakfast area is really small, there are quite a few tables but they are really mushed together. 2nd would be elevators being really slow and usually always full, we took the stairs more often then not. But overall great place and I will go back there next time we go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: dspMd
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel that is very close to Penn Station and I would recommend staying overnight here if you travel by train as it is within walking distance and not have to worry about hailing a cab. Should I come again for an overnight in New York City, I would patronize again since it is also close to Macy's.

Reviews.Title: “Aboslutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycnyy
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely thrilled with this hotel. Clean & a great location are the best words to describe this hotel. It was recently renovated so everything is new, but it is soooo clean. The location is great; steps away from the train, 5th Ave shopping, Herald Sq and the Empire State Building. Great pizza place literally around the corner; Empire Pizza. This was a great rate and a great hotel. Will definately stay there again when we visit NYC next time.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD/CLEAN PLACE TO CRASH IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: IAB042404
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and the staff was efficient. Our shower backed up a little and they fixed it immediately. The bar in the lobby was a great plus! The guy working it was very nice & friendly. He even took us out on the town a couple of nights to some great clubs! Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: fanojeter2
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the same hotel when we travel to NYC for a vacation or long weekend getaway. It was booked so we were referred to the Applecore Hotel chain. We were hesitant to stay somewhere that we weren't familiar with since my first experience in NYC was a disaster because of the hotel. To our surprise the Red Roof Inn was clean, in a good location and affordable. We were fortunate to get a room at the last minute. We booked on a Friday morning for the next day. We were able to book just for the one night which is often difficult in NYC. The hotel was pretty basic and the rooms were small but it was sufficient for the one night that we were there. The only real complaints that we had were the slow elevators and the bathroom door in the room was just about see through which made it difficult to take care of business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MRSROCKL
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly because of Trip Advisor Ratings and were not disappointed. The Hotel is convenient to most all Manhattan attractions and subway lines. The room although small, was CLEAN and Cool which is good for Manhattan in the summer. We arrived early and were allowed to check in early. The Staff was very nice and helpful. We could not have asked for a nicer place to stay. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigeltufnel123
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Great Location. Great Price. Was there Summer 2008 for business, but I would recommend to families as well. Close to Empire State Bldg, Penn Station, Madison Sq. Garden. Staff was great

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, minor defects”
Reviews.Author: Filippo75
Reviews.Content: That's, all in all, a nice hotel, located in good a midtown location (a few blocks from Times Square). Rooms are spacious, clean and well furnished (the ipod dock station is really nice!) Some minor annoyances: - breakfast is poor, and the breakfast room is too little; I suggest you not to pay for the breakfast, and go to one of the many breakfast places outside - the elevators are slow (which is a problem, especially around breakfast time, if your room is at the 18th floor) - acoustic isolation is inadequate All in all, I'd suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: I_love_shoes0412
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof Inn from 25th June 2008 to 2nd July 2008, I was really impressed. Friends and colleagues told me about the really small rooms in New York I did not find that, the room was a good size, we were in a twin room on the eigth floor, room 806, both beds were double size and the room was comparable with other hotel rooms I have stayed in, the beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was a good size with lots of towels. The 32 inch TV on the wall was really welcome. We were placed on the back of the hotel and the view was not unpleasant. The breakfast was really substantial, I defy anyone to say there was nothing there they could not eat. On Trip Advisor there have been complaints about the lifts, the lifts are not slow, but there are no stairs so the 2 lifts have to service the whole hotel, we did not find them slow but sometimes you might have to wait a few minutes, chill, you are on your holidays!! There are now fridges in the rooms which I think are a welcome addition, the Americans call them a micro fridge but when it was delivered it is the same size as my fridge that fits under the worktop. If I go back to New York I will definately stay at the Red Roof Inn and have recommended it to my friends and colleagues, the location is central to all the sight seeing and one block away from the Empire State Building. Macys is just across the way and British visitors get 11% discount!!! what more do you need. The bar was much appreciated after a long day on your feet, also, there was wireless internet in the room and a computer set up in the bar, my son thought he had died and gone to heaven.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Roof Inn was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: tadYakimaWA
Reviews.Content: We were very, very pleased. Rooms were spotless - lots of fluffy towels. Bed very comfy. Staff was very pleasant to deal with - very helpful. We were just a block from the Empire State Building - lots of shopping of all types in the area. Would gladly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property Improving Every Visit”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: The business rooms at this property are pretty flawless for a property of this caliber. The rooms are extremely clean, the business desks are spacious and have the right plugs in the right places. The phone system and the Wireless/LAN connections work as they are supposed to. The free breakfast is more than clean and bountiful for the price of the room in Manhattan. The staff is friendly and efficient all around. I would highly recommentd this property for its convenience and value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-lighted place”
Reviews.Author: equinoxWashDc
Reviews.Content: If you arrive in NYC by Amtrak (Penn Station), the Red Roof Inn is an easy walk down 32nd St. The double room was immaculate and suitable for a family of four. The continental breakfast was more than adequate to start the day. The elevators were efficient and the housekeeping staff was accommodating when we requested an extra item. We left our luggage at the front desk at check-out and got another day to sightsee before our afternoon train. An added bonus was the yummy Mandoo Bar dumpling restaurant a couple of doors away.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - Not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: streake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this location for the second time this June. Since he is a frequent traveler he gets free-room certificates from RRI regularly. We were very happy b/c we were able to use them for the NYC RRI. (It takes two vouchers for this location since it is higher priced than the average RRI.) We were not disappointed this stay. Our room was large enough to accomodate us. The air conditioning worked great and the flat screen TV and ipod doc are nice to come back to after a long day of walking the city. We are anxious to stay here every year we travel to NYC for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaKat
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Great location, nice clean rooms, quiet. Small hotel meant ease of getting around. Great continental breakfast and FREE! Was recommended to me and I would recommend to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, price too high, slow elevators, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: devode
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times now and its a great location. However, the elevators are very slow and the staff could use a few customer service classes. They are a little rude and sometimes when they speak to you, you think you are at the local conveinence store. The rates are way too high also. But you are in manhattan so that is expected but even for Manhattan it's pretty high. There is an awesome deli on 32nd. and broadway called speedy's it has great food and good service. All this hotel has to do to improve is: rates a little lower, friendlier staff and upgrade the elevators. The rooms are very clean and remodeled, free internet, free nationwide long distance see not all negative.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ellesmereporters
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Red Roof Manhattan. The hotel has a superb location. We were on the 17th floor with a great view of the Empire State Building. Rooms are small but very clean. Breakfast is basic, but replenished on an ongoing basis so there's always enough to eat. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Madison Square Gardens or the underground (but you won't see as much if you're not on foot!!). Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ok budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-lover50
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in April. The hotel itself is in a very good location, close to the Emprie State Building, Penn station, subway and Macy's! The room we had was an adequate size and was cleaned daily. The breakfast at this hotel was terrible, the dining room was exceptional cramped a couple of times we ended up taking our breakfasts into the lfit and up 10 floors to our room which is ridiculous-and it wasn't just us doing this. They had an ok selection of continental breakfast items. We found it amusing that the music in the ill-functioning lift was very loud and dramatic for 'lift' music. The reception service was ok, however when I asked for stamps they claimed not to have any and that I had to way for the concierge to get back from her coffee break. I found this quite irritating and after explaining that our cab was arriving in 5mins made no difference to them and we ended up having to skip the stamps. All in all as a budget hotel this was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Domer90mom
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is a nice budget hotel. The 3 star AAA rating that it receives is a bit generous. More a 2 star property. However, the rooms are small but clean and comfortable enough. The location is great right around the corner from the Empire State Building, and easy walks to the subway or to Penn Station. The breakfast is nothing to write home about-some donuts,bagels,cereal, and yogurt, but it's included. The bottom line-you won't find a decent place in midtown Manhattan for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: MaryDublin7
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked a 3-night stay in the Red Roof Inn Manhattan on the reccomendation of friends who had stayed there previously. We were not disappointed. The hotel is ideally located and good value for those who want a shopping/sightseeing trip in New York. It's close to Penn Station, the Port Authority and subways and is within walking distance of many of the major sites and shopping areas.Our room was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the room had everything that we needed. It was cleaned and restocked with towels etc daily. The continental breakast fare was good and although the Breakfast Room was busy we always had a table. From time to time there was a bit of a wait for the lifts but this wasn't a problem for us. We found the staff, especially at the Front Desk to be very friendly and extremely helpful and charming to deal with. All in all a very satisfatory experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Costumer Service !”
Reviews.Author: just73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location but costumer service is very bad , there was a broken chair in my room and when i sat to do some work in my laptop i almost broke my back and my laptop, when i report it to the front desk they told me that they where going to check that out , but well i estay there for a few more days and they did nothing!!! go figure. And the consierge was to busy counting money and answering her cellphone when i tried to ask her a question !!!

Reviews.Title: “best value for money in nyc”
Reviews.Author: abelbabel
Reviews.Content: This is my first review and I'm writing it because we felt so overwhelmingly positive about this place. Admittedly we'd just walked away from the despicable Bowery White House but the Red Roof Inn is awesome, actually awesome. In essence it is just a standard room but the service is friendly, the room is comfortable and very clean and, for the price/location (just over $100) what more could you want? It's in the lower part of midtown, our room looked smack onto the Empire State, an incredible view, and easily accessible to everywhere in Manhattan. I can't big this place up enough. Unless your budget allows you to stay in one of the more 'special' places, you couldn't do much better than the Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great!! but...”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights at the end of May 2008. We have stayed here before - and we love this hotel due to the great location, the breakfast that is provided, and the price. Unfortunately, this stay was not so great. When we arrived, we were checked into a room on the "penthouse level" (level 17). Unfortunately Level 17 is the worst level of the entire hotel. There is a really loud noise emitting from the "Engine Room" - which does not stop during the night. In addition, when taking a shower, the water pressure would reduce to a trickle, then two seconds later, go back to full blast. This is quite annoying when taking a shower. I mentioned this to the front desk on my first day - and they said they would "look into it". Nothing was done to fix this during our stay. We have not had any similar problems with any rooms on any other level. We would stay there again, however if we are offered a room on level 17, we would decline this and ask to be assigned to another level.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for an Average Room”
Reviews.Author: Ragas81
