Reviews.Content: Pros * Clean room * Good location * Staff were generally helpful * Free calls within the US * Decent enough breakfast included with stay Cons * Had to ask more than once to get things in my room fixed * A/C did not work * Very slow elevators * Ice machines did not work on a few levels which meant i had to keep waiting for the SLOW elevators * No coin operated laundry machines

Reviews.Title: “Awesome -- Couldn't have wished for better!”
Reviews.Author: JENinAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't have been more pleased with the Red Roof Inn, Manhattan! We had to basically find a place to stay based on internet research alone! That can be a bit scary, especially when people's standards are so varied, and we don't know the city at all. I will admit that I was a little skeptical due to the great rate - when this hotel is in a great location. Most hotels downtown are much more expensive. It is very close to Times Square, right around the corner from the Empire State Building. You can't get much better. It has been recently remodeled and other than being small, it was one of the nicest rooms I have been in. (And who cares about small when you are supposed to be spending time in the city?!?!) Huge bed, great continental breakfast -- the list goes on. I highly recommend this hotel and will be choosing it again the next time I visit NYC -- It is great for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Freindly Staff”
Reviews.Author: poldy115
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel for one week on tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The room was clean, large enough and quiet. The staff was extremely helpful whenever we needed any help. We will definitely stay there again. Thank you for making our stay in NY so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: tartanaussie
Reviews.Content: What a find! Great little hotel. Room was a reasonable size for New York. Complimentary Breakfast excellent, very small dining room so took to room to consume, Gave us a good start to the day. Just around the corner from the Empire State Building. Handy for most places of interest. Easy walk to Broadway. Would definitely return. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not worth the trouble!”
Reviews.Author: chrchegirl
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the other reviews on this site, that the rooms at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan were very clean and modern. My extented family and I stayed there before departing and after returning from a cruise. Our first night was fine, and in fact we were quite pleased with the hotel. It is close to the Empire State Building, and the train, and we eager to return and spend time sight seeing in New York with the hotel as a centrally located base. However, when we tried to check back in there were a lot of problems. We were informed that even though we had a confirmation number and had booked in December of 2007, we were only booked in for three nights instead of four. Further we were informed that the rate for the additional night would be $385, $177 more than we had originally been quoted. When we questioned this rate, we were told that was the price and there was no negotiation. We pointed out that we had a confirmation number and that the number of nigts and the ratest had been booked in December, but were told that computer said we were staying for thee nights not four and so even though we a confirmation number given when we booked there was nothing to be done. When we asked why the rate was such a drastic increase from what we had been quoted, $208, we were told that that rate was wrong and in fact if we wished to stay our rate was $275 per night for the first three nights and then $385 for the fourth. We said that this was not what we had confirmed, but we were told, again, that that was what the computer said. We then attempted to cancel our three rooms, but were informed that Red Roof Inn policy states that all cancellations must be made 24 hours previously and that as we had stayed there before we were familiar with the policy so even if we decided to leave the hotel and find other accomodations we would be charged for our rooms. We pointed out that we were in the middle of the Atlantic ocean the day before and that we didn't at that point in time know there was a problem that would require us to change hotels and we were again told that Red Roof Inn policy requires a 24 hour cancellation and we would be charged for the rooms whether or not we used them. We very reluctantly stayed the night, and left the following morning, after paying over $60 dollars a room more than we had been quoted and had confirmed. We filed a complaint with Red Roof Inn corporation and when after hearing nothing for a week we placed a follow up call, we were informed that it was most likely we would never hear anything back as this location was know to be unwilling to "give refunds," or to negotiate in any way. We booked three rooms on two separate nights and were prepared to book one room for another four nights, and we recieved no help. Our rates were changed by at least 60 dollars in each room, and this was after we had confirmed and booked in advance. After confirming twice on the phone, our reservation was filed incorrectly. And we were not given any help or cooperation from the front desk staff, or the corporate staff when we spoke to them. We didn't want any special treatment or rates, but simply what we had booked and confirmed four moths previously. This hotel has a great location, the rooms were clean and modern and the housekeeping and bell staff were friendly but based on the poor level of customer service at the front desk and the total lack of corporate response, I will never recommend it, or another Red Roof Inn property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Loudles
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in NYC. Never having been there before just took a stab in the dark over the Internet. We were very pleasantly surprised by the hotel considering its low star rating. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Gave us toothbrushes and toothpaste when our luggage was 24 hours behind us. They directed us to a sister hotel across the road for free Internet use when our in room service didn't work. Great location - so close to everything. Breakfast was good but often very crowded. But didn't really go to NYC to waste too much time eating breakfast anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nanasnest
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel. I stayed here for 2 nights. I go to New York about twice a year to visit family so therefore am familiar with the city. I booked here based on the reviews but guess people have difffent expectations. My experiences were as follows: Pros: Good location, close to 2 subway lines. King size room which was small but clean. Breakfast was nothing to write home about in a very crowded room. Cons: The staff. This was the most unfriendly, unhelpful staff that I have encountered. Luckily, I did not require much service. The review which said not to get a taxi from the front desk was vey helpful. They get you a private car which costs a lot more. Also, no computer in lobby to print off boarding passes. The management here has a flyer that says they encourage especially postive reviews. Well, they are something that have to be earned and a friendly staff would help greatly. I had a fanastic time in New York but I will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “NO CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: DanaDayton_OH
Reviews.Content: I was suppose to stay here on May 9th but my flight was cancelled once for mechanical and once for weather on the same day. I could not make to New York at all. This hotel refused to give me my refund for confirming the room even though these circumstances were out of my control. I have complained to the manager only to receive the "Too Bad" attitude. I am now being charged on my credit card for services not rendered. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: fishballs
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 5 nights stay at the red roof inn. The location is grreat. Just round the corner from Empire state building. Penn station is 10 minutes away and there is a subway at the end of the road. If you are there for a fair period would recommened you buy a seven day unlimited travelcard valid on the subway , buses and cablecar, It great value for $25.00. Yes you do a lot of walkin while you are there ,but it so easy and convenient to hop on the subway. The hotel is very good value for money. Breakfast very nice with a good choice of bagels, doug nuts , cereal and toast. Agree that the lifts are very slow, but a small price to pay for the location. check in staff very nice and helpful and room spacious with a big confortable bed , which you need after a busy day sight seeing. There is a very nice bar there as well. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: michigan007
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best value in Manhattan. We paid $199 per night for a King room, which was nearly half of what the 3 and 4 star hotels in the area were charging. This room was emaculent, and very luxurious. It had a flat screen TV and an easy to use safe which was very important to me. There was a congierge on the 1st floor and a lounge on the 2nd floor. Best of all, it had a free continental breakfast which saves you from going to an expensive New York restaurant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived before 11:00 A.M. and asked them to check our bags while we explored the area. But to our surprise, the hotel clerk said our room was ready and let us check-in over 4 hours before the official check-in time. Also the location can't be beat. It's 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, close to the subway, and within walking distance from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. This hotel felt like a luxury hotel at an economy motel price ($199 is cheap for a clean room on a weekday in Manattan). Plus your saving even more when you figure in the free continental breakfast which you won't get at other 3 or 4 star hotels. I just can't figure out why its called the Red Roof Inn. Most Red Roofs I've stayed in are budget motels. This is much nicer. It's more like a Hampton Inn or a Fairfield Inn. Book it, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zabka
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location is great, we didn't have to use taxi at all. Room is a good size, clean. It was a bit cold but we turned the heating on for little while just to warm it up. Bed was great! It was very comfortable and huge. We were lucky as we had a view of the Empire State Building from our room on the 13th floor. At breakfast time you might wait longer for a lift. The first morning we had breakfast at the 'breakfast room', but it is really tiny so the next few mornings we took it to our room and I would recommend doing that. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Crumblyfudge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 22nd April - 27 April 2008. Ideal location for major attractions of New York - Empire State Building just around the corner, Times Square 20 minutes walk or one stop on the sub-way, Broadway 20 minutes, I could go on but too much to mention. Subway at the end of the road and you could basically get to anywhere from here with maybe a change at one station. We were located on the 16th floor and the room was very clean and a nice size with LCD TV, bath/shower, internet access, iron & ironing board, daily maid service, tea/coffee making facilities. Our outlook was on opposite side to Empire State Building, however, no road noise or problems. Complimentary breakfast just the job to start the day off - would recommend to try and get breakfast before 8.30 as it seemed to be less busy as small room. Staff friendly enough and room rate was good. Our only gripe was the lack of speed with the lifts. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here.......”
Reviews.Author: Daynese
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I had planned on traveling to New York on April 18th for their birthday. This would have been our first trip there and we were all excited. Prior to our trip my daughter became very ill and we coldn't travel. When I called to cancel my reservations they couldn't find it. I was told that there was NO reservation made in my name. HA! The next day, I called again just to make sure that the person I spoke to earlier had been correct. Once again, they couldn't find my reservation. However, once they put in the confirmation number it popped up under a mispelled last name. Red Roof Inn didn't have the right name, but they did manage to enter my debit card information into the computer correctly. Although this was clearly a mistake on the part of the Red Roof Inn, they continued to charge me. $300.00 for the first night. It went through on my account before we were even due to leave. It was to late for me to do a stop payment. They also took another $30.00 out. I don't even no what this charge was for. Once I complained to guest services I was told that this is TYPICAL FOR THAT HOTEL MANAGEMENT! This hotel is a franchise and there is nothing anyone can do. So, they just take my money FOR NOTHING. I PAID OVER $300.00 FOR THEIR MISTAKE AND I RECEIVE NOTHING IN RETURN! Ahhh...I am so mad. I was hoping to travel in August but will NOT be staying there. The sad thing is that I really DID NOT have that money. I have a sick daughter, a broken down vehicle, and a bank account now in the NEGATIVE. If for no other reason, other than MY STORY ..... PLEASE STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Vijayanil
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and children for 2 nights, on the 12th floor. The rooms are a decent size and bathrooms very clean. The hotel staff is courteous and the complimentary breakfast has a an awesome spread. The best part is the proximity to all he sites in Manhattan - The Empire state (re)building is almost next door, it took us 15min to walk to the Times Square and the train station is 2 min from the hotel. The only down side is that the street is a bit stinky, maybe because of all the restuarants around. If you're a fan of Korean/Chinese/Vietnamese food, there are lots of restaurants around, but if you're vegetarian (like me) you're at a loss of this street.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: CatwomanUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, we arrived 2 hours before check in but the very friendly staff at the desk said our room was ready and we could check in straight away. The room although on the small side was more than adequate for us and the vast amount of luggage we had accumulated as this was our last stop of a 3 week vacation. Had a great view of the Empire State Building. The bed was really comfortable and coffee making facilities were available in the room. The bathroom was absolutely spotless with lots of towels and decent toiletries. The only time we had a problem with the lifts was the day we left as they are compact and if guests from higher floors are going down there is not enough room for the luggage - a bit of patience and you will manage it. The hotel is in a great location with Macy's just around the corner. It is on the edge of Korea town and we felt safe all the time even late at night. Check out the frozen yoghurt shop opposite you won't be disappointed, Cannot recommend this hotel enough - it was great value and we will definitely book in again next time we visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Do not rely on your reservation confirmations”
Reviews.Author: benginer
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmation number of W841212-BS for our stay at red roof inn for 10th - 13th of April for 3 room. When we arrived to the hotel for check in, we are informed that our reservation was cancelled ! without any mail or warning ! and there is no available rooms to us. The front office clerk tried to help us and managed a terrible room at La quinta to me, send one of our guy to Ramada and then gived to him again a room with different price at Red Roof Inn, and send the other one to a totally different hotel ! Our Manhattan visit returned to a nightmare. Additionally the rooms are 2/3 sizes of the picture shown at their internet pages, if you have two international luggage you will have a troubles

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, no light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: Salamanteri
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during Easter. The room was comfy, clean and neat, but cold. The heater was so loud that u couldn't sleep while it was on. Plus the cleaning ladies kept so much noise in the morning that it was difficult to sleep after 7 o'clock. We could also hear some toddler screaming together with his/her dad every morning in their room, so suppose the sound isolation is poor on window and door...Otherwise liked it and liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location!”
Reviews.Author: emskilove
Reviews.Content: Clean, great location, polite staff, good breakfast. Good for Penn Station. I found all hotels expensive for what they were in Manhattan but this seems more realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Midtown hotel & Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: alabamagirl
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel in March for four nights. We were very pleased with our stay and would not hesitate to stay here again in the future. Check in was fast and easy and our room was on the 13th floor with a view of the Hotel Wolcott across the street. Our room had two double beds, a nice bathroom, and flat screen tv. The beds were VERY comfortable and I slept ver well the entire stay. The room was always spotless and the maid was very friendly and there was an abundance of towels. Water pressure in the shower was fine. The walls are a little thin and the rooms very close together so you will hear your neighbors coming and going, although we didn't find this to be a big deal. The lobby was being retiled while we were there but the day we checked out they looked to be finishing it up. There are only two elevators and they are kind of slow, although I don't think we ever waited more than 5 minutes for one. The location of the hotel is great. It is in the Korean district and only a couple of blocks from Macy's and the Empire State building. It is about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Very convenient. They have a continental breakfast on the 2nd floor everyday, but my mom and I never tried it so I cannot comment on it. Instead we ate at The Bagel Shop (that's the name) down the street. Very good made to order bagels as well as a buffet including pastries and fruit. Tip: If you bring a laptop with you there is free WiFi and after a long day of walking one day my mom and looked up places that delivered in the hotel's vicinity and ordered dinner from the Cheyenne Diner nearby. The concierge stood outside in the freezing cold wind for 30 minutes trying to flag down a cab for us to return to the airport after we checked out. We thought he went above the call of duty and tipped him accordingly. Again, very friendly staff. Overall, this is a great hotel if you are on a budget but need a nice, safe place to stay that is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob-Stod
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is superbly located, just off broadway on 32nd (15 min walk to Times Square), right opposite the Empire State Building, Madison Square garden is 2 blocks away, on the corner of 5th Ave and on top of the 34th Street Subway. What more can you ask for from a budget hotel? Rooms are basic but clean, reasonably sized, well maintained with good TV (cant say we had time to watch it) and comfortable. Stayed for a week mid March and for the cost £670 myself and my girlfriend found it to be great value. Only thing I'd mention was that we had a room 901 (and I assume all rooms from 201 to 1401 are the same) that was next to the lift which if your not up early (between 8am and 9am) then you could be woken up with people waiting on the lifts. Thankfully we were always up so was never an issue. If you want budget accomodation with central location, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: bencastlecomer
Reviews.Content: kilkenny ireland just returned from 4 night stay , comfortable bed ,very clean, great view of empire state building, All staff helpul and allowed to check in early. Excellent breakfast even if breakfast room a little crowded. Location could not be beaten and so quiet for new york . Would defin. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great central location....and updated rooms too!”
Reviews.Author: chicagochris07
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay. This is our 2nd time, after a 2 year absence. Hotel is a great value with clean, upgraded rooms with new flat panel TV, new, very comfortable mattresses, new, streamlined bathrooms. Everything in the room and on our floor was neat, clean, bright and very comfortable. The only 2 things I found not to my liking were: the frequently used elevators (only 2), so people had to wait for a more empty one....especially busy in the a.m. AND the breakfast room was very small with limited seating, but people often took their breakfast items to the room. While the continental breakfast might not appeal to some (basic quality), you can still find bananas, apples and yogurt, juice and hard boiled eggs. Skip the doghnuts. Didn't have whole wheat toast, but what the heck......this hotel is still great value! I have recommended to many friends who have also been very pleased. Great value, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kai_stafford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb 08 in room 515. The hotel is in a perfect location and is central to all the sights of New York. Our room was cleaned to perfection everyday and we found the staff to be very helpful. The breakfast room was a bit crowded some mornings but this wasnt too much trouble for us as you can take food out and eat it in your room. The breakfast had everything you could ever want and we even loaded up on bagals for pack lunches some days! The internet didnt work in our room but we did have a million channels on the t.v (perfect for watching sports!) The only thing I would say is that the taxi the hotel arrange to take you back to the airport is over twice the price of any you can hail from the street. My advice would be to check out and grab a taxi on the road, its far far cheaper! Overall this hotel is in a central location, secure and clean. A perfect stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “rubbish service from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: TAFDRC
Reviews.Content: One month after I checked out and paid in full, I have managed to have the hold placed on my debit card by the Red Roof Hotel removed. I had two rooms booked on two different cards I paid for them both with one card and they maintained a hold for more than the total amount of the two rooms on my other card??? What right do they have to do that?

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: GirlMouse
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with my hotel choice here: I would say that this was a very good price/quality ratio (on NY standards) especially taking into account the fabulous location. As yes, the location is fabulous, much better than some noisy streets near Times Square. The hotel is right in the corner of 5th avenue (and also few steps away from Broadway) and is right beside the Empire State Building and 34th street shopping (which, believe me, is much more affordable than in 5th avenue). Took about 15-20 minutes to walk to Times Square. The west 32nd street is quiet (=quiet rooms) but very safe, never felt unsafe anyware near the hotel (and safety is no. 1 in my book). Rooms are nice and clean, with nice big tv. Beds are funny: first I though that that the mattress is hard, but boy did it turn out to be comfortable - it kind of adjusted to your body, so very good beds. The pillows were excellent too, none of those large hard ones which make you think you have a large rock under your head. Breakfast room is small, but was not full if you went prior to 8 am. But can't say what it will be like in the rush season but you can always take food up to your room. Only negatives I have are the elevators (they are a bit old and slow, but hey, you are on vacation and have no hurry) and the service (which is mediocar at best). And also there is not much water pressure in the showers. But as price, location and safety are the most important factors for me, thus I am giving this hotel a 4. Would book again. Some other NY tips: do not miss the Broadway musical Wicked at the Gershwin Theather: simply fenomenal: tickets might be a bit more expensive than for other shows but well worth it. And if you get hungry: the Brewery in the empire state building's building (on 5th avenue) is very good and also the Korean restaurants on 32nd street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Pure Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: Visit NYC often - always stay more in upscale hotels, I was a little concerned about the "Red Roof" name...but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised by the beautiful intimate lobby. Then off to my room...WOW - better than most upscale hotels! Contemporary, stylish, immaculate, unbelievable! Flat screen televisions - the works...and FREE Hi-Speed Internet in NYC - unheard of! This place is the best! I still cannot believe it and the price! WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: codiBristolEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night break at the Red Roof Inn. The hotel is in a great position for sightseeing being near to the Empire State Building and within easy walking distance of other attractions and shops. The room was warm and comfortable, having been recently refurbished to a high standard. The bathroom was very clean with fresh towels daily. There was coffee making facilities, hairdryer, iron and a fantastic 32" television. The included continental buffet breakfast was great and meant we could set off on our day well fed. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and thought it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairerobbo
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a 5 night stay at Red Roof Inn, Manhattan. The location of this hotel is brilliant, 10mins walk from Times Square & Broadway and good subway access. Good sized room, plenty of space to move around even with the 2 massive suitcases. We booked 5 months in advance and requested a view of the Empire State Building, which we got. My sister & her husband, who were travelling with us, booked 2 months ago and were not so lucky with their room. Upon arrival they were put in a Smoking room despite having booked non-smoking. They immediately went to request a room change and were told that their booking wasn't an actual booking, merely a request. Unwilling to accept this they insited that they get a non-smoking room and the girl on reception was very unhelpful until the manager eventually stepped in and sorted things out. Breakfast was fine, good to fill up on before a day sight-seeing. The breakfast room is very small for the size of the hotel, but we only had to eat in our rooms on one day. We would definitely reccommend this hotel, excellent price and location, probably one of the best value hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: whitechristmas07
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in January in a famliy room, room was small but adequate. The best part - great value for money as it is so centrally located to tourist attractions, the theatre, transport, shopping and food. The staff are not overly helpful and the tour desk operator was more concerned with texting on her mobile and doing her finger nails than helping customers!! The front desk staff did however let us have a late checkout (3pm) without additional cost so this was a bonus. The breakfast room is too small and always crowded - would recommend you take your breakfast back to your room as there is minimal seating available and if you are lucky to get a seat, other customers are hovering over you to grab your seat as soon as you move!! Would stay here again as it is a clean, budget hotel. If going to New York for the first time definitely take a hop on, hop off bus and queue for half price tickets to shows at Times Square (although the queue seems long, it moves really fast- however be there early to get the better shows!)

Reviews.Title: “clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: spakky7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - 2 blocks from the Empire State Building! The room was basic, but when you're exploring a city all you need is a clean base, with a comfy bed (it was, very) & a decent shower (it was, very). (And it had a huge TV!) The breakfast was nice - eggs, bagels, doughnuts, cereal, fruit, yogurt, fruit juice, tea & coffee. There were only about 10 tables, but if it was busy, it would be empty in 5mins! Or you could take your food back to your room. We never had a problem finding a table though. Free paper every day in reception. I'd definitely stay again, and recommend to a friend. Its so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: VeeBristol
Reviews.Content: I know that review is a little delayed(!) but just wanted to say what a plesant stay we had at the Red Roof. This was down to the really helpful and friendly staff . Our room was really comfortable, with a big plasma screen (not that you had anytime or even wanted to watch TV!) and a view of the Empire State Building outside our window. The breakfasts were really generous too even if the breakfast lounge was a little small, best to try and get their early. The hotel is situated in the Korean quarter of Manhattan, well worth exploring the resturants around there, and you're not that far away from Macy's and the Empire Site of course. We also had a great taxi ride to JFK on our way back, which was booked directly by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Joe77Cork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof for 6 nights in February. The location was excellent , the hotel itself was very good. The rooms were sufficiently big and clean. Continental breakfast was very good also, although the breakfast room got crowded at times. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Destroyed holiday”
Reviews.Author: traveller101vt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and we had the worst experience. We returned to our room one day to find $1300 missing. The manager was sooo rude and unhelpful, more or less roaring at us. Got a swipe key card print out of who had entered our room in the time we were away and while not laying blame on anyone. The only persons who were there were Housekeeping. The manager told us this had never happened before. The police told us that this was not the case. Also when we said that we would complain to the hotel chain itself. The manager more or less told us not to bother, as the complaint would come back to him and he would give the same answer. We were also informed that meetings had been set up for every hotel in the area re Tourists and Security and this was the only hotel not to attend. We got in contact with the franchise on return and as of yet had no satisfactory reply. They have completely washed theie hands of it and we have been told to get in contact with the hotel owner. Even though he has received a copy of our complaint. I would strongly advise against staying here, especially in the terms of security.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Purple_Pisha
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel about 4 years ago but looking at the pictures, it hasn't changed at all! Came to NY with my mum and we loved the hotel so much, we booked it again during a second trip to the city. The double room we stayed in was very large, with a big TV, HUGE bed and coffee machine. We had a gorgeous view of the Empire State Building which was very close by. The best things about the hotel was the clean large rooms and the friendly staff. Breakfast was included in a room on the upper floors. The location was excellent, only 10 blocks from Times Square and less than a minute walk from the nearest subway. Macy's in Herald Square, the Manhattan Mall and the Empire State building were also very close by. As far as I can remember, the ONLY thing I didn't like about this hotel was the heating system- it blew out lots of warm air which in turn sucked out all the moisture in the room!

Reviews.Title: “A huge surprise- Nice Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memorymakerstravel
Reviews.Content: On a trip during February vacation with my husband and our four year old daughter, her first trip to the big city. When we first drove up I was a bit scared but due to the holiday and a vacation week the choices in New York were slim. I had read reviews that gave the hotel good reviews so booked it two night's before we arrived. $189 for 1 night non-smoking, queen size bed, included breakfast and free internet. I was plesantly surprised. The room was small but very clean and well kept everything looked brand new. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Only a short walk or subway ride to Times Square, lot of shopping a block away. I recommend....the outside apperance does not do this hotel any justice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pigee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the red roof in and couldn't fault it at all. We requested a room with a view of the empire state building and were not disappointed when we were given a room on the 15th floor. The rooms we spotless and more than adequate in size for two people and a hell of a lot of shopping bags! We ate breakfast out most mornings due to the fact that we wanted to experience the city rather than staying in the hotel but the one day we did sample the food it was fine. The staff seemed friendly we had no need to complain about anything. The rooms were of a good temperature and we had no cause to use the heating even though we were there during the recent cold snap. The location of the hotel was supurb and i would return and recommend it to others without hesitation. You can walk to Times Square in about 10 mins and we found ourselves walking everywhere so we didn't mis any sites. All i can say is book the red roof if you want a clean and comfortable hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: acehappy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Lovely breakfast. Great service. Clean and modern rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: kohster
Reviews.Content: I am from Singapore. I was in New York with my wife from 23 Jan 08 to 28 Jan 08. We had heard about Red Roof inn from my wife's cousin working in Virginia and so decided to book the hotel. Due to off peak winter rates, the room only cost US$150 per night. With my wife's AAA membership it was even cheaper at US$147. We requested a high floor and were delighted to get a room on the 16th floor. The room was nicely decorated and came with wireless internet. Bathroom was top notch. However, the heater/aircon kinda goes through cold to warm...so if you're the picky type, you'll have trouble with the room. The location was incredible. Right next to Empire State building and next to Penn Station, we were able to get anywhere easily and safely. With Macy's just nearby and Times Square a train stop away, Red Roof Inn was perfect for our Manhattan tour. We were also able to book an airport shuttle from the hotel lobby when we left, which saved us quite a sum. It was US$22 per person but we would recommend a private car for a little more at US$55, so there's no hassle over luggage space on the transport. Overall, we would come back here in a flash. But do book a high floor as it can can noisy on the low floors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinGal_08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan (32nd Street & 5th Ave) from Jan 10 to 13, 2008. I was extremely pleased with the hospitality, room and value and will definitely stay there again. The rooms are clean and newly renovated, with comfortable beds and a large television. The management was very friendly and attentive. The location cannot be beat. Overall, a great experience and a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time at the Red Roof Inn NYC”
Reviews.Author: MzParker
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan. Great location near the Statue of Liberty and Madison Square Garden. Great Korean food nearby and lots to do. Overall the price was great, location was great and the staff was great. They have a very nice Bar with a great Bartender. I'd recommend it to everyone AND I would stay there again and again. Shelley & Tessa from Chicago : )

Reviews.Title: “Great! It is New York”
Reviews.Author: strgzr1230
Reviews.Content: This property is in a wonderful location, steps from everything. Our group had two different room types. One couple was lucky enough to have a beautiful view of the Empire State Building and a rather large room. We were in a much smaller room that overlooked a vacant lot next door and much construction...No worries...It's New York! It's loud, It's busy! We were fine. The elevator is a little slow, but nothing major. The breakfast is your normal continental fare. We just looked at it as a great morning snack to hold us over till lunch.... a bagel and cream cheese will do the trick. The staff is not overly friendly, but aside from check in and departure we didn't have to deal with them much. And lets all remember...Again, It's New York! Though you may pay $200 plus a night here, it's not the same as $200 in Dallas or Indy. You don't get the same level of staff attention. Think Motel 6 in a SUPER location and you've about got it. Was great for us!

Reviews.Title: “Empire State Building Views”
Reviews.Author: FlyerAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn is in the heart of the Korean District, a 1 min walk from the subway and is in the centre of the fashion district. We chose the Red Roof Inn based on friends recommendations and because it was so much cheaper than anything else we had seen. We were so excited when we arrived to find it so central to everything. The Korean restaraunt next door as great food and a great ambience - also open 24 hours if you feel hungry late at night (try the dumplings!!!). The breakfasts were excellent, the rooms were clean and well serviced..... and the best bit was looking out your window up at the Empire State Building.. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: induway
Reviews.Content: This is truly a find in NYC. It's located on 32nd street, between Broadway and 5th Avenue, on Little Korea street. Tons of great restaurants open 24 hours, close to the Herald Sq subway station, just a short cab ride to Union Square (18th street, $4 cab ride). We have stayed there several times in the past 10 years, and the rooms seem to have been refurbished - marble/granite counter tops, flat screen TV... I don't know if the hotel has free Wifi, but there were enough open networks that Internet access was not a problem. The room had a bit of a cleaner-smell, but everything seemed very clean. The room was not small, enough for a queen size bed, a sitting chair, a desk/chair... I have stayed in MUCH smaller hotels in NYC (this is bigger than the Hudson or any of those other boutique-y hotels). The free breakfast is basic but filling - bagels, cereal, instant oatmeal, donuts, bananas, bread, coffee, juice... But the best part is the location - awesome, busy, fun, great restaurants at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: AlfiePC
Reviews.Content: Red Roof Inn is ideally located. Subway lines all nearby to get you around the city easily. Near to Macy's and madison Sqaure Gardens, Empire State and Penn Station. Times Square is in walking distance. Our room was a good size with a huge comfortable bed. Large flat screen TV, iron and ironing board, coffee making facilties and plenty of towels. Breakfast room is small but we just took it to our room if we couldn't get a seat. There are yoghurts, cereals, bagels, toast, doughnuts and fruit to choose from along with fruit juices and coffee. Was good to be able to have something to eat before exploring the city. Would stay here again as the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: Ann_B37
Reviews.Content: I read all the negative experiences of others in this hotel (bugs, unkind service etc.) and was a bit wary to book it - the price was winning though. And I had to come the conclusion that all the pervious problems have been dealt with. All the rooms are newly decorated, absolutely clean (we booked two rooms so had a basis for comparison), even the smallest ones are spacious in NY terms, there is wireless internet, flat screen TV, coffee maker in the room - we had everything we would expect for a short trip to NY. The service was fine, in fact they helped us a lot with our luggage. The only two issues were slow elevators and of course, the small breakfast room. However the breakfast room was only crowded between 9 and 9:30 AM, so if you get down early or nearer to ten, you'll have a seat. Considering the price and the location, it is a winning place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kitseng
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for New Years and stayed at 2 hotels do to changing number of people in our group. The Red Roof was the second hotel we stayed at and we stayed only for 1 night. We stayed here on Jan 2nd and paid $118 for a 1 bedroom. The room was fairly small but that suits me fine in NY as we are only in the room to sleep, and not very much of that happens either. The room was newly renovated and very clean. Bed was comfortable. The location is top notch, located only blocks from many attractions (empire state, Madison Square Gardens) and very close to the subway station. This is a perfect hotel for a couple coming to New York for a shopping/museum/partying/sight seeing type of trip, probably not for your honeymoon...

Reviews.Title: “Got value for my money! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A.Brouwer
Reviews.Content: What a great place. You can't beat the location: it's on W 32nd street between 5th avenue and broadway with the 34 St Herald Sq subwaystation nearby which is on the orange and yellow lines. Use the 32 street exit. This part of 32nd street is filled with Asian eateries (mainly Korean) and seems home to the Korean community. I felt it is a safe location, I wandered late without feeling uneasy. Penn station and Madison Square Garden are a few blocks further and walking is easy and safe. The hotelstaff is very friendly and professional. Rooms offer free wireless internet and there is free breakfast every morning. Be warned that the breakfastroom is very small and fills up quickly. But you can take your breakfast to your room which has a coffeemaker. During my 6 days I was able to find a table on the first 5 mornings, on my last morning I had breakfast in my room. I was given a large room which had a big plasma tv-screen. There are free papers (NY post, USA today) in the hotellobby. I stayed there for 6 nights and I paid about $800 including tax. I would stay here again on my next visit tot New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Third Christmas stay here.......”
Reviews.Author: VAIslandHopper
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third annual Christmas stay at this hotel. You will not find a better deal in New York City.....Our room on the 16th floor was recently completely redone, and was beautiful. King-size bed, flat-screen TV on the wall, and a view of the Empire State Building. Most importantly, very clean and well maintained. Even though we arrived around 12:30pm, we were immediately checked in. The location itself can't be beat; 2 blocks from Penn Station, 2 blocks from Herald Square, subway right on the corner at Broadway. I can recommend this hotel without any reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller205
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay and had a wonderful experience there as always. We have stayed at this hotel on 6 different occasions in the last 3 years (usually 4 or 5 nights per stay) and can't say enough good things about the cleanliness, the staff and the amenities at this hotel. This time we had an extra pleasant experience as all the rooms have been upgraded and are even better! We are already planning our next trip to New York City and would never stay at any other hotel. The only reason we hesitate to give a glowing review for this hotel is in case it gets too busy and we can't get reservations for the dates we want ! We are having a problem booking for May 2008 as they are already booked for our dates so we may have to change our vacation to the Fall so we can stay at this great hotel. By the way, you can't beat the location - just steps away from the Empire State Building, Macys and subways to any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: vivi1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof from December 2nd to December 3rd. The location was perfect! 5 minutes from Macy's and very close to 5th avenue. I had stayed at this hotel in 2005 and the rooms have been renovated since then. We had a nice size room with two double beds. They also had a nice flat screen television. The bathroom was spotless! The staff was very helpful and they kept our bags in their storage room after we checked out. Check out is at 12pm but we had plans to stay in the city until 3pm so they kept our bags for us. There is also and indoor parking lot a few doors down that you can get a discount at. Just make sure you have the hotel sign your parking ticket. I would definitely stay here again, the price was great and the room was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel Red Roof Inn Manhattan New York”
Reviews.Author: Suz1976
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, superb location, very friendly staff, very clean, nice room, good (complimentary) breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Situation”
Reviews.Author: merlinUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Considering the relatively low price the position of the hotel is excellent, 2 minutes from the Empire State Building, 5 minutes maximum, depending on traffic, from Macy's. Rooms are relatively small but very comfortable, staff are very helpful. Free continental breakfast is very good although the breakfast room is small.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: lucy1038
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel! I have stayed here twice and both times it was fantastic. The first time there were three of us in the room, the second time just two of us but rooms are plenty big with two large double beds and a decent bathroom. Rooms are spotlessly clean with maid service everyday. The staff are very helpful and friendly and there's a great concierge. The hotel also offers a great very reasonable priced shuttle service to the airport. The breakfast is included in the price and it perfectly adequate - fruit, bagels, doughnuts, porridge, tea, coffee, juice. The hotel is very well located in Manhattan, two minutes walk to Macy's and the Empire State Building is literally just around the corner! There is a subway station just on the corner of the street and it is only one stop to Time's Square. Any disadvantages? Well the hotel doesn't have a restaurant but as this is New York city there are plenty of other options in the locality! This certainly is the best value hotel that I know of in Manhattan for the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Red Roof”
Reviews.Author: princesstoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Red Roof Inn on December 3rd. We flew to NYC for the weekend to see a Cirque Du Soleil Show and the Double Dutch Holiday Classic at the Apollo. We arrived at the hotel at 9:45 am hoping there would be a hospitality room for luggage until check in time. The friendly clerk informed us check in was not until 3:00 pm, but checked and our room was available, and allowed us to check in! We had room 705. We had two double beds with super comfy mattresses, flat screen t.v., fridge and micro. Granite vanity in bathroom. The room was spotless. Our room was plenty big. I did see a diagram of the other rooms on our floor and I believe we had the largest room on the floor. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast both mornings. We are early risers and never had to wait for a table. The location of this hotel is great. We walked to Times Sq., Madison Sq. Garden, and of course the Empire State Building, just one block away. We used Air Train and subway to get to thehotel from JFK. This was very easy and convenient. We also took the subway to Harlem which was easy. Warning, it can get very cold in NYC in the Winter. We took the hop on/hop off double decker bus tours with an open top. Be aware there are at least two tour companies that offer these tours. Look to sign up on the tour that offers a covered top deck. We enjoyed the tours, but were chilled to the bone. (Bring long johns) I love NYC! Everybody was very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Staff incredibly unprofessional and confrontational”
Reviews.Author: Holidaygal001
Reviews.Content: Hotel centrally located. Rooms nice & clean. BUT staff are incredibly rude and unprofessional, was shouted at on multiple occasions by front desk staff- including the hotel manager- and threatened after complaining of the unprofessional treatment. Items went missing from the room also. Would most definitely NOT Recommend to anyone. Unpleasant staff at Red Roof Inn Manhattan really put a dampner on the New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMarylander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn for one night, Nov. 17, 2007. Our family rented two rooms with two double beds each for $265. We arrived at Penn Station, just a few blocks away. Our rooms were both very clean, looked recently renovated, and quiet. There were plenty of soft towels in the bathroom. We found the staff to be friendly. The free breakfast was very nice. It included various hot beverages and cold juices, yogurts, cereals, bagels, nuts and dried fruits, oatmeal, and fresh fruits. We were extremely pleased with the quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - super Location”
Reviews.Author: Wecanbeheroesjust41d
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan, from Oct 29 to Nov 3rd and had a fabulous stay. We paid 269 dollars , per night, for a room with 2 double beds. As this was our first time in New York with our family we had asked for a nice, newly decorated room and we were not disappointed. Room had 2 large double beds with Plasma TV, Fridge and Microwave. Room and bathroom were clean and functional. Breakfast Room on 2nd floor, while on the small side, had enough fresh coffee, juice, donuts, breads, cerals, fruit, yogurt to keep you going. The longest we ever had to wait for a table was 5 minutes. It was not waiter service luxury but this is New York and it got the day off to a good start. If you wish, there are plenty of good value breakfast deli's etc close by. There are 2 lifts to serve the 17 floors and they can be slow at times but again we had to wait no more than 3/4 minutes at peak times. For us, having read reviews on this site we became apprehensive in relation to the comments made about poor or indifferent customer service - but we did not experience anything of the sort. In our 6 days in the hotel we interacted with at least 2 hall porters, 5 reception staff , 2 breakfast room staff and 1 room maid. EVERYONE of them , especially the Reception staff (particularily Sam and Rohit) were most courteous and helpful - nothing was a problem from making phone calls at the reception desk, seeking tourist advice,even changing our booking from 5 days starting Sunday to 5 days starting Monday because our airline, Delta were overbooked. The location, just 2 streets behing Macy's on 34th Street could not be better. The hotel recommend a car service to pick us up and drop us back to the airport - a Lincoln town car at a charge of 70 dollars payable directly to the driver. He was extremely punctual and well worth the little extra when compared to an airport Cab. Above all, we felt very welcome at this hotel and we will definately return. Thank you Red Roof Inn and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nellie17
Reviews.Content: After reading many reports about this hotel was not sure what to expect, I am glad to say it exceeded all my expectations. Location was excellent. Check in was fast and efficient and staff were not at all rude as other people mentioned. Given rooms on seventh floor. These were clean and tidy and remained so for our whole stay . I understand the hotel has been recently been renovated and this shows in the rooms.The bathroom was very clean and the beds were really comfortable ( better then our home ones) We went to the breakfast room every day and always managed to get tables even though there was six of us ! There was a good selection of things and my kids enjoyed the doughnuts. I loved the granola so much am even going to try to make it at home. Yes the lifts are slow but you are on holiday just relax and go with the flow. We also used the bar area a most welcome area after a long day sightseeing. The bar man was very cheerful and made a point of remembering our names, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would return again,

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and its location, don't bother with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EwaMac
Reviews.Content: Came to NY for 4 nights (October) to celebrate my birthday with serious sightseeing and shopping thrown in. Found the hotel through venere.com after reading reviews here. Loved its location!!! Did some serious walking and it really felt central to all tourist attractions. Room (402) was great, clean, spacious (King size bed was more than adequate for two friends sharing). 32nd street is noisy, but it can be expected from Midtown Manhattan. Felt very safe walking everywhere, the hotel is 2 min walk from the tube, Macy's and Broadway. Viewing ESB from our room a bonus (32nd street side). "Not so good" bits include faulty air con in the room (on a plus side, it was quiet as it did not work) and I'd not even bother getting to the 2nd floor for breakfast unless you fancy fighting for food/chairs/tables. Fresh fruit and bagels gone in seconds; it is difficult to maintain dignity while balancing coffee mug in one hand and bagel/jam/butter/cream cheese in the other. Instead go to the nearby Bagel Bakery (2 min walk, turn right from hotel) for $4-6 breakfast (hazelnut coffee to die for, hot bagels, pastries, fresh fruit etc) plus plenty of seats upstairs. We did it every morning and started the day as locals do:) The room was pricey, but the location, neighbourhood, views and walking distance compensate for that. Quite helpful staff; we booked a Lincoln limo returning to JFK ($55) - the hotel took a $10 deposit, but provided a receipt, which we handed to our driver (to his displeasure). Three tips: for best views, go to Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Plaza (better than ESB); for best skyscraper outline and truly unforgettable experience - walk across Brooklyn Bridge and turn back when all the lights start coming on, for the overall views take the Circle Line (semicircle tour will be enough to see the Statue of Liberty, Staten Island etc.). I'd recommend the hotel and would return (if they fix the air con:)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Geographer2
Reviews.Content: Three of us (females) just got back from 5 FANTASTIC days in New York City! As to the hotel - it was just perfectly fine. The rooms were smallish (we shared one room) but newly decorated and very clean. The bathroom again, was smallish but more than adequate - we only slept (a few hours a night) and showered there! We also found the continental breakfast to be perfect - just what we needed to start our day. The breakfast room was small, but we were always able to get a table. All of the people that worked there, from front desk to maid service, were very helpful and accommodating - mind you, we treated them with respect and we therefore got it back! And now for the BEST!! Location, location, location! PERFECT! 1 1/2 blocks from Macy's, Empire State Bldg. and subway! Fabulous restaurants right next door - Korean bar be q to die for! The Red Roof Inn gives a great bang for your buck! Will we go back to same hotel? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: debiz4889
Reviews.Content: We got back a week ago from (my) first trip to NYC and were very happy with this hotel. The rooms have all been remodeled and they have Tempurpedic beds, which were very comfortable. We were surprised that there was no fridge/microwave as the website mentioned, but they said that these had been taken out during the remodel. So, they should probably update their website. But the room was great, very comfortable, clean, quiet (as you can get in NYC) and only 2 blocks from the Empire State Bldg. Request a room facing 32nd street (which we had) and you will see the ESB from your room. Staff very pleasant, helpful, friendly. Location is great - pretty centrally located, really. Felt really safe all over the city. A nice 10 block walk to Times Square if you have the energy (which we did our first night!). Macy's is just down a few blocks. Good places to eat all around. Loved New York and will stay here again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, staff surly, breakfast a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: notenoughtime
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for my first trip to NY with sister-in-law and our 2 teenaged daughters. Good points: good location for all attractions, subway and restaurants, clean room and bathroom. Not so good: indifferent and patronising staff at reception - they ripped us off with our taxi to the airport home by taking a deposit which the taxi driver knew nothing of and which they did not return - $10 Breakfast was a nightmare - brings out the worst in people when they are confronted with an over-crowded room, with no where to sit, cheap food and frayed tempers. The only solution was to get what you could and retreat to the safety of your room - this was not an experience you would want on holiday - we've all had experiences like this at school canteensbut it's not what we want in our leisure time! We were in room 608 and located nearby was the ice machine (not working) which was so loud the noise could be heard in our bedroom way down the corridor - it was like sleeping in an engine room. We asked the reception if they would turn it off as it wasn't working anyway, so why put up with the noise, but they ignored our request. All in all, although it wasn't that expensive for NY, the attitude of the staff and the hideous breakfast experience do not make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canton,MI
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our fabulous trip to NYC. We stayed here and had a wonderful time. The hotel appears to be finished with most renovations. We had a 14th floor room with new carpet, vanities, wallpaper and bedding. A very clean hotel room that was also quiet due to the layout of the short hallways. and we got very little street noise also. We did not want to pay for amenities like restaurants, pools, etc and got a great deal from their website at $269/night for 2 adults/2 double beds. Located in Korea town, my sister and I felt very safe the whole time, and we took the subway located less than a block away to anywhere we wanted to go. Times Square is a very short walk, and Broadway shopping is right by the hotel as is the Empire State Building. Breakfast was mostly cereal, rolls, coffee, juice, and fruit. It was fine for our needs and a bonus for us since we didn't want the expense of another meal. Cab fare from LGA was $40. Highly recommend you check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kysstherayne
Reviews.Content: For my son's 10th birthday I took him to NYC. We booked three nights at the Red Roof Inn, primarily because of the location. Once we got there (early) we were checked in quickly and efficiently. Our room was on the 10th floor. Other than very slow elevators (big deal, just plan on spending a few extra minutes waiting for it) the hotel's first impression was fabulous. The room was spotless. We had a coffee maker, hair dryer, all the promised ammenities. Even the bathroom passed the white glove test, and I'm pretty OCD about cleanliness. The weekend we went there was a heat wave and they had even turned the A/C on in the room prior to our arrival. I had requested a room with a view and we got it. At night we could see the Empire State Building. It was fabulous. The people that work there, from the cleaning crew to the front desk were all helpful and pleasant, even helping us with a pizza delivery from the best place in town the last night we were there. My ONLY complaint is that breakfast is included but getting IN to the small room that accomodates it is impossible. They serve from 7 to 10 a.m. and we tried various times, thinking we could escape the crowd, but the room only holds about 10 tables and we ended up having to take the food back up to our room to eat. They DO need to re-think their breakfast accomodations so that ALL their guests can sit down in the morning. We ended up eating out the last day, just so we didn't have to fight the crowd. Other than that, the stay at the Red Roof was exceptional (and very, very safe!). If you book, make sure you ask them about their luxury car to and from the airport!! It's the same price as a cab and a LOT nicer. This hotel's location is PRIME! We walked EVERYWHERE with out any problems. We WILL be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: csapple
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home after our first visit to New York City. We stayed at the Red Roof Inn from 27 Sep to the 5 Oct. I had spent ages and ages searching on the internet for a hotel within our budget for our 8 night stay. I finally reserved a room at this hotel with a fingers crossed attitude. We were very very pleased with our room. The bathroom was very clean and new looking and there were pleantly of clean towels and face clothes. The bed was very comfy with plenty of pillows. We had an iron and Ironing board in the room which is handy and a hairdiyer in the bathroom. I would agree that the the staff at the front desk were not exactly friendly but they were far from rude. Overall we were very happy with our say. We asked the hotel to arrange a car to take us back to Newark airport for our flight home. I would recomend doing this. It didn't cost much more than our taxi in and it took the hastle out of it. The location of this hotel was ideal. Combined with the complimentry breakfast and the clean rooms i think it is a good deal. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicht99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof Inn from Sept 26-30 and was pleasantly surprised. Asked for a room with a view of the Empire State building and received it. Room was clean, nicely decorated and quiet. Other reviewers mentioned that front desk staff were unfriendly; this is quite true, but maids are nice, and since you only have to deal with staff for a brief time, does it really matter anyway. elevator is extremely slow, but one can always make a joke of it with fellow travellers. overall i would highly recommend this hotel;

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience ”
Reviews.Author: eroque
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their website. I was traveling for business; therefore, I used a company card to book the room. I called the reservation line for a Credit Card Authorization form and they faxed one to me and I filled it in accordingly and faxed it directly to the New York hotel (as instructed by the corp offices). I called the hotel to verify receipt of my fax but they were having trouble reading the signature, so I was instructed to simply bring the original copy with me. When I arrived at the hotel, they informed me that the form I faxed in was not the correct form and that they needed the information on their own form. The only difference between the corporate form and the hotel's form was the address cited in the header. Otherwise, all other information was exactly the same, including the Red Roof Inn logo at the top. They insisted that they could not let me into my room without the 'correct' form being filled out. Even though this was through no fault of my own, they insisted that there was 'nothing they could do'. TWell, there was nothing I could do because this was 8 in the evening and my offices were closed. They said they needed my credit card, but all I brought was a check card since this was only a 2 day trip and I could not put the $400/night rate on my check card. After lots of pleading and crying, they eventually let me into my room but only after taking an imprint of my check card and after I promised to get my company to fax in the 'correct' form first thing in the morning. Will NEVER be staying at this hotel because of this HORRIBLE HORRIBLE customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel Choice For Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CanadaOttawa
Reviews.Content: I live in Canada and was visiting NYC , stayed there for 5 nights starting Sept. 2, 2007. Since I had asked for the best view possible they gave me the top floor (Room 1702) with great views of the Empire State Bldg, and the Chrysler Bldg roof. It was clean, comfortable, newly renovated, and had all the amenities you would expect for a hotel in that price range. I had compared it with other NYC hotels, and I wasn't disappointed. The included breakfast was good, with free newspapers to read each morning. I loved the location, ate at good korean restaurants on that street, and it was only a short walk to the subway, bus, Macy's, and the Manhattan mall, with easy access to everywhere. The hotel only has a few rooms on each floor. The only negative was that there was a noisy mechanical device in the hallway across from the elevator that I could hear in my bedroom. All in all though, I recommend this hotel, and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: b12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan for two nights at the end of August. This was my second time in NYC (the first time was at the Pennsylvania Hotel) and I am very satisfied from my stay at this hotel. The hotel is very well located, only a few blocks away from Times Square, one block away from the Empire State Building. There is also the orange subway line right at the corner of the street. The red & blue lines are two to three blocks away. My only complaints are that there are only two elevators that service 17 floors so it takes a while to catch it, and there water pressure in the hotel is very low. Otherwise, everything was how I expected it; the rooms were very clean & average size. It`s not easy to find an affordable room in Manhattan. Red Roof Inn was the only hotel that offered a room for less than 250$ a night. Our first night was 194$ and the second night 249$. The only hotel that came close to that was the Pennsylvania at 249$ for both nights. Parking is available at 26$ per day. To park you need to go around the block and park at a place called Parking System. It's an underground parking in front of the Radisson on W 32nd street & Broadway. Once your car is parked you need to get your ticket stamped by the reception at the hotel, or else it will be 48 $ per day!!! It's important to get a clean room when staying in Manhattan. I researched many hotels before and made sure we got a reputable place before making the reservation. Word of advice, avoid the Carter Hotel and the New York Inn.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of renovating the lower floors.”
Reviews.Author: Linna49
Reviews.Content: We asked to be above the 15 th floor which had already been renovated. This was a tip from one of your reviews. The room was very clean and everthing was new. Good deal for New York. The breakfast room was very small but they were starting renovations just two days before we left. This meant we had to eat breakfast in the teeny tiny lounge area. You need to be there early.... Everyone was quite friendly and when the renos are complete it will be a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “red roof still the best!!”
Reviews.Author: goonerific
Reviews.Content: this was my 5th time to stay in the red roof inn manhattan and my second review which i feel it deserves since it has been a couple of years since i stayed here last. we arrived in after a red-eye from vegas at 9.45 in the morning. we figured they wouldn't have the room ready so we just asked would it be possible to leave our luggage in somewhere until we could come back later. the gentleman on the desk replied he may have a room ready shortly if we were willing to pay a $50 early check-in fee,no problem,we were wrecked from travelling so waited in the lobby for 10 minutes until he called me back. he said he had a room ready and would waive the early check-in fee(i like to think he recognised me from my previous stays!"!!). he said it was on the 9th floor,away from the noise of the garbage trucks/sirens etc. which i found strange as we'd stayed on lower floors before and it never bothered us before. we went to our room to be pleasantly surprised by the newly refurbished decor.they've done a great job,almost everything was brand new. we bedded down for a few hours and it was only a few hours later when we headed out that we realised why we were put up high,floors 3/4 and 5 were all being gutted and redecorated so they obviously didn't want to have us disturbed by the noise. we spent 5 nights there and we seen little in the way of disruption barr a couple of times were only one lift was in operation because the builders were using them to get rid of rubble etc.the day before we left we got a call from the desk asking about my travel plans for the following day and if we needed a taxi to the airport,a nice touch given i've never seen them do this before and they're obviously trying hard to make up for any disruption.check out was a breeze. overall another great stay,great value,great location and obviously i'm a fan and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “FAMILY FRIENDLY...”
Reviews.Author: travelmommy2
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the Inn after spending two nights and a day. The process of finding a place to stay was highly stressful because our children are young (5 and 7 yrs.old)and safety and cleanliness was top priority along with a limited budget. After reading literally hundreds of reviews, I found the reviews written about the red roof to be the most postive. We were very happy !! We arrived at Port Authority and took the Metro to Penn Station, once at Penn we were able to walk to the Inn, it's that close! Checking in was effortless and in fact it was even cheaper than what was quoted to me over the phone (use AAA if you have membership). The gentleman at the front desk was very pleasant. Our room was not large but it was clean and newly renovated. I was worried about air quality and bathroom cleanliness. We stayed on a non-smoking floor and there was not a hint of cigarette smoke. The bathroom was spotless. The only downside was the veeery sloooow elevators. Lots of construction work going on and there are only two elevators. One is used for patrons and the other is for construction. We used the stairwell once so that is an option. It was really nice to leave the hustle and bustle of Times Square by settling down in a quiet room, we did not have a view,not an issue with us. Overall, I recommend the Red Roof Inn to those who are traveling with children and have a limited budget. We plan to return next summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: leo28
Reviews.Content: I wanted to be walking distance from the sights, but I didn't want to spend a lot of money. After researching my options I booked this hotel. When I arrived I was upgraded to a bigger room and it was $10 less than the price I secured on their website. The room was functional. It had an iron, hair dryer, and coffee maker which are musts when I travel. The entire floor was getting a make over (new furniture, matresses, etc) on the day I chekced out so I'm sure it's even better now. You can't beat the location. We even walked to the train station just down the block to catch our train to Philly.

Reviews.Title: “BAD customer service”
Reviews.Author: TorontoehCanada
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, really good location. But Customer service is awful, minus the ladies which help with tours. They were awesome! We got screwed over when booking through another website for this hotel. Said we were no shows, but we were there for 2 nights and paid for them. But also paid 211 cdn dollars for a no show night. Customer service to resolve this was NOT acceptable. Argued on the phone. Talked down to me. Didn't believe a word I said, when all I wanted was my money back that was charged for something that was untrue. Overall, decent, rooms a little small, and the breakfast room was tiny and couldn't get a seat. Suggestion, Don't book online through another company for this hotel, cause they may just double charge you anyways.

Reviews.Title: “close to all”
Reviews.Author: teenager_family
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable- we were 5 in a room- a bit tight but tolerable. From the outside this hotel looks much less impressive than it really is! Nice lobby and breakfast room, clean and noise proof. Rooms large for NYC. Nice breakfast included. Street atmosphere not great (the first few minutes the smells of last night's Asian cooking overwhelm you) but close to everything important. Some really nice Deli's & restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Yay Red Roof Inn!”
Reviews.Author: GAtravelerATL
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! We paid $179 a night (which really ended up being about $210 after all the taxes and whatnot), and could not have been happier. The location was PERFECT. I never felt unsafe, even walking around at 4 a.m., which was one of my major concerns with the city itself. We stayed 3 nights on the 15th floor, which is newly remodeled. They are remodeling from the top floor down, and they are working on the 8th floor currently, I believe. The room was nice, very clean, and I am assuming fairly large by NYC standards. We had maid service and fresh towels every morning, and the free breakfast was a great way to get the day started. We were within close walking distance of two subway stations as well as the Empire State building and plenty of shops, and there was never a shortage of cabs outside the front door. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel bar/lounge (while extremely cheesy) was a nice place to relax. The bartender was wonderful and we gave him way too much of our money during our stay! We were a $5 cab ride away from Times Square when there was traffic, but it is only 10 blocks if you walk it. Overall, great location, wonderful accomodations - just don't go there if you are expecting luxury. Luxury it is not, but it is a great value for a nice place to stay in a good location in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Front office staff & the Manager we met could take a lesson in Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: ajmoScotland
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we booked this hotel. Our 20th Wedding Anniversary and 1st visit to the USA. I e-mailed explaining both and asking for a quiet room with a good view. The reply from the Hotel was our request would be passed to the GM. We arrived at the hotel after our long flights (as we travelled via Amsterdam) to be met by a severe receptionist. (no hint of a welcome smile) ok she may have been having a bad day but was that our fault! We were given our key and told our room was on the 12th floor. Yes, we waited ages for the lift, when it arrived the other one opened at the same time and we were met by a builder and a full skip. Passing the 8th floor drilling- hoped that was not going to continue. Opened our room door to see the tiniest, dingiest room but it was clean and if we had planned to spend much time in it (which we did not) then we certainly weren't now. It looked over the side Room 1210. Was too tired to bother mentioning it to receptionist( her attitude didn't exactly lend itself to her giving a damn anyway) On the plus side it was quiet and the maids were really cheerful & happy people. The breakfast was really good too. Beware though if you have a problem the manager we spoke to should visit a charm school. My husband accidently lost our safe deposit box key at the Yankees Game or somewhere on the day we went to the game. We held our hands up and were told that he would have to pay$125. Ok but we had to see the General manager the next day at 12.30. So we stayed in our room till then as OUR money was in the box- went down to meet the manager, fobbed off with he was busy and had we really looked properly! Manager would see my husband at 1pm, back to room back down in lift at 1pm waited , waited and waited manager not available. Come back at 2pm. Finally turned out that the reception person told us they had a spare key (not true). Manager had to arrange for someone to break open our box- bearing in mind the hotel was full of workmen why did we have to wait so long? We were only in New York for 5 days. Spent half our penultimate day waiting for the Manager. We have both been employed in hotels within the UK and if we treated our visitors like this we would not be employed. Such a shame to make a real meal out of a genuine error. Having said all this we would stay at an applecore hotel but not this one unless they change their manager and front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay right in the middle of Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: ct_roy_nyc
Reviews.Content: Location Right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. The location is top notch for the price. An excellent spot in Koreatown - perfect for walking to all the main shopping districts (Macy's and 5th avenue are literally around the corner) The location is the distinct advantage for anyone coming to NYC for the first time. The Room We stayed on the 16th Floor with a view of the Empire State building. (at the suggestion of another review here we requested this upon check in). The room was excellent and well air conditioned. It was one of the rooms that has been recently refurbished. They're refurbishing floor by floor from the 17th down (they're down to the 11th floor now). The elevator did take a long time to get down to the lobby at peak times but that's only a small price to pay for the view! The Staff Overall, they were pleasant. They could be a bit more helpful but I wouldn't have said they were rude. Breakfast Standard fare - nice coffee and OJ.
