Overall, I'd highly recommend the Red Roof and will stay there again next time I'm visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hixona
Reviews.Content: We had a decent size room that was clean. Not the greatest view from the back of building, but we were not in the room very much. The bathroom had no towel racks and very limited counter space. The convenience to the subway and time square is wonderful. I felt very safe at all times when walking around the hotel. We came back 1 night to a find several fire engines in front of the hotel. A firefighter was standing in one of the elevators. There was a small fire on the 5th floor, but it did not go any farther than the smokers shirt.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: mfgn
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a surprise. Went because of tripadvisor's reviews, and it was OK. The room is big for New York Standarts and confortable, the rate was the cheapest I could find in a resonable hotel( It was Saint Patric's Day and I didin't know). Very well located with a subway station 50 mt nearby. Do not expect luxury. Hotel front desk staff is not simpatetic

Reviews.Title: “Very good 3* hotel, downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JustbackfromZante
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our trip to wonderful NYC where we spent 1 night in June at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan. Location is great while in the middle of Koreatown and right next to the Empire State Building. Hotel is nice, convenient for a short and affordable stay. We've booked through the hotel website and hab a Business King, non-smoking. Upon arrival, we asked for a quiet room on the upper floor, which was provided (room 1603) and was great with a view of the Empire Building itself! Amazing view also by night. Room was big, with 25" TV, A/C and bathroom with everything you need. It's not the Ritz but you got something good anyway. Breakfast room isn't big but ok if you go early as we did (around 8am). Food is good so you have a good start of your day. Had no problems with elevators. Front desk staff is ok and friendly enough to enjoy your stay. In fact, we would recommend this hotel to stay in central NYC and Manhattan, with all the good attractions nearby. Go up to the Empire State Bldg as you got an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “elevator is frustrating”
Reviews.Author: MLFMarshfield
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Red Roof Inn in NYC. We stayed there last year and it was fine so we went again this time. It smells of roach spray which was new, and they apparantly have no service elevator so you usually have to squeeze in with a maid and her cart or a janitor and his junk! I know it's not a fancy hotel but for $239 a night you don't need to have to deal with that. It's OK, room is clean and overall just a place to sleep when you are in the city. The Tudor Hotel seems to be alot nicer for just a little more money, we will go there next time. TIP: feel free to use the rooftop bar at LaQuinta across the street! They are owned by the same company, not that anyone asks you anything when you walk in...it's a nice place to have a beer outside on a pleasant night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, but just passable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DojoBerkeley
Reviews.Content: This hotel, or at least my room, was much more run-down than it looks in the pictures. I was traveling for work and they could never get their wireless or wired internet to work in my room. So I had to pirate off of local wireless routers. The room is tiny (which is normal for NYC). Free breakfast is not fancy, but saves you buying breakfast each morning. Being in Koreatown was cool. Good food and subways close by. But I will likely not return to this Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: garryJ
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this property during the Memorial day weekend 2007. The hotel is located in the heart of Korean town. I didn't take avantage of the free breakfast, but the room was clean, the bathroom was also above average. The hotel was in a good location just blocks from the train station(we took the train up from Washington DC) and from times square and the theaters. The only negative was the internet didn't work . This hotel is a good value and great location. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria35
Reviews.Content: As always I was totally satisfied with my stay at Red Roof/ Manhattan. I requested a room facing the street and although it can be a bit loud due to traffic late at night, I always request a room facing the street to enjoy the "view." I arrived hours prior to check-in time and was given a key to my room. The room was very neat and clean. If you ever need anything for your room just ask one of the housekeepers; they are quite friendly and helpful! This stay was my first time trying the breakfast buffet. The bagels and donuts were fresh and I was glad I stopped in for a quick snack. I have been staying here for years and have yet to be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn delivers service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: evzona
Reviews.Content: Well situated,in front of Empire State Building. Very good reception,concierge and house-keeping service. Breakfast sets you up for the day. Can recommend with confidence...having previously been spoilt by staying at more expensive luxury hotels like The Plaza and The Mark.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: MegSydney
Reviews.Content: After reading several other reviews about Hotel rooms in NYC I was a bit worried but the room we received exceeded my expectations. We had plenty of space and just out the window was a view of the Empire State; I spent the first 15 mins talking about how I could now see the real Empire State outside my window!! The bathroom was clean and all facilities worked OK. The breakfast room was small and we often had to poach tables to be able to sit, although other guests appeared to take their food back into their rooms - a pretty good idea. The lady at the tour reservation desk was not really very helpful but the reception staff were helpful. An absolutely great location an easy walk to Penn Station and Macy’s just around the corner…. I thought over all great value for what we received and have had friend stay here on our recommendation with the same response.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingeralice22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the red roof inn for 4 nights in april and i would recommend it to anyone staying in new york as a tourist. It was good value for money and clean. The best thing about the red roof is its location though, we were able to walk from the hotel to all the main tourist spots in the city. being so close to fifth avenue meant we also found it easier to navigate back too when we were all the way up or downtown. the staff were helpful and friendly and we will definetly come back again. Our only issue was the heater in our room, when we were there it was pretty cold (and we came from england!) and the heater was very loud, meaning we couldnt have it on while we slept. next time i will come back in the summer and will stay at the red roof again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place..but a couple of things you should read”
Reviews.Author: yuna1971
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Red Roof Inn . It is based in the heart of Manhattan, around the block from Macy's and Penn Station (for Amtrak and Metro services) a straight walk up the street!! The room was fine. I asked for a smoking room and that is what I got, I also asked for a quiet one - not facing the street and again, got what i wanted. What disappointed me somewhat was the air conditioning unit in the room after a minute or two blew out warm/hot air. This was slightly uncomfortable but as we were out mostly sightseeing, it wasnt worth complaining about. The staff whilst not unfriendly, were not that chatty or helpful either. For instance, when we were given the room - they never told us the floor or where abouts it was or asked the baggage man to help us with our bags. We wanted to change up our travellers cheques - they told us that they were too busy and to go to Macys - this was the first day, no indication of where it was, which direction to head in etc. Overall, the hotel is fine. But the staff really do need to "care" abit more about the customers they recieve as it is us that give them their business and without would probably see it lose out to other hotels and vastly slide down the tripadvisor scale.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: tritentrue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 5 nights. The hotel has two elevators, used by both guests and staff, which made for some long waits and crowded rides. On the one day in which I stayed in my 13th-floor room for much of the daytime (due to the weather), there was heavy demolition work being done on the 14th floor, continuing until after 8 p.m. Additionally, there were times when one elevator was locked off for the workers, leaving only one elevator for guests and staff, meaning waits of as much as 15 minutes or more. There was no advance notification of this disruptive event. The ice machines on the 10th and 12th floors were not working, so I had to remove a tarp from the one on the 14th floor each time I used it. The heater/air conditioner in my room had two options: off or on, leaving the room too cold at times, too warm at others. Of the five days I was there, I was able to find seating in the overcrowded breakfast room only once. On the bright side, houskeeping and bell staff were pleasant, and the car service to the airport was timely. Unfortunately this was far from enough to balance the negatives. I won't stay at this hotel again and I do not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Repack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, paid $199+tax on Apr. 17.I arrived early and no problem checking in. The location is great and is located in Koreantown. The room size was OK, but had too many problems with the room. First, the table lamp wasn't working, then the bedsheet had some kind of jam on it, disgusting and the sink in the bathroom was clogged. Never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “secret gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: mangomama28
Reviews.Content: secret hidden gem in koreatown--right near a TON of delicious restaurants, including the delicious pinkberry frozn yogurt! my husband and i bought some and brought it back to our clean, comfy room to enjoy for an evening snack. easy access for subway and our room (king sized bed) was pretty spacious and immaculately clean--and I am TERRIBLY snobby about bathrooms, but this passed all my tests. hotel staff was above and beyond pleasant and i would stay here again in a heartbeat. very close to shopping and we had an amazing view of the empire state bldg too. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: NadineEtClaude
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Roof for the Easter weed-end and I really enjoyed my stay. The service was excellent: we had a problem with the ventilation and it has been fixed within 1 hour. There is a tourist office on-site that help us to find restaurants and attractions in town. It was clean and not noisy at all. The location is great: 5 minutes walk to Empire State Building and 20 minutes walk to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “very bad!”
Reviews.Author: holland1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel manager said: O yeah, we are charging you another $150.- for the kingsize beds and the 4 people. A terrible rip off, while the reservation was already made and paid. He just charged the credit card!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Red Roof Inn Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: rphsweet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan and we really enjoyed it! The breakfast was great and we were able to get a table as long as we got there by 7:30 every morning. We were able to walk wherever we wanted pretty much from the location the hotel was in. The area felt safe no matter what time we were walking to or from the hotel. Our checkout process was very quick. We heard very little noise since we were up on the 13th floor. Our kids enjoyed the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: sparknut
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel without a Problem. Parking garage located about a block away! Very Friendly staff. The TV didn't work but oh well we were exhausted anyway and didn't have energy to watch. We did let them know and they wanted to fix it but we told them it was no big problem!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Cheap 'n' Cheerful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fi&ad
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in this hotel for six days from March 9th - March 16th. Check in staff were curteous (not over friendly) and swift. We requested a non-smoking room with a view of the Empire State Building - we got our view but it was in a smoking room on the 6th floor. The smell was unbearable and after one night we requested a room change. This was done with no complications or hassle and we were moved to a room on the 14th floor which was at the back of the hotel so there was no street noise which was great. The free breakfast in the hotel was brilliant - loads of choice and we ate there everyday. The location was second to none and just around the corner from Macy's!! The interior of the hotel is a bit dated but they are doing the hotel up floor by floor at the moment beginning at the top and working their way down. Check out was a little delayed as a big group was checking out at the same time as us (the hotel is very popular for large groups of Amercian school/college students). The only problem I had with the hotel was that they booked us a car to JFK airport through a car company which they use (not a yellow cab) and they told us it would cost $55 dollars and we paid a $10 deposit to the hotel which left the fare at $45. When we arrived at the airport the driver attempted to charge us $60 but we did not pay him. He then demanded $55, we were in a rush so we gave it to him but in charging us $55 he lost out on his tip. I emailed the hotel to complain about this 1 week ago but so far have not had a response. Other than that we had a pleasant stay at Red Roof Inn and are already planning our next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but no wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: ExDirectory
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn in Manhattan was great value and comfortable. The rooms are a good size for New York. The complimentary breakfast was fine and very convenient. The location is great for central NYC. My only complaints were the lack of wireless internet and the lack of action from any of the staff to fix it. Their attitude was "its free so you can't complain if you can't get it". I tried in my room, in the lobby and in the bar. I frequently visit New York but with no wireless internet this hotel is not good for business use.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: jamidodger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Roof Inn from the 8th-12th March 2007 and must say that we found this hotel to be absolutely fine in every respect and even excellent in some. The location couldn't be better, 10 mins (max) walk from Penn Station, 2 mins from subway and Empire State. The check in staff were very polite and efficient and the decor and general look of the place was good. Our room on the 12th floor was clean and plenty spacious enough for our stay, and had a great view of the Empire State! The bathroom was clean and the shower good. The free breakfast was more than enough to keep you going 'till lunchtime, but the breakfast room could get a little busy- no real problem though. There was a free gym which looked ok too. We paid $164 per night which I thought was reasonable and I would definitely recommend the Red Roof and would return again if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: settogo06
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable rooms. The bathroom was spotless and plenty of hot water. Free breakfast has a good choice of food and there was plenty of it. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, cheap and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: jody2412
Reviews.Content: Located across the Rd from the Empire State and 1 block from Macys. It is in the Korean District but DO NOT be put off. Excellent value for money it does not serve food but a buffet style cold breakfast is available in the mornings. The breakfast room does get busy but apart from that a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: lwlwl
Reviews.Content: I had an awful stay at the Red Roof Inn. My reservation got screwed up multiple times. While I was in transit to New York, someone from the hotel called me to say that there were no rooms available for me. I was sharing a room with two other people, who had already checked in when I arrived (I guess our room was available after all...). However, when I got to the hotel, they could not find the names of my companions in their computer system and checked me in seperately, charging me for an additional room. When I tried to get all of this straightened out, one member of the front desk staff was incredibly rude to me. He refused to answer my questions and mocked me for being concerned about being charged for a room I wasn't staying in. He actually said "It's just money, it's not the end of your life." Eventually I was able to speak to the manager, who did remove the extra charges after a lengthy discussion. He was very intimidating and initially maintained that I was at fault for the mixup. But he eventually agreed to charge me only a reservation cancellation fee. For a reservation that I never should have had! But I gave up at that point, as I was only being charged $30 extra rather than $300. Dealing with this situation ate up several hours of my trip to New York, and pretty much ruined the whole trip for me. As for the hotel itself, it was in a good location, but it was run-down and somewhat dirty. The wallpaper was peeling and the carpet had holes in it. It was definitely NOT worth the price I was paying (even when I was charged for only one room!) I later wrote a complaint to the Red Roof Inn parent company about the problems with my reservation and the outrageous response of the front desk staffer. Following my complaint, I received a phone call from the manager of the hotel, who berated me for contacting the company instead of him and told me that what I had said about the front desk staff couldn't possibly be true. I was in tears by the end of the phone call. He asked me to contact Red Roof Inn again to tell them that he had helped me and that he had fixed every problem that I brought to his attention. While it's true that he helped me to fix the problems I had, I thought that his response to my complaint was very inappropriate. Needless to say, I will not be staying at that hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Good Room”
Reviews.Author: Kristen1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect choice for us. We had an excellent rate and we were in walking distance from a lot of attractions/subway station. The free breakfast is great b/c everyone knows that NYC can get pretty expensive so it was nice not having to pay for a breakfast. The staff was fine they didn't go out of their way for us but they were not rude. The room was clean but on the small side, however figured most NYC rooms would be on the small side. The size of the room was not a big problem considering you really don't spend much time in the room anyways. I would definitely stay here again if I return to NYC any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: jrzgirl
Reviews.Content: What a deal. My husband and I wanted to stay overnight in the city since we were going to a concert and planned to make a night of it. We didn't want to spend a lot though. After reading MANY reviews of cheaper hotels in the MSG area, we chose the Red Roof Inn because of the many good reviews. From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but inside it looks recently renovated. Our room overlooked the city and was nicely updated and clean. The bathroom wasn't as updated as everything else, but it was still decent. When we decided to order a pizza at 1:30am, the front desk was helpful with telling us who to call. I believe we booked the room for $129! We were within easy walking distance to Madison Square Garden, and had we chosen to spend the day in the city to sightsee (we're from Jersey!) it was a wonderful location for that as well. Close to the Empire State and Chrysler building. I highly recommend this hotel if you're on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “don´t sleep there!”
Reviews.Author: Annabella2007
Reviews.Content: This place is expensive and a real [--] . everything is used up, cracked and the room was really dirty. The bath room was a nightmare and the surrounding of the hotel is very touristic and loud. The interieur is used up, the bed was like a hammock. dont go there. I had to sleep there for 2 nights and it wasnt good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: readymade
Reviews.Content: I booked a DDBL room for $149 the first night and $119 additional nights. I called the day before to add my sister's name to the room. She arrived before me and there was no problem. I ended up arriving a day later because of the big snowstorm. I called about parking and was told it was next door. This is false. It's at the beginning of the block, at 32nd and Broadway. It was $28/nite, more if you have an SUV. You drive in, they park it and retrieve it for you. Show your call tag to the front desk to get the hotel rate; they'll put a sticker on it (the parking is handled completely separately). Room was small but adequate, and clean. Free hi-speed was intermittent and unreliable. Breakfast on the 2nd floor was OK--donuts, bagels, yogurt. Also free Red Bulls if you like that. There's a sign up saying don't take food to room, which is ridiculous because the breakfast room is too small. Front desk staff all had thick accents. I think they were south Asian. Not particularly friendly or helpful, but they did their job. Housekeepers were friendly. Location is great. At the end of the block is the 34th St. Subway stop with many different lines. The neighborhood is lousy with restaurants and drugstores, including a 24 hour Walgreen's up on 5th and 33rd. By the way, the hotel is much closer to 5th than to Broadway or 6th. I'd stay here again if I got a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and arrogant front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBoston-7
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to New York City and have stayed in a variety of hotels and I never encountered such rude and arrogant front desk staff. This is a basic hotel in a good location, but the attitude of the staff ruined my stay and put a damper on my visit to New York. To put it simply, we arrived around 1 p.m. on a Sunday and asked if we could check in early because at 3 p.m. check-in time, we would be at a Broadway matinee. The indifferent desk clerk looked up my reservation, shrugged and said no, but we were allowed to leave our bags. We returned to the hotel around 9:30 p.m. and were told that our reservation had been cancelled AND that the hotel was sold out and no rooms were available! It was a cold February night and we were staggered! The reservation had been made through Quikbook, a hotel reservation website, and nowhere had it been mentioned that at 6 p.m. the reservation would be cancelled without a credit card. (Quikbook had given us a hotel confirmation number). The card on file at Quikbook had been declined, but I had not intended to use it. It was the rude attitude of the staff that shocked us. After some haggling, they said, well, there are rooms after all and quoted a rate that was $60 a night more than the reservation. After we argued some more, they finally gave us a room for $30 more a night. The customer service was really appalling. Needless to say, I will not be staying in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Bleiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Red Roof Inn Feb2 - Feb 6. We booked it also through their website - and the rate was 109,99 USD plus Tax.!! I think this price is unbeatable in the heart of NYC. We did a lot of the attractions by feet - but the Metro station (34th Street) is only a few steps away. It is located just around the corner of Macy's and the ESB. We had a room on the 15th Floor with a straight view of the ESB. Amazing. It was -2 F outside, but our heating worked very good. Everything is clean and nice. The breakfast buffet (fruits, jelly, cream cheese, cranberries, rasins, nuts, apples, bananas, bagels, donuts, cereal, toast, juice, pastries, cappuchino, jogurt, skim/whole milk) is included!!! ...but around 9 a.m. it is a bit crowdy in the room - but who cares ;-) It was our 5th stay in NYC (a we already stayed at the Waldorf Astoria!!) but this Hotel is perfect - we will go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: gracefitz00
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru the red roof inn website which is lower than that of apple core hotels. We stayed here for 5 nites.The rate of $175 excluding taxes for a double double room was amazing. There were 3 of us and the 2 bed room was ideal. The room was extremely spacious on the 9th floor. It overlooked an apartment building and there was NO street noise whatsoever. The only gripe: the was a draft from the windows! since it was below freezing this was a pain! Although the heating system was adequate, once we fell asleep, the place overheated! When heating turned off, it was too cold! It didnt matter too much as we were only there at nite! DO NOT USE THE BEDROOM PHONE FOR INTERNATIONAL CALLS! we were charged 27 bucks for a 5 minute call. Housekeeping excellent, we tipped about 2-3 dollars per day. They did a great job! Breakfast in the hotel is great! We were there on a budget and ate the hotel breakfast every morning. We were there early around 7-7.30am. We always found a table. If you leave it later than 8am it gets crowded. Location of this hotel is AMAZING! Macys & ESB extremely close as is Penn station. In the centre of everthing on west 32nd street. Taxis very easy to get on this st also. We walked to the nearer attractions. Go to ESB early to avoid queues. Use busses and subways, check out the MTA website. For 2 bucks you can go allover nyc! I would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: reipan
Reviews.Content: We (four women) stayed there January 18-22, 2007. We had a great time! What a deal the room was! We had requested a room on a higher level (to see the Empire State Building), but when we could get a refrigerator and microwave, we opted for the double bed room on the third floor. Our view overlooked a patio roof top next to a Gym and Apratment Buildings across the street. It was not bad. We were happy because we had very little street noise as opposed to the front of the hotel. The room was very clean. We ate the free continental breakfast two of the four mornings. We chose the Carnagie Deli for Sunday brunch (great choice) and a bagel shop/deli 1/4 block from the hotel this morning just to do something before we checked out. The hotel is two blocks from Penn Station, two stops from Time Square. The first day we walked to Time Square (10 blocks) Macy's is two blocks north, the Manhattan Mall is on your way to Penn Station. The area the hotel is in (Koreantown) is a good location because restaurants are open 24 hours so there are always people around. When I go back again, I am staying there again! FYI--the cab fare from Rockefeller Center to the hotel for four was less than four one-way subway ticket ($6 verses $8, we made it $8 with a tip!) Thanks to all the reviewers on Trip Advisor for your help in making my trip a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: R&RWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the best deal in New York City!!! We found the hotel very clean and extremely well appointed. Very handy for all attractions especially the Empire Stae Building which we could see right outside our bedroom window.... what a view!!! The breakfast was more than adequate especially when you consider that most hotels make you pay for the breakfast. It meant that we could start sightseeing that much earlier and saved us some money!! We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: CanOz11
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at the value this centrally located hotel offers. New York hotel prices can be extreme but the Red Roof was excellent. Room looks small at first but you don't spend much time there anyway. Interesting view of the Empire State Building. Entrance to 34th street subway at the end of the block was a bonus. Walkable distance from Times Square. A bit of noise from the street throughout the night and in the morning but it is New York ... and still managed a good night sleep. Comfortable beds. Clean but slightly dated bathrooms. Excellent concierge/bellboys ... very friendly. Will stay here again on my next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: whits1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 4 nights and was very pleased with the hotel. Room was a good size for a New York hotel, and was cleaned daily, with the towels also being changed. Great location. I will stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAD215
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this website and I was hoping not to be disappointed and I was not! My mom and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in late September 2006 and we researched alot before we left for our first time in NYC. From when we first arrived at the hotel and welcomed by a very nice porter then the front desk staff was very friendly and pointed out the concierge desk and the amenties of the hotel. Our room was a business king and it was spacious (consdiering the amount of luggage that was great), clean and airy. We had requested a view of the Empire State Building and that is what we got and also a view of an office building right across the way. The breakfast room was a little small and the selection was a normal cont. breakfast, nothing over the top. You are supposed to eat in the breakfast room, but it was too small so we would bring the food back to the room. We used the concierge to book a car back to the airport and that was a great deal. We also got maps from her that helped alot during our trip. The porter was the same when we checked in as when we checked out. They stored the luggage for us with no problem and he is warm and friendly. We plan on going back in May '07 and we will use the same hotel. Very close to everything and where you catch the subway I recommend sitting in the park and eating peanuts from the vendor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Place!”
Reviews.Author: heyyou65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our 2nd wedding anniversary trip to NY. We wanted to see all of the sites in 3 days and we did see a TON! This hotel was centrally located only blocks from Times Square, and was the best value! We requested a room high enough and facing the Empire State (only one block over) the view was fantastic! The room was BIG (especially for NYC) and had everything we needed. We felt safe as well. I would go to this hotel again for the bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: lightninglady
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, the price for the service is outstanding. Free Continental breakfast, free wireless, and I had a fabulous view of the Empire State building...convenient to uptown or downtown...it ain't the Ritz but dollar for dollar this is the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: oleiros
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 17-20, 2006. The room was great - stayed in a room with two double beds, size of the room was good. Room also had coffee maker, fridge and microwave, as well as a tv. The staff were friendly, especially the porter who held our bags until we checked in and after when we checked out until we left by a cab to LaGuardia (which was arranged by the hotel too - $45 with tolls). Paid US$139 for the room. Breakfast was good - bagels, toast, oatmeal, juices, coffee, fresh fruit and donouts. Location was excellent, steps from Macy's, Penn Station and the Empire State Building. Street where the hotel is has lots of Korean restaurants and shops, a bit on the unsightly side compared to other places nearby. But always felt safe. Highly recommended, excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Spot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sstark
Reviews.Content: Awoken at 4:30AM with vulgar language and heated arguement with threats of killing someone in the hallway. When I attempted to call the front desk for help, I found the phone next to the bed to be dead. I called the front desk long distance from my cell phone and asked for help. No one ever came and we were too scared to leave the room. This went on for over an hour when finally the fight calmed down. When I went to check out and spoke with the front desk the best they could say was that they were sorry my stay was interupted. Obviously, this must not be an uncommon occurance here. I would not considere this place for anyone travelling with children or not of strong heart.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: synnove
Reviews.Content: We (3 friends) stayed at the Red Roof Inn in late November 2006 for 7 nights. Location of the hotel is fantastic, as has been stated here several times. The subway station is very close, as are Macy's, Madison Square Garden and Empire State Building. The area is bustling with life as the hotel is in Koreatown (ie. on 34th St between 5th and 6th Avenue). We had made the booking at the hotel website stating we would be 3 adults. As the reservation confirmation included this information we assumed the reservation and rate had been calculated for 3 adults. However, when we checked in the clerk said there would be only one king-size bed, ie. a room for 2 adults. He basically said that the Internet system cannot be trusted in this type of special cases and we should have been in contact with the hotel staff in person. Fortunately we were able to get a slightly bigger room which would accommodate an extra bed (at an extra cost). We were pleasantly surprised with the room as it was very spacious. The extra bed fitted there well and we could all still keep our luggage opened on the floor. The decor is old and the room is slightly rough on the edges, but as such it was basically what we had expected. The room included a king-size bed, extra bed, desk, closet, tv table, fridge, chair, coffee maker. The bathroom was spacious as well and there was soap, shampoo and conditioner available. It was clean and made actually a better impression than the room itself. But although there was a bath tub it really was not inviting enough to actually take a bath. It was a pleasant surprise to have breakfast included in the price but on the last couple of mornings we were getting quite tired with the selection. The breakfast consisted of white bread and bagels, apples, bananas, porridge, coffee/tea, apple/orange juice, donuts and on bread you could take jelly/butter/cream cheese. The breakfast room is small and it got very crowded towards 9 am. We usually went there at 8 am and had no problems finding an empty table. In all, it was a basic tourist hotel and you get what you pay for. Thus the experience was pretty much what we had anticipated. However, it seems that better deals can be found and I think I will look for another hotel in the same price range the next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: H&SP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn for 7 nights around Thanksgiving. I had done a lot of research before booking this and was really pleased with the choice. We paid $210 a night which I soon realised is pretty good price for a hotel this central. I shopped around a bit and found the best rate was through the hotel's own website redroof.com. The location is absolutely ideal for any visitors. It is about a 3 minute walk to Macy's, 5 minutes to Madison Square Garden and about 10 minutes to Times Square. When the reviews say it is in Koreatown it is really just one street and has a lot of restaurants which were always very busy. We were out quite late at night and always felt safe. There are always plenty of poeple around especially if you don't head away from the main streets. We had room 1502 with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building from our window. After reading other reviews I was really surprised by the size of the room. By American standards it was pretty big and certainly bigger than the one we had in SF last year. Of course by European standards it was enormous! We had one large bed which was really comfortable and huge. The room was cleaned and bed changed every day without fail. Wasn't that impressed by the breakfast but there were plenty of great places to eat not far from the hotel. Check in and out was very smooth and the hotel happily held onto our luggage for us the final day before we headed to the airport. Had a fabulous stay in New York and would definitely stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: tuxedobob
Reviews.Content: My assistant made the reservation for me, so I was in a foul mood when before I walked in. However, what a surprise! It is really clean, the beds are comfortable, and the people are friendly. I only stayed one night when I was stranded in town, I am a bit of a snob but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Great price, area is lively and not intimidating. You are handy for all the subways etc, getting a taxi isn't too hard either. Nice place

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: T2Georgia
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Red Roof Inn on December 1st and 2nd. We were there for a "Father-Son" weekend and flew in from Atlanta. The location was great. 34th street subway station just down the street. We were in room 905. The room had only one bed, but it was an extremely large king size. I have never seen a king size this large before! We also had a refrigerator and microwave in the room, but did not use them. The bathroom was clean and of decent size. Overall, the hotel and room was very clean. The staff was courteous and helpful. We had no issues with loud noises either inside the hotel or outside. Our room was on the backside of the hotel so we did not have any car noise to deal with. The breakfast in the morning was great, but we did get there when they opened so we had no problems getting a table. Great selection of morning foods. My son and I were out past midnight both nights and used the subway both times. Never had a problem or felt threatened. The street the hotel is on was alive with people and never had a problem walking anywhere. Although we paid the normal December prices, I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a clean, comfortable place to bed down.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Value”
Reviews.Author: SRB13
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in NYC- Booked the Red Roof Inn almost a year in advance and got a (for New York at Christmas-time) good rate- The rooms, while, typically for New York, not large, were very clean and comfortable- One couple, in our party of 4staying there, had a nice view of the Empire State Building- We had no noise issues- The elevators were not terribly slow, though we were out early and in late- The continental breakfast was all you could ask for- Four others in our party stayed at a much more raved about hotel further uptown but did not receive anywhere near the value we did- I would go back here unless money were no object

Reviews.Title: “loved the convience”
Reviews.Author: cheech1425
Reviews.Content: This hotel was CLEAN The Korean take out down the street was open 24/7 and always had hot fresh food (pumpkin soup to die for!!) Everyone that worked here was very helpful. I plan on staying again in Feb 2007 with my 13 year old.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay at one of the Apple Core hotels for a while because they were supposed to be such a good deal. The price was an okay $250/night and the experience was nothing special. The woman who checked us in was surly, the tub was stopped up, and the room was small. But we never saw the woman again, the tub was fixed quickly, and I really didn't expect a big room anyway. The room was reasonably clean, the location is really nice - near lots of subways, and it's on the same block as about a dozen Korean BBQs (the Shilla was delicious). The hotel was adequate but I'll go someplace else next time because there's so much to choose from in Manhattan, not because the hotel was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for N.Y.”
Reviews.Author: BMRC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from Oct 30th with my husband following a 4 night trip to Washington. I didn't expect it to be as good value as Washington and my expectations were realistic. However we were surprised the hotel was as good as it was. The room was not large but certainly adequate in size and met our needs. The room was clean though the cleaners missed out on things like dusting ledges and vacumning under the bed and lockers which might annoy some people but it wasn't too bad. Bathroom was fine but the shower head wasn't very powerful. The lift (we were on the 14th floor) was slow enough but not very irritating. Breakfast was good with bagels, fruit, juice, doughnuts etc on offer. The hot water dispenser for making tea was in need of replacement as it emitted a dribble of water all the time but we survived! This hotel is in a great location for Macy's ,Empire State, Penn Stn, Times Sq etc and surprisingly traffic noise wasn't an issue with us at night time. You won't get better value in N.Y. for $209 per night (Before tax). So my complaints are really minor ones and we were quite pleased with our stay. We did notice that it was popular with other Irish tourists and that may be helpful to know if you feel the need to hear Irish accents around you in order to feel "at Home" in this hotel! One positive aspect of this fact is that you always have fellow country people on hand to direct you to the best bargains in the shops! From Drogheda, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a fraction of the price”
Reviews.Author: Norie
Reviews.Content: Location! Location! Location! 0.1 mile from the Empire State Building. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants and to the tour bus route. Continental breakfast served. Rooms though small and basic are clean. Request for a higher floor for better city view. Friendly staff. No concierge, any planning requests like taxi service or tour tickets have a fee. Plan tours on your own or ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rena1102
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Red Roof in NYC! We have no complaints. Being a budget hotel, we were very satisfied with our accomodations. If necessary, the hotel staff met our needs with no problems. We found that most places, with the same price range, did not include a toilet/bathroom, they were usually shared. Fortunately, at Red Roof, we had a full bath. They included soap, lotion and a conditioning shampoo. Another great thing was the free Continental breakfast. They had bagels, fruit, doughnuts, juice and coffee. Also, in our rooms was a coffee maker and coffee available. The Empire State building was right next to our hotel, we could see it from our hotel room. Broadway and Times Square were very close, as well. There was a subway about 1/2 block away and cabs were always readily available. You must keep in mind that it's NYC and everything is expensive so for the price range, you must liken the stay to a typical Motel 6 in the Mid-West. Overall, we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: Seein'_the_world
Reviews.Content: It was an average room with an average bath but it was clean and the a/c worked well. Inside the hotel (and room) it was very quiet even though it was noisy outside. The location was very good for sightseeing, but the best part was the Empire State Building filled our view out the window!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Budget Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Blackout
Reviews.Content: We had room 1612 for 5 nights. Reasonable size room by European city budget hotel standards. Comfortable king bed. Bathroom was clean and bright. Plentiful supply of hot water morning and evening and no problems with water pressure or standing water (as reported in other reviews). Housekeeping was excellent, fresh bed linen and towels every day. Coffee maker in the room. No minibar (an observation not a complaint). Big TV. Very warm in NYC on 2nd/3rd/4th Oct and air conditioning in the room worked fine. Complimentary breakfast (7am to 10am) is fairly basic (fruit juice, coffee, fruit, bagels etc) but for us it was more than sufficient. Tiny breakfast room on 2nd floor with 12 tables. Packed every morning. If you don't mind sharing tables you will be fine. Reception desk was efficient for both check in and check out. Lobby Tour Desk was helpful and friendly providing information whether you were booking a tour with them or not. The Concierge had taxis at the front door whenever we asked. Hotel location on West 32nd Street between 5th and 6th Avenues is well reported in other reviews, perfect for a city break. Access to subway and bus options within yards. Penn Station is 2 blocks (400 yards). The Empire State Building is 100 yards away. A 10 minute walk to Times Square (note to men, take the 5th Avenue route to avoid Macy's, West 34th Street and other magnets for shoppers). Little Korea restaurants and shops attract a constant crowd both day and night but a safe neighbourhood (restaurants throw garbage in the street at night for overnight collection). The bill on check out was as expected and fully itemised. There are 4 different State and City taxes, in total an extra 15% on top of the advertised room rate. I booked this hotel based on the strong reviews on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. Overall very enjoyable experience and everything we needed for a high activity city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location with a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: NunoVaz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Red Roof Inn for 8 nights, and the Hotel fulfilled all my expectations (which were high due to the tripadvisor reviews). The main strength is its location, right behind the empire state building. In terms of service, it is plain vanilla, being the only extra a decent breakfast (a rarity in New York standards). The room was big enough (probably for American standards could be considered small) and the bed was excellent. The main weakness is the slow elevators. In conclusion, for a budget and no-frills stay in NY this is an excellent value for money choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Nonnapn
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a convenient hotel in NYC but want to save on rates, Red Roof Manhattan is a great place to stay. We checked out the reviews on Tripadvisor.com and found most of them to be favorable so we decided to go ahead and book a 9 night stay, from Sept. 24 to Oct. 2. LOCATION - The hotel in located in W32nd St. between 5th and Broadway, in that area known as Korea Town. This is actually good for Asian tourists because of the proliferation of 24 hour Korean restaurants, serving authentic and affordable meals. The hotel is just around the corner from the Empire State Building, a hop and a skip from Macy's and H&M, Forever 21, the Manhattan Mall and other shopping destinations. Just walk up 5th Ave. and you'll hit the NY Public Library, the Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, FAO Scwarz, the entrance to Central Park ... the hotel is great for just taking long leisurely walks to shopping and sightseeing destinations. Take the M4 bus all the way to Cloisters, it passes right by the hotel, take the Q32 all the way to Jackson Heights in Queens to all the ethnic restaurants -- and a few steps away from the hotel, at the corner of 32nd and Broadway is a subway station for the N R W line that takes you to Union Square, Chinatown and everywhere. The hotel is also very close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, and Times Square -- everything is within walking distance. FACILITIES - As to the hotel facilities, the rooms are average sized, we had a king bed and cable tv and the room and the beddings were clean and comfortable. The room and bathroom were kept clean throughout our stay. The soap they provide is lousy so bring your own soap and shampoo. FREE BREAKFAST - There is free breakfast on the 2nd floor, up to 10 am, which we went to only twice during our stay -- they have bagels and doughnuts and jam and butter and coffee and juice. We opted to enjoy more of what New York had to offer and enjoyed brunches in quaint places throughout the city -- but if a continental breakfast is fine with you, the free bagels and rolls are good value for the rate you paid for. CHECK IN - I was momentarily nonplussed at check in because I had requested for a) non-smoking floor, b) higher floor with room number ending in 02 or 03 c) a view of the Empire State building. Instead, I got a smoking room on the 6th floor albeit with the requested 03 ending. The 6th floor is not high enough to block out the noises from the street below specially late at night, when all the garbage trucks are picking up the garage. I expressed my disappointment but the lady who handled the check in said there were no more non smoking rooms on non smoking floors. When I countered that I had requested for a non smoking room, they said that preferences were just that and could not always be met. I was afraid that the room would be stuffy and mentioned that 9 nights was too long a stay if I hated the room but she did say that rooms were aired and deodorized so definitely, the room would not be stuffy or would not smell of smoke. Thankfully, she was correct but if you are very sensitive to smoke -- perhaps you can follow up your reservation with a phone call to the hotel to make sure you do get what you requested for. PHONE CALLS - The hotel claims that you can make free phone calls within the 212 area code but we tried several times but couldn't get through -- we were never able to make use of the free service. You always get a busy signal. A friend who also stayed in the same hotel had the same experience and we ended up using our own mobile phones to call. What's the use of saying there are free calls when no one can ever get through? SERVICE - Reviews I read about the hotel were equally split between raves about the service and rants. I found the service at the front desk perfunctory but then again -- it's not the Ritz. Maid service was on the ball and rooms were cleaned thoroughly and on time and that was more important to me during our stay. We hardly needed anything from the front desk or the concierge so it wasn't an issue that they were not too friendly -- except for one night manager who was quite accommodating about a package I wanted them to keep for a friend. Because of the hotel's terrific location and the very good rates, I would not hesitate to go back to the Red Roof Manhattan next time I go on vacation to New York.

Reviews.Title: “superb value and location”
Reviews.Author: mcgorr
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, good sized room, all amenities, excellent location, concierge assistance first class. We stayed on a pre cruise stop over and on our return got off the ship 9am with a flight home at 10pm, they held our luggage all day at no charge. Thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Budget Gem Tucked Away”
Reviews.Author: Dazzzleu
Reviews.Content: All I can say is...Thank goodness for TripAdvisor! It used to be a throw of the dice as to what hotel to book. We did extensive reviews and getting the nod was Red Roof Manhattan. Finding the hotel was a little bit of a challenge as it's really tucked away deep in Korean Town - definitely invisible from cross streets but after a few circles around the area - we called the hotel and their friendly staff was able to guide us in. The hotel lobby was nicely updated with marble walls, a concierge stand, front desk and a second level cocktail bar that too was comfortable and inviting. Check in was painless and upon arriving to our room, we were pleased that albeit a little on the small side - it wasn't too small and certainly was clean, smell-free and had everything we needed for a comfortable night's stay. The nicely tiled bathroom was very clean and had all the little hotel amenities (soap/cups/shampoo/etc) and plenty of towels. The best part about this hotel is it's location! You're on the same block as a subway entrance so it's great to be able to get the all day Metro Card and make our way through various parts of the island. It's an easy walk to Madison Square Garden, The Empire State Building and a whole lot of shopping stores. Keep in mind - once outside the hotel, you are in the middle of Korean Town with a lot of hustle and bustle and 24-hour sushi/karaoke bars. At night - the trash is piled up high but any smells we encountered were minimal. There is also a parking garage in the same block and the hotel does offer discounted parking. In our case - we parked the car and took cabs and the subway for the three days that we were there. Parking for our oversized Suburban was $35. Smaller cars about $25/day - One time in/out. I highly recommend this hotel especially if you're only planning on spending a minimal amount of time actually in the hotel as we did. We needed a great location, hot shower, and a comfortable bed at a price that wasn't outrageous....the Red Roof Manhattan fit the bill perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: flyme2moon
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you are looking to visit Manhattan and not spend all of your money on accomodations. The hotel is centrally located (less than 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, Times Square (about 10 blocks), Macy's and other shopping (about 2 blocks) etc.). The rooms were fairly small and plain (typical of most budget hotel/motels) but most importantly they were clean and quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly ~ so be sure to ask them questions if you need directions or to arrange a ride to the airport. A few things to mention....there are only 2 rather slow elevators servicing nearly 17 floors....So if your room is on one of the upper floors...prepare to spend quite a bit of time in the elevator. They do provide a continental breakfast but it is held in a room that can only seat about 15-20 people (max) at a time. We would get there at 8am but could never find a place to sit down. So, unfortunately, we could not really take advantage of the free breakfast. But otherwise we had a pleasant stay at the Red Roof Inn and wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was clean and reasonably priced until.......”
Reviews.Author: hikinggal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends from 9/11-9/15. The hotel was clean as other reviewers have stated. The continental breakfast was fine. Our room was serviced well. It was as others described it. A budget place to stay, close to attractions, helpful staff-the conceriege people were most accomodating in recommending places within walking distance to dine at and securing our confirmation for our return trip to the airport. However, When I arrived home, I received a letter from my credit card company stating there had been "unusual" activity on my card so they placed a protective hold on further charges until I contacted them. The ONLY place I used this credit card the entire trip was at this hotel. There were a number of attempted "unusual" charges to my card. Thank goodness for my issuing bank institution and their diligence. Use your cards at your own risk. Because of this, I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: dcharmant
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about booking this hotel as the price was much lower than others in the area, but the reviews were good, so I decided to take a chance. Accommodations were simple but clean and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There's a basic complimentary breakfast, a workout room I used each day of my stay, and a bar/lounge area. Even the guests were friendly - one woman was passing the workout room and popped in to ask me if I wanted her to turn the t.v. on for me. The location was also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “...the review's are right”
Reviews.Author: TrotamundoGirl
Reviews.Content: I usually use this web page to have an idea about the hotels. We never be disapointed. We were in NYC from Aug. 19-23, in Red Roof Inn of course. I stayed in various hotels in NYC but this one are in the best ones. (Pennsylvania, Standford, Grand Union, Thirty Thirty, Mildford Plaza) Hotel: is in the middle of Broadway and 5th Ave. Location: close to everything. One block form Penn Station. If you came from JFK or Newark you can take a short walk to the Hotel. Also in Broadway and 32 and 33, you can take the subway there. Room: is like the reviews said. Some are big and some are big enough to sleep only. But trust me, very clean and smell fresh. Continental B: good enough for saving some $$. Fresh fruits, bread, orange juice, cofee, milk...I think is fine. Shopping: If you are interesting in see some "replicas" from LV, Coach, Gucci. Don't forgget visit Broadway down, is like 6 block from the hotel. Every one offer you see it, and remember you have to negociated with them to have a good price. There are more cheaper than Chinatown. You have many place to eat around. In Manhattan Mall there are many economical places and in Penn Station, in 5th Ave. between 32 and 33 are a Starbucks location. If you like sushi and seafood visit Todai. Location, 32nd between 5th and Madison Ave. (todai.com) To be my first time in a place like this I think is good enough to star.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a very expensive area”
Reviews.Author: marsia54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in August, 2006. The room was very clean and neat, spacious, and convenient to many local attractions. The service was very good. Only downside was the continental breakfast room is way too small and overcrowded for the number of people there. The food selections were very limited also, but for New York, it was probably pretty good. Price was reasonable considering where we were. Parking was an issue as it always is in New York. If you don't use the hotel parking, do not park in front of your hotel overnight, unless you want the New York City Sanitation Dept. to bathe your vehicle in liquid garbage. Then just try to find a car wash! The hotel told us it was ok to park there, also. Remember to bring your antibacterial handwash with you and use it often. Use the bathroom in your hotel, and then don't drink too much. Lots of luck finding a public bathroom. Don't miss Ellis Island, Cental Park, The Met, or the MOMA. Those were the highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fear Not! Red Roof Inn Is Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: stepman
Reviews.Content: I spent considerable time looking for an affordable (less than $175.00 per night) Midtown hotel with a consensus of good reviews. This property was about the only one I found. Yet, I was still reluctant to book it because well, I was going to NYC, not Topeka, and a Red Roof Inn seemed like too much of a budget name for the City. Fear not! But for the non traditional and decidely New York styled (and Korean) signage on the front of the property, you would not be able to tell you're staying at a Red Roof. This 17 story property is typical of most any other Midtown Manhattan hotel, but at a fraction of the price. The location, 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and 5 minutes to the subway, is ideal for activities in Manhattan. I found the room to be clean and funtional in every way. I didn't consider the room large like many reviewers did, but it was not small either. Another value move is to buy the 7day Metro/Subway pass which gives you unlimited rides on the subway or buses for only $24.00. I bought mine at La Guardia and used it to get to the hotel. I returned to the airport by taxi (it was raining and I was short on time for return by subway) and it cost $30.00 including tolls and tip). This hotel exceeded my expectations, given the price paid. They accept AAA also.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Brogden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RRI three nights this past weekend. This was our third or fourth time to use this property. It did not fail to please. The price is certainly lower than most comparable properties. The location is ideal for mid-town touring and to get to public transportation. The rooms are large and comfortable. The rooms as well as the common areas are clean and fresh. The free breakfast is very adequate. Check in staff is typical of NY - hotel staff is very friendly. All in all, it is a great hotel if you are going to NY! We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: PON
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good location, because of 3 min walk from empire state building and 10 min walk form Penn Station, and offers at reasonable price. The other hand, room is small (not enough space for luggage) Its wall is thin, and you might hear voices form the next room. (When I stayed, school girls stayed at my next room and I have heard their cheering loud voice)However the room is very clean and I consider that you can have comfortable stay at this hotel. This hotel is located in Little-Korean town and you might feel different atmosphere around this hotel but generally it is safe. If I were in NYC, I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Red Roof and once again it was a great stay. I like the hotel because it's close to but not in the middle of the hectic pace of Times Square and it's basically next door (ok, a block or two) from Macy's, Herald Square, Penn Station and a multitude of subway lines. The hotel itself is fairly basic but very nice. The staff is efficient, the continental breakfast a decent start to the day and the rooms themselves very comfortable. I've stayed in kings three times and none have been the same layout or size, ranging from very tiny to very roomy. Watch both applecorehotels(--) and redroof(--) as you prepare to book. I intially booked the room at $139 and over the next 10 days, it went down to $109 ($104 with my AAA discount). As long as you send Red Roof an email through the Red Roof website and let them know you noticed the rate change, they will adjust the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: go_mommy
Reviews.Content: You 'never know' what you'll encounter in NY. I was pleasantly surprised at the value for the location and price, the room was spotless, everybody was very nice, cute small bar and a good enough continental breakfast/snack to get you going.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldexplorer2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The room and the bathroom were beautiful and clean . They serve contenential breakfast every morning and the food is pretty good, especially the bagels. We found this hotel a perfect location because it is right by the Empire State Building, and about 10 blocks from Times Square. This two star hotel was great value and we got more than what we expected. We would definitely stay here again. Excellent Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Touch Down!!”
Reviews.Author: Gaúcho
Reviews.Content: Thanks, Trip Advisor! The hotel was better than I expected! Very good quality breakfast and nice room/bathroom. Ok, the price is a "New York Price" (U$ 179,00/night) for a 2 stars, but is pretty much a 3 stars! The staff was not "kind" or "sweet", but was efficient. The room was comfortable, the size and the cleanliness were good, and the view was cool (Empire State, if you look up). There is a neighbour internet point and the fast food restaurant in the corner (Broadway/32St) was inexpensive, healty and good. Cons: The neighbourhood was not so good, cause was in Little Korea (sometimes has garbage in the street), but was safe and strategic, near to the Metro and Macy's/Gap/H&M/BHPhotoVideo and other nice stores. The breakfast room was tinny, so, go early. The room has no minibar. Me and my wife had a great time in NY, and the Hotel (comfort, strategic location) was part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Mobes119
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof for only one night...my two kids had never visited New York, so it was a spur of the moment decision. The price and positive reviews given here led us to stay at the Red Roof, and we were really pleased with our decision. We found the front desk staff to be very friendly and accomodating...they even adjusted our room rate DOWN when we checked in!!! (We did have to pay an extra $20 for a roll away in the room, but no big deal!). The room was very large by New York standards, and clean and neat as could be! We spend very little time in the room, but it was very comfortable...the mattress felt nearly new! Location was the biggest plus...nearly next door to the Empire State Building and Times Square is within walking distance. We visited the Statue of Liberty as well...about a $15 cab ride including tip. I would certainly stay here again...great for the money!

Reviews.Title: “A good decision made ....”
Reviews.Author: WAFC
Reviews.Content: I took my nephew to New York as a treat and after much deliberation decided to spend a little extra than planned and go to the Red Roof. New York hotels are extremely expensive and you normally don't get a lot for your money but the Red Roof is definitely worth it. I booked a room with 2 double beds and was surprised at how big the room was in comparison to other New York hotels I have stayed in. Hotel room was clean, great bathroom and decent air conditioning. Would recommend highly to anyone. Bonus features of this hotel; 1) Location - just round the corner from the Empire State 2) Free breakfast 3) Free WiFi internet Downsides a) Slow check in process b) Even slower lift (elevator) ! c) Taxes ... added about 25% onto the advertised room rate Picture attached was taken from the top of the Empire State Building … as you can see, the Red Roof Hotel doesn’t have a red roof !

Reviews.Title: “excellent room loved breakfast”
Reviews.Author: chrisGalwayIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from 8th to 11th july 2006. First trip to N.Y. and loved location of hotel. Very near everything and staff on hotel desk very helpful as regards location of places of interest and travel outside city. Stayed on 10th floor and found room very clean and had great view of Empire State Building. Breakfast very good but one would need to come to dining room early as it does not accommodate very many people. Opens at 7.00 and packed by 7.30. Hotel very central so one can dispose of shopping back to hotel as load gets heavy. Loved our stay there and would certainly stay at same location on next trip . Bed extremely comfortable and clean. Linen changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “1 week at the Red Roof”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (myself and my girlfriend) stayed at the Red Roof Inn for 7 nights in early July 2006. We chose this particular place based on the positive comments here, the central location for our sightseeing and the reasonable price compared to other hotels in the area. Overall, looking back, it was a very good choice and one I'd happiily make again. The room and bathroom were a good size and tidy. Iron, ironing board, TV, movies and Nintendo games available on demand (for a fee), coffee making facilities were all available in the room. Vending and/or ice machines were available on all floors from 2-17. The breakfast is simple but considering most hotels only offer food as an extra we were very glad of this most mornings. Tea, coffee or juices, cereal, toast, bagels or donuts were on offer here until 10am. Small but practical as long as you didnt leave it until the last minute to get here. The staff we dealt with were friendly although this was limited to checking in and out as we had no problems once we got settled. We had a noon checkout but our bus shuttle didnt depart until later in the afternoon so we were very glad to be able to leave our luggage safe for a few hours behind the front desk to allow us some final hours out shopping. We used the NY airport service from JFK on arrival which dropped us at Penn station. This was about a 5 minute walk from the hotel (with luggage) and on the return journey the concierge at the hotel arranged for us to be collected at the front door of the hotel. For $54, both of us had a comfortable return journey to/from the airport. As for sightseeing, I would recommend the Top of the Rock as a very good alternative if you want to avoid the very busy empire state building. We arrived there at 11:30am and we among only 30-40 people there. Loved the elevator trip to the top, you'll know what I'm talking about when you get there!! The views of Central park are much better and of course you get a proper view of the ESB ! Two thumbs up from me for the Red Roof.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money confirmed”
Reviews.Author: Tuga2005
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in early June for vacation. We chose the Red Roof Inn mainly due to the positive reviews we got here. We confirmed all the positive items reported earlier: excelent midtown location, clean and nicely decorated, the room bigger than average (for NYC standards), continental breakfast included, staff OK. All with a below average price ! If you reserve it, ask for a room in a higher level with a view to the 32nd street, facing the ESB.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Midtown.”
Reviews.Author: BanaPona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. Yes, it is in a smelly and busy area of Midtown – but that is most of this area and not just this block. It is busy and the buildings are packed – it would be hard to tell where the hotel is if you try to see the sign from just a 50 yards away. The location is pretty good – in a couple hours you could do the major sites of the ESB (only 1 block away), Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square. There is a ton of Asian food - - and it does seem somewhat a “Korean town” street. There is quite a lot of Muslim food nearby too (e.g., 27th and 29th streets). As one reviewer mentioned, the area between the hotel and Times Square (on Broadway) does seem to transition a bit toward dark. However, the street itself (where hotel is) becomes very lively with young Asians meeting each on the street for food and fun – it gives sort of fun feel at night. As for the hotel itself, it is OK – small and generally clean. The staff are a hit-or-miss. Some are very good; others seem pretty indifferent about your existence. Overall, would I stay here again – I am unsure. Maybe for a night or two, but for longer stays this hotel does not seem to engender feelings of warmth and enjoyment. Mainly a place to rest your tired soul at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the hotel as tourists and have nothing but positives to say about it. The staff were all courteous and helpful, our room was ample, clean and quiet, the location is great, mid town one block from Broadway and a subway stop and the price couldn't be beat. I recomend it highly. Jack Sands, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Huntersville
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Red Roof Manhattan for 4 nights in early June 2006 and were very satisfied with the hotel. The room was clean, big enough, and bathroom clean and also good size. We are a family of four, kids 13 & 10. We paid $189/night and booked through the applecore hotels (they own 5 Manhattan hotels of various chains) website. The breakfast room was too small and had to wait for a table, but food offerings were similar to Holiday Inn Express. Frankly, we were thrilled to have free breakfast in NYC. The location of the hotel was excellent. Subway at corner, easy access to Central Park, museums. We walked to Times Square, Bryant Park. We walked early and late, never felt unsafe. The hotel offers parking in Central lot at end of block, and this worked out fine for us. I would stay here again. As mentioned, its just around the corner from Empire State Bldg, get tickets online for this (and anything else possible) in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: DonegalGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in May at the Red Roof Inn. Excellant value for money for a NYC hotel. Amazing location - only 2 blocks from Empire State Building and not much further to Macy's or Times Square! The hotel was clean, the rooms were a nice size, and service was good. They also let us leave our bags (kept in a room behind reception so very safe) on arrival and after checkout free of charge although we did tip on both occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Red Roof Inn from May 28 to June 2. We're in our early twenties and wanted a safe, clean, relatively inexpensive place to stay. The room is of average size. Two doubles. Nice big bathroom. It has a superb location. As others have said, it's in "Little Korea" so it's kinda stinky. Breath through your mouth. Face it, NYC is an array of pleasant and not so pleasant smells. It's a half block to the Empire State Building. (Must do) I must say, that as a hotel receptionist, the continental breakfast went above and beyond. There were a ton of foods and beverages to choose from. If you're too early or late for breakfast at the hotel, try the Brooklynn Bagel Co. on the corner of 5th and 32nd, they make great breakfast croissants. The hotel is in a safe area. We were two girls walking alone at night and never once felt uncomfortable. Housekeeping was great. (Been there, done that, wouldn't want to do it again!) We had a burnt out lightbulb that was changed immediately. As for things to do: We did it all, so... Go to the information center in Times Square, ask about Broadway theaters. We got a 50% off coupon for Beauty and the Beast. AWESOME SHOW! Kids and adults alike. Hairspray was by far our favorite. Great for the entire family. We were lucky enough to get our name in a drawing for tickets 3 hours before curtain. Two front row center seat tickets for $25! Central Park is gorgeous. If you have kids, go to the zoo. Small selection, but laid out nicely. IF you need to give your feet a rest, go on the 3 hour tour, (don't be afraid, you won't ge shipwrecked) on the Circleline Tour. Very relaxing and informative. Nice breeze on a hot day. It was 90 with like 500% humidity. Very relaxing. Tom is a great guide. Get up early and check out the Today Show in Rockefellar Plaza. We saw Taylor and Katherine from American Idol and met Matt, Al & the gang. All really pleasant. If you want great pizza, go to "Little Italy", the name, not the neighborhood. I think it's off of 46th and 6th. YUM! Carmine's is an excellent restaurant. 44th I think. Huge portions, family style but super yummy. GO to NYC it's amazing. It was by far the best trip I've been on and between the two of us, we've been a lot of places. But, it's true what they say, "New York state of mind" They're not all overly pleasant, but it's still worth it. Oh, speaking of pleasant, take the tour at Radio City Music Hall, Joyce is a great tour guide. Sweet as can be! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Night, Sleep Tight, Don't Let the Bed Bugs Bite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After doing much research on Trip advisor, my sister and I decided to spend our Spring Break vacation at the Manhattan Red Roof Inn. The price was right and the location was described as being very good. Upon check in, I requested a room with an Empire State view and received it. In the initial inspection of the smallish room, I discovered these strange little bugs all over the faucet in the bath tub. I could not tell if they were roaches, spiders, fruit flies or what. They were very small, moving all over the place, and I was grossed out. To the hotel’s credit, they sent someone up to check out the situation immediately. I requested another room and was given one without hesitation. The next room was bigger, but we lost our Empire State view. After venturing around the city etc., we retired for the evening. I woke up around 4 a.m. and discovered a bedbug on a towel we had spread out on the bathroom floor. From information obtained through Trip advisor, an AAA article, TV, I was well aware that it was a bedbug. I decided at that point to check out and find another hotel. I didn’t want to risk staying there because my feeling was, if there was one bed bug, then there are many. I took pictures of the bug for future proof and I showed the bug to the people at the front desk. They told me the general manager would not be in until Monday. I wanted to get a refund for the inconvenience and the overall negative experiences. It was a rainy Saturday morning at 6:00 a.m., but off my sister and I went in search of another hotel. We stayed at the Carlton on Madison Ave. and had a marvelous stay there. I wrote a review for them too. (Carlton Treated Us Like Royalty) It was more expensive, not as good of a location, but we felt comfortable and welcomed from the start. I returned to the Red roof on Monday and talked to the manager. Despite his insistence that they take such matters very seriously, this was the first time he was hearing about my case. He took my name and information and informed me an investigation would have to be done, etc. Needless to say he called the next day. They owned up to the bugs in the first room, but not the bedbug in the second room. He assured me this was something the Red Roof organization took very seriously. Within a day, an inspector supposedly checked the room; a new mattress was purchased, etc. He offered free accommodations for the future, but I declined. I just wanted to get a refund, but he credited half of the one night stay back. I say beware. The location was good, the price was right, but the risk of carrying insects home is a huge concern. The whole ordeal was unsettling, time consuming, and very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan with my family from May 15th-18th. When we arrived at the hotel following a long flight, we were upgraded to a deluxe room which was much appreicated!
