We found the staff very welcoming and friendly and the hotel itself is set in a perfect location of Manhattan, couple of blocks walk from the Empire State, around the corner from 5th Avenue. Continental breakfast was served every morning in the 2nd floor restaurant which was plentiful. Couldn't believe how quiet the room was as in a previous hotel I stayed in NY, it was so noisy so this was such a relief!! We had a fantastic stay in NYC and would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a smelly block”
Reviews.Author: ASSDO
Reviews.Content: Great location, near everything you want, but this block in special has lots of korean restaurants, which smell not very good to me. Besides, they all (INCLUDING the hotel) leave their garbage bags on the sidewals, so it's impossible to walk to/from the hotel without feeling that terrible garbage smell - even if you, unlike me, loves korean food, you will not like the garbage smell. Room OK, bathroom needs a more effective cleaning, staff not very helpful (25 minutes to have our luggage picked up, ended carrying it ourselves). Not worth the USD180/day.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but overall EXCELLENT Hotel! Please read this short novel:”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexas48
Reviews.Content: OKay..... I am a Houstonian and just got back from my visit from this wonderful city with my 20 year old son. I will talk about my overall visit before I mention this particular hotel. I want to give you some insight to help you make your trip more enjoyable. We checked in on Tuesday, May 16th, after a taxi brought us from the airport. The taxi from LaGuardia was $ 34.50 and returing to the airport it was $ 26.50. I can't explain the price difference, but there is one $ 4.50 toll fare added to the actual meter amount. If you are staying at the Red Roof Inn, fly into LaGuardia as it is about $ 15.00 cheaper each way for taxis than JFK, which is a flat fee of $ 45 . My son and I went there to see three NY Yankee games (vs Rangers) and we wanted to see all of the big, non-museum tourist sights. If you are going to be here for for 4 days or more and want to see as much of the city as possible, I suggest a couple of things: 1) Get some good walking shoes, as walking is the best way to see the city 2) Get a $ 24 Unlimited Use Metro Card, which will give us unlimited rides on the subway and public city buses for 7 days. 3) Get a good NYC Guide Book. We used Frommers. I recommend starting a walking program so you will be ready for your NYC advanture. The subways are fun to ride, and safe. We probably walked 5-6 miles a day and rode the subways up and down the city, into Brooklyn and all over the place. Subways are a New York experience you have to try. There are always people to ask if you get confused, and most of the people were fairly nice. If you are a baseball fan, you MUST see a Yankees game. There are no other fans or stadium like Yankee Stadium, and it's a fairly easy ride via the 4 train via the subwaysubway. One word of caution: The Yankee Stadium security people will NOT allow your large bag into the stadium, but a place right behind the stadium will check your bag for $ 5.00 and put your stuff in a clear bag. You can retrieve your bag after the game. The place and whole street is something no baseball fan should miss. If you are gonna see the Empire State Building, get there at sunset and stay 30-40 minutes until it's night and all the city lights are on. It's gorgeous. Buy your tickets online in advance. We rode the 3-hour Circle Line Tour around the city. Our guide was kinda hokey, but it was fun and educational. The Statue Of Liberty is a beautiful thing to see in person, as is Ellis Island. One of the best things we did was walk from Brooklyn back towards Manhattan on the Brooklyn Bridge. It's spectacular. If you do this, you can take the subway to Brooklyn, have lunch at the famous Grimaldi's Pizzaria, and then walk the 30-45 walk back. I visited Nathans at Coney Island, and yes, the hot dogs justify all the hype. They are very, very good. The walk back over the Brooklyn Bridge takes you past City Hall and that is an easy walk to Wall Street and Ground Zero. Central Park is beautiful too, and we had lunch at Mickey Mantle's across the street and next door to the Ritz Carlton. You must visit Rockefeller Center and Times Square, and Grand Central Station. They are NYC experiences. I could go on and on, but I'll stop and talk now about the hotel. I do STRONGLY reccommend getting use to a lot of walking. Most of the time you can walk faster than the traffic. Time's Square at 10:30-11:00 pm when a lot of the shows end is a madhouse.... packed, but fun. It has a tremendous amount of energy. It's eletric!!!! If you need a need a good NYC pizza place in Time's Square, try John's on 44th Street. It's in a cool building that use to be a church, and it's directly across the street from where Phantom Of The Opera plays. OKay, the hotel. It's an ideal location and only a block or two from the Empire State Building. If you are in Times Square and want to make the walk back, just walk towards the Empire State Building and you'll find your hotel. It's that easy. The hotel is pretty centrally-located, so you can walk just about anywhere in midtown easily. We stayed in a room without a view of the ESB, and the clerk told us none of the 2-double bed rooms have an ESB view, only kings. Our room was # 708, and it was very quiet. The beds were comfy, and water pressure and everything was okay. The toilet flush is obscenely loud, but that's okay. I suggest bringing your own bar of Dial or whatever you use, as the soap provided is pretty lame. The towels are okay, and shampoo and lotion is provided. Unfortunately it's true that the drains in the tub don't work so quickly, and there was 3-4" of standing water during your shower. It's MY water, so I didn't care. Please note that there is an air conditioner in the room, but the thermostat controls aren't operable (at least not in # 708. You can turn the fan off and on, but you can't control the temp from your room. I like it cold (73-74) and you have to INSIST when you call down to make sure they turn the temp way down. It will blow cold for a while, then cycle to warm air for a while so it won't freeze up (so they say). If you need an average temp room like a normal person, it's probably won't even be an issue and you'll sleep very well. The elevators aren't as slow as some reviewers are saying. The complimentary breakfast was good, and included bagels, doughnuts, OJ, coffee, fruit and Oatmeal. It's on the 2nd floor, so go down to the lobby for for your complimentary USA Today before you go eat. Overall, this is a very clean and basic hotel. It's on a street with Korean restaurants, but it's nice. We only wanted the hotel for a base and place to sleep at night. Our NYC vacation was very busy, and you can miss a lot if you sleep late. If money is no object and you need luxury, and need a beautiful hotel to lounge around in, don't stay here. For the $ 189 a night we paid, we more than got our money's worth by the cleanliness and super location. We were pleasantly surprised, and will probably stay here again on our next visit. Please e-mail me if you need some more info or suggestions. I absolutely fell in love with this city and can't wait to go back!. - Lefty_Coach@Hotmail.com (Steve)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the apple and the inn !!!”
Reviews.Author: paradisefound105
Reviews.Content: First time visitors from Winnipeg, Canada to New York. We found the location excellent !!! It was close to the subway, the Empire State Building and a ten minute walk to Times Square. The service was excellent and the hotel was very clean. The continental breakfast was adequate but added to the value of the trip!!! Excellent Korean restaurant right next door, we recommend steamed shrimp dumplings for a late night snack. A native New Yorker friend was quite impressed by the size and quality of the room by New York standards. The room was large enough for a comfortable stay and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud!!! The staff was friendly and helpful, although the elevator is extremely slow. Overall, Highly recommed this hotel, would stay again, great value for your money in New York.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sharpe56
Reviews.Content: First visit to New York City and didnt know what to expect. Reviews from this web-site helped us to pick the Red Roof Inn Manhattan. Didnt have alot of money to spend so The Red Roof Inn was a good deal compared to others we looked at. The location was wonderful, close to all subways, empire state building and times square. Felt safe walking to and from the hotel at all times. Went to New York with a sister and brother and we shared a room with two double beds. The room was plenty big and comfortable. Quiet too! We were on the 11th floor and had no trouble with elevators. Not much of a view but who has time to sit in a hotel room in New York City and look out the window anyway! Only complaint would be they did not serve coffee in the small bar and we wanted a late night coffee topped off with amerretto. No minnie bottles either or we would have made our own as we did have a coffee maker in our room. One reccommendation. Go to Carmines restaurant, it was great. Family style italian. we ate there twice and save room for dessert or go there later and just have dessert they are to die for and serve more than one! Highly reccomend the Red Roof Inn. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service! Great value for Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: starladear
Reviews.Content: We definitly recommend staying at the red roof inn. Our main reason for such a high review, is the kindness of the front office staff. We arrived after a very very very long non-stop journey across canada and down to NYC, arriving extermely early for check-in that day. The gentleman at the front desk offered to check us in HOURS earlier than usual. Being soooo sleep deprived we were sooo grateful for such a gesture from a hotel. Now we asked for a view of the Empire State Building - and boy did we get it! Do ask for this view - its an such an experience to be able to lesiurely take in such a NYC icon from your hotel room. The location of the hotel is excellent, pretty much in the middle of manhattan. We walked to everything. I do have to note the bed were huge - king size - and the pillows were above comfortable. Breakfast is included at the hotel, but if you want a table you better get in early - particularly during busy holiday times! When compared to other hotels in manhattan the red roof inn is a bargain! Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Ale56
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 days stay in NY. I chose this hotel according to the good reviews of this website. Now i can say that they were correct. The room was very clean and big enough, quiet (just doors are a bit noisy), furnished with everything mentioned in the hotel web-site. Moreover the hotel is in a very good position just 1min walking to the Empire State Building and to Macy's (even if the street in which it is located is not very nice - there are lots of Korean restaurants and sometimes there was garbage left in front of them). The breakfast is pretty good and even if the breakfast room is not too big i always found a table free. Concerning the price it seems to be quite low with respect to other hotel of the same category and in a similar zone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our visit to New York and enjoyed our stay very much read all the reviews on Red Roof Inn and wasn't sure what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed our stay there Rooms good size and very clean requested a non somking quiet room which although by the lifts (no problem) was exactly what we got with added bonus of great view of the Empire State Building Breakfast buffet was also very good no problems finding an area to eat Found all the staff apart from the concierge on the last day extremely friendly and helpful,would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and bathroom was good, apart from the shower. Shower was not very powerful or too hot. Staff, as previous reviews had mentioned, were efficient, but no smiles at all. We asked for a fridge, but were told it would cost $30 a night. No real coffee offered, except a watered down filter coffee machine and a cappuccino machine. The breakfast room can be busy, though most times there was a table for us. Toast and doughnuts and bagels and fruit. Adequate breakfast, apart from the lack of good coffee. Had to buy proper coffee outside the hotel in the mornings. Coffeemaker in room though. It is noisy outside, as no one seems to sleep. We were on the sixth floor at the front of the hotel. However, after the first night you get used to it. Central for shops, Penn Station, Maceys, Empire State Building. Adequate for a short stay in New York. Maceys food hall is good for a reasonable meal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Affordable.”
Reviews.Author: ElvDvd
Reviews.Content: This quaint little place has all the necessities to make your stay in NYC great. It's really clean and conveniently located to everything, including the subway which is at the corner of the street. Our king size bed was incredible comfortable and the view out our window was the Empire State Building. The staff was always very pleasant and helpful. We will definitely be staying at the Red Roof Inn once again. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to visit NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, family 2 adults and 2 teens, stayed there for 4 days/3 nights. Arriving there we got a free room upgarde (w/o request!) so we could have 2 rooms an same floor. Departing we got late check-out w/o any further question. Next to the friendly, helpful staff the best is the location of the hotel, less than 200m away from Empire State Building and almost on the 5th Ave. A great base to explore NY! The hotel is clean, the rooms are large. Rooms next to the ice machines may be noisy. The tiny breakfast room gets croudy after 0900am. Then it may get hard to get a table (eben a chair). Next time in NY I will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most Budget”
Reviews.Author: munchmag
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here 4/12 - 4/18. When we checked in, they upgraded us to a larger room, with fridge and microwave, wasn't that nice. Not only was the price right, but the reviewers are absolutely correct, this place is excellent. Not only is the location great, with the subway a block away, as well as the Empire State Building, the service was wonderful and the room was spotless. I'm very picky, especially when it comes to bathrooms, and I was not disappointed. In fact I was pleasantly surprised at how clean everything was, considering the price. I highly recommend this place and I would definitely stay here again. Don't forget you also get a free breakfast, which isn't fancy, but filling and did I mention it was free. You also get free wi-fi, which most hotels in Manhattan charge $10 a day for. There's a Starbuck's around the corner on 5th, as well as Cafe Muse, a few doors and across the street from the hotel, for those of us who live on a caffeine drip. Also if you are looking for a more substantial breakfast you can try Martinique Cafe on 1260 Broadway. It's just around the corner from 32nd St. Have no fear, the reviews are true, this place is a fantastic find.

Reviews.Title: “Want affordable & clean? You can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: SommerWind
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my Saturday night stay at the Red Roof and would definitely come back. Pros: reasonable rates, good location, very clean & relatively spacious room, complimentary breakfast, internet in lobby Cons: MIA bellman (waited at least 15 minutes for him to come back to his station so I could check in my baggage) the room key didn't work, elevators can be a little slow. Nonetheless, these were minor inconveniences that could probably happen anywhere at one time or another. All in all, a great pick thanks to tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself & my boyfriend stayed in the Red Roof in Jan (for the 2nd yr)for 5 nights & had a great time, the staff even upgraded us complimentary to a suite! We found the staff very helpful & the hotel had the most reasonable rates out of any of the other central hotels. I will definately book again for nxt Jan!

Reviews.Title: “Central Situation & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very centrally situated for midtown locations and great value for money. Room was quiet, clean, comfortable and well furnished. Go for rooms 03 & 04 on the highest floor possible (there are 17) to get a close up view of the Empire State Building. Rooms 01 & 02 also have the view but are next to the elevators and could be a bit noisy with solid floor in that area (no carpet). The breakfast is fairly basic and gets a bit crowded but where else in New York can you get a free bagel & coffee. There's also an all-you-can-eat Korean & Sushi restaurant just across the road with lunch (11 to 5) for $9.95.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It and the Location”
Reviews.Author: bennybear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red ROoof from March 23 for 9 nights. We found the staff, very helpful. The hotel was well situated, close to everything and the subway was very handy as well as was the proximity to Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens, Macy's and The Empire State Building. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pud123
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Red Roof for 5 nights from the 28 March 2006. I was slightly anxious as I had previously stayed in the Double Tree Suites on our last visit and we both loved it. However, costs dictated we were more sensible with our lodgings, as as we planned not to be in there too long, we booked and hoped for the best. First impressions were good. The lobby was clean and bright, the reception staff were fine, not overly chatty, but gave us a room! The room (707) we thought was super. No great view of the Empire State Building for us, but it was a decent size compared to other hotels I have stayed in in NYC, was very clean and had all the comforts we needed for a 5 night stay. We felt housekeeping was excellent. Daily visits kept our bed nice and neat and our towels fresh and clean :-) The complimentary breakfast, which we thought would be something we might not access, was visited by us daily! Again this was so much better than we ever thought: fruit juice, coffee, fruit, toast, bagels etc...A smallish breakfst room, but we always got a table and it was open from 7.00am - 10.00 which was great. Location was super. Right next to some great shops and within 2 mins of a subway that can take you wherever you fancy. Felt very safe at night too. All in all when I go back to NYC I would not hesitate in staying at the RR again. Great price (about $850)and great location - what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kipukatrading
Reviews.Content: Besides the group of an excited teenage orchestra, obviously in Manhattan for the first time, the stay was pleasant. The property is spotless and the staff is eager to assist. The rooms are on the small size, but what do you expect in NYC? The eleveators are also tiny and slow. For the price, it's a great value for a midtown Manhattan hotel, surrounded by great Asian restaurants and within walking distance to Herald Square shopping and the Empire State Building. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: BreeVdK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan just after Thanksgiving 2005 and we were really delighted when we arrived. The hotel was great and the rooms were spacious and really clean. The brilliant thing about this hotel is its location. It is a 5 minute walk up the street to Macy's and the Theatre District/Times Square/Madison Square Garden etc are only a block or so away. We would definitely return to Red Roof Inn and I have been recommending this hotel to my friends since getting home ! Don't forget tax is added to the cost of a room per night. Our was $180 per night but with tax it was approx $200 per night but still this would be cheap for such a good hotel in NYC. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Uconnhoopsfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and comfortable.. Great location, very affordable and nice breakfast. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best value”
Reviews.Author: wurly_monster
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Red Roof Inn and I would not hesitate to return again if I make it back. I saw a friend's hotel in Chelsea for slightly cheaper price and it was not a patch on this place. We were on the 15th floor which has great, direct views of the Empire State building 2 blocks away. The hotel is centrally located in the Little Korea area - a lively street, and a walkable distance to Times Square, subways, many food shops etc etc... The only downsides of this place are the queues for breakfast which seem even worse than the last time I was here, and the deathly slow elevators - which of course become more of an issue on the second top floor... but the views from there make it worth it - we could also see the tip of the Crysler Building...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a five day stay at the Red Roof Inn for my first trip to New York on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed - in fact the hotel exceeded my expectations. An excellent location - a block away from the Empire State Building and a short walk to Macy's and Broadway. The room was a good size with large bed, tv and clean bathroom (there is daily maid service with fresh towels). Reception staff were courteous and efficient if not exactly effusive and the staff on the information desk were helpful and clear. The continental breakfast was perfectly adequate (fresh juice, fruit, coffee and bagels etc). When I mentioned to reception staff that one of the bedside lights was not working the problem was fixed the same day. Overall the hotel is clean, comfortable and offers excellent value. I would not hesitate to recommend it or to stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value/Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CMACK24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend in NYC celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Our experience at the Red Roof Inn was excellent. We found the staff to be friendly and informative. The parking garage we used was less than a block away and we received a discount as hotel guests. (reg.rate-$38.00 per 24hrs./disc. rate-$24) The Empire State Bldg., Times Square, and Penn Station were all within walking distance as well as a great comedy show at Jack Dempsey's (Sat. Nights) on 33rd St. We walked to Penn Station and took the subway (E train)(cost-$4 round trip per person) to the World Trade Center site(less than a half hour ride). We couldn't have asked for a better price on our hotel room or a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but was overcharged”
Reviews.Author: Shar39
Reviews.Content: We had the toughest time finding the hotel with the directions we got from Mapquest. Had to circle around 4 times before we finally found it. There is only a small opening at the front of the hotel to park a car to get luggage out and when we got there, an airport shuttle was there waiting for someone to come down so had to double park with much honking from taxis going by. Front desk help is not very friendly and we got a room right next to the elevator. Room was not very clean and the maids did not vacuum when we got back to the room the next day. We had a terrific view of the Empire State building. Loved the location. Really is central to many things. Hotel could use some refurbishing and soundproofing. Heard every door closing in the hallway and people talking while waiting for the elevator. My biggest gripe has to do with being overcharged for the first night. Was charged almost twice what I was quoted over the phone. Front desk clerk basically said Saturday nights are more expensive than Sundays and to take it up with the reservation office. Otherwise it was an okay stay. The best thing going for this hotel is the location but will probably stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Great! Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a five night stat at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan. Unbelievable deal! We had a room with two beds - 6th floor, room 609. I lived in nyc and am very aware of how expensive hotels can be. Most bargain hotels have shared bathrooms. We paid $94/night plus taxes (with AAA discount) - for a clean room with a private bathroom, daily maid service, and a top location near Penn Station! What more can you ask for? The truth is, that you get much less for your money when you stay in nyc - This hotel gives you much more than other hotels in the area. We will be staying at applecore hotels when we return to nyc. There is also a La Quinta across the street which is also owned by applecore and a Ramada Inn on the eastside. We did change our reservation at the last minute to get a better deal - keep checking the website for rates. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelevable value!”
Reviews.Author: The_Flying_Chef
Reviews.Content: For $90, I got to stay in a clean room a couple of long blocks from Penn Station in New York City! Of course it was small, but the bathroom was bigger than most in midtown hotels at double the price. Add to this a decent free continental breakfast, an exercise room that was included and open 24/7, and internet and email service for $9.99 a day. There was nothing wrong with this place -- even the staff were nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night, but I found the room very nice and confortable... And the location is perfect... I had only one sunday to visit NY for the first time... And at this hotel I was in the middle of the best sightseeing spots... It was worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: moglie33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Red Roof Inn Manhatten for one night in December. We had reservations at the Marriott Marquis for the rest of the stay. We decided to go in a day earlier (which was a Saturday) and most rooms were either booked or over $600 a night. Found a review of Red Roof Inn in Frommers guide and decided to try it. It was clean, and I would compare it to a Hampton Inn hotel...room not quite as big. But there were no problems. It was in a Korean section of NYC and we actually walked there from Penn station. They had a free continental breakfast (donuts, bagels, toast, yogurt, coffee, juice, etc) and we found no problems with it. There was plenty of traffic, so we felt safe coming and going, and from our window...when you looked up you could see empire state building. The bed was comfortable enough. We came back in around 11pm and there was still plenty of activity going on so we felt safe coming and going with kids. It was conveniently located, and not too far from main things, and not an expensive cab ride from most areas. This isn't a 4 star hotel, but it more than served its purpose, and at a 1/4th of what other hotels were charging for that night. My main concern was safety, cleanliness, and ease of access since we were traveling with 4 kids, and it served its purpose. I prefer the Marriott in times square, but would not mind staying here again if necessary. If you are trying to do NY on a budget, it is a definate deal.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof is ideal for NYC on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high hopes for the Red Roof, due to its 2 star rating and us being snobby "only 4 star hotels will do", but our concerns were unfounded. Our room rate was higher than usual, but that was due to the fact we were staying over the weekend of the New York Marathon. On arrival, we were allocated a room on the 17th floor. We couldn't believe our luck when we looked out of our hotel window - we were so close to the Empire State Building that we couldn't see the top! We also had a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building to the right. Unfortunately however, the pipes in the bathroom were making some very loud and strange noises. We were worried that, as the hotel appeared to be very busy, there might not be the availability to move rooms, however we were moved a few doors along and again, the room was of a decent size, with a good view of the Empire State. We had a good 1st night's sleep, but it was broken on several occasions by more clanking pipes in the bathroom (they were, in fact, even more noisy than in the previous room). We complained again in the morning and were moved room once more - this time to the 11th floor. Our 3rd room was again comfortable and didn't differ much at all from the previous 2 rooms, other than the pipes in this bathroom didn't make a sound (other than the ones you'd expect anyway). We didn't have the fantastic views but, hey, all we really wanted was a base and somewhere we could get an uninterrupted night's sleep. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast which was included in our room rate, instead we took advantage of the fantastic delis and coffee bars that NYC has to offer. The only real problem with this hotel (apart from the odd room with loud clanky toilet pipes) is that the 2 lifts are SOOOOOOOO slow.... and we mean painfully slow. Ok, so we're not saying you'd be quicker walking up 17 flights of stairs, but not far off it! All in all though, the Red Roof in Manhattan is fantastic value for money and a great base for exploring Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: TSW42
Reviews.Content: First of all was given a room near a vending machine, asked to move which they did. The new room was clean and nicely presented and had an amazing view directly up at the Empire State Building. The staff were friendly and didn't have any problems. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: bmike2000
Reviews.Content: Was the cheapest "normal" hotel i could find. The location was great, room was clean, lobby was nice, and theres a consierge. Only complaint was drain in bathtub was pretty bad, and there was about 4 inches of standing water while showering.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: G99UGS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 12 night stay at the Red Roof Inn and really enjoyed it. The room was very clean and large enough for us, the bathroom was clean and we got fresh towels every day. We were on the 14th floor and it was extremely quiet, we were next to the ice machine and it didn't bother us at all. All the staff we had dealings with, maid, reception, doorman etc. were all friendly and helpful, they let us check in early and held our bags until it was time to go to the airport. We had no problems at all with the lifts, a couple of minutes wait at the most. Breakfast was more than adequate, fruit, bagels, toast, donuts, fruit juice, oatmeal, coffee, which kept us going until lunchtime. The breakfast room is small and can get busy around 8.30 am, we went at a variety of times from 7am until 9.45 am and always managed to get a table. The hotel is well located, close to the subways, ESB, Macys and we felt perfectly safe in the area. Yes the local restaurants do put their garbage out at night for collection, as other reviewers have complained about, but how else are they supposed to get rid of it? We would have no hesitation in staying at the Red Roof again and I would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: sftravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I was pretty happy & satisfied with this hotel. It's clean, roomy (King size bed), relatively quiet (can hear people outside my door but not often), close to subway (N,R,W at end of the block) & most importantly, I felt safe even though I was traveling alone. There's a little bakery/coffee shop nearby open until 2am. $209+tax per night for Nov 8, 9 & 10 $239+tax for Nov 11 (Friday)

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC for a long weekend. We were pleasantly surprised by the value of our room. $209/night king bed and includes continental breakfast. The room and hotel was well-maintained. We stayed in Room 801, which was right next to the elevator, and voices do carry through the door (though outside noises were well-muffled). Towels were not luxury nor was bed linens, but all were clean and very comfortable. Bed was very comfortable and not lumpy or sagging. Would definitely stay here again. Limited down-sides: Breakfast limited to toast, bagels, and fruit; hotel located on 32nd. between Broadway and 5th Ave which is center of Koreatown area, but Koreatown only takes up 2-3 blocks of city; low quality towels and bedding. One block from Empire State Building ($14 per adult), 10 blocks from Times Square (10-25 minute walk), 20 blocks from Rockefeller Center. 1 Block from a subway entrance so all was extremely accessible. Leave extra time if travelling to/from Central Park on weekend, as not all lines run regularly. Nearby recommended restaurant:Ramsey's Irish Pub - Restaurant/Bar where food was excellent and prices were reasonable. On 33rd St. also between Broadway and 5th Ave. Highly recommend the Blue Line Bus Tour at $39/person if lots of walking is not your style. I hurt my ankle and walking was limited. Tour gave great overview of city neighborhoods and main attractions with on/off priviledges to view locations at your own pace. We flew into JFK airport - taxi was $45(fixed) + tip. Ask consierge to hire a car for return trip at $50(fixed) + tip, otherwise taxi is on the meter to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “to noisy to sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hallways outside your door all all tiled. I haad one of two rooms right next to the elevator so anytime people came to the elevator and waited they would of course talk and laugh, I can't complain about that, but because there is no carpet the sounds just seem to get louder. i woke up many times from people just talking outside the door. Then there is the incrediably loud ice machine. it was so loud I thought it was right outside my door but I looked and it is on the other side of the floor. I can't imagine how loud it was for the folks with rooms over there. had a shower that drained poorly also. Room was clean but I expect to be able to get a good nights rest and I didn't any of 4 nights I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “i cant say a bad word”
Reviews.Author: sualg
Reviews.Content: If your in NY and on a budget (who isn't!) give the Red Roof inn a try. Central location and very clean with a great view of the empire state if you ask (nicely) We stayed for 5 nights on our honeymoon last month. Forget the worry about the lifts (it's only a couple of min's) the maids where great and so where the desk staff. My first time in NY and i felt so safe and the local area is great. So go stay and you may have to eat your breakfast of a plastic plate but who cares cos your in NY !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Left without a choise really -there were hardly any rooms in all Manhattan at the time of our booking, we booked this hotel. We got the penthouse (17th floor) and had a nice room with a great Manhattanview. Everything worked smoothly during our whole stay (4 nights). Elevators were fast enough, breakfast room never to crowded and the room was clean and quiet. There was some noice from the bathroom (plumbing?), and when pointing that out we were imidiately offered to switch our room. We choose to stay though. The only thing bothering us, is the fact that the hotel uses plastic wear in the breakfast room. So much garbage!! Not very envoiremental...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: datz70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights during September in Room 710. As other reviewers have mentioned rooms ending in 10 are small. However, even with a King Size bed it was perfectly adequate. We had no problems with the elevator, does speed matter anyway? The hotel staff were friendly enough. The mezzanine bar was handy for a late night drink before bed. The Red Roof Inn is only a couple of blocks from Penn Station for the Air Train to Newark Airport. We walked from the station to the hotel with our suitcase and hand luggage with no problems! Overall the hotel is in a great location and is good value if you don't want to spend a fortune on accommodation. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: phxsunshine60
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Red Roof Inn, September 30-October 2. Rooms and bathrooms need a thorough cleaning. The springs on the beds can be counted by hand - or backside. The elevators are really bad and the problem is that you cannot walk down to the lobby, the stairs lead you down to the service/storage area. The tub would not drain in our bathroom. I reported it to the morning desk clerk, who was very annoyed at me for bringing it up. The morning clerk seemed very annoyed at everyone and everything - 3 days in a row. He said he would have it checked and fixed, and did not. Second day I reported it again, this time it was fixed so 2 out of 3 showers were spent standing in 8 inches of dirty water. Lots of very loud neighbors on our floor and the building directly behind ours is in the middle of construction, so it is quite noisy very early in the morning on weekdays. The breakfast room is configured poorly and there are only a handful of tables and chairs for all the guests to use. Think you would be better off taking it to your room? There is a big sign telling you not to do that, but worse still is the thought of trying to juggle everything up the stairs, you can take the stairs to the room, or wait for the elevator which will be by in an hour. I didn't discover until I was at my next location, but the maid took the towel I had packed in my suitcase - the next place I stayed I needed it. They must have mistaken it for a hotel towel, but it was beige and of much nicer quality. I had also filled out a survey online when I made my reservation which gave me a $10 coupon for my stay. When I checked out I gave it to them and they told me I had to present it upon arrival and would not honor it. This was the nicer desk clerk saying this. The hotel is in a very convenient location, but strikes out on just about everything else. Certainly not worth $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy and Uncaring Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only saving grace of this hotel is its position! We had travelled the world and found the staff here the worst we had encountered. Not one "thank you" or smile the whole time. The rooms were OK, however when one is paying a high price the least we can expect is civility!! Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a bit surprised by the rating...”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Sweden
Reviews.Content: We were four people who stayed in this hotel for four nights between Oct 6 and Oct 10. The hotel was nice and I'm glad we got one of the largest rooms cause with that, we managed fine being four persons. It was clean but didn't smell very good. They said we got a non smoking room (605) but it smelled badly of smoke when we got there. We kept the air con on all day and that made it a bit better. And it was not very quiet. A fan of some sort were on all night right outside our room. You were so glad when it stopped but that only lasted for like two minutes, then it was at it again. I can agree with some people complaining about the elevators, they were slow. We stayed at the 6th floor so it was still ok. The hotel is ok. It is very nicely located (even though the street outside has A LOT of garbage bags from the restaurants thrown by the sidewalks) and the rooms are also ok - for New York. The staff was not overly friendly or service minded but on the other hand not rude either. What I am surprised by is the rating this hotel got on this site (#69). In march we stayed at Holiday Inn Manhattan - Downtown / Soho wich was a better hotel and that has a rating of #123. But I guess that relates to the location. Over all - ok hotel. I have stayed in much worse places in New York over the years. The only problem with this trip was the 4 inches of rain that came down on the Saturday ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good for Aussies”
Reviews.Author: George091
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on my yearly visit to NY. It was easily one of the best properties I have stayed at. The location is handy to subways and main line stations. I did not like the front narrow street usually full of foul food waste from the Asian restaurants. The rooms and facility were well cared for, room servicing clean and discreet. Front of house were typically American business like and helpful even at 2am. I have never bothered to comment on some of the dreadful places nearby, particularly the big one near the station. Really a good hotel worth a few more dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: abooklovertoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Room with two doubles was a good size and very clean In fact everything in the hotel was very clean. The bagels and fruit at break-fast were pretty good but as others mentioned go down early because room fills up after 8am. Front desk staff not very friendly but were efficient. Very accomodating in keeping our luggage for us until the evening. Many excellent restaurants on the block. Block not very clean but very safe. Always filled with people. Used buses primarily because they were convenient and we sort of used them as a sightseeing tour. The three hour circle lin e tour was excellent. Will definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off By Red Roof Inn, Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room online through AppleCore for a 4 night stay at the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan. We were quoted a rate of $189.99 per night. Unfortunately, we had to return to California 2 days earlier than we had planned. When we checked into the hotel we told the receptionist that we would only be staying for two days instead of four. The manager informed us that because we were changing our reservation we would have to pay $289.99 plus taxes for the night instead of the $189.99 that had been contracted. There was no mention of this policy on the AppleCore web site or in the e-mail confirming our reservation, nor can I find this "policy" anywhere on the website. We were ripped off, especially when you consider that although we had requested a non-smoking room we were given a dark room on the third floor that reeked of cigarette smoke and faced a dingy courtyard of ventilating equipment. Travelers beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: tonksky
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights each Sept. 23-27th, 2005. We arrived around 8pm, and checked in with no problems. We were given very nice rooms on the 17th (top) floor - there are only 4 rooms on this floor, so very little traffic and noisy neighbors to condend with! The rooms were extremely clean (no signs of roaches or rodents) and just large enough for 2 people in each room with luggage. Each room had a single king bed. The rooms were not large, but they were fine for our needs (sleeping and getting ready to see the city.) Our only problems with the hotel probably have to do with the age of the building. There were a few noise issues. The air conditioners in both rooms used by our group rattled and coughed their way through cooling. Changing the temperature guage on the units did not change the noise, just the frequency of the noise. Every time the a/c would kick on, it would thump loudly and the wall unit would vibrate noisily. We were tired enough each night from all our sight-seeing, it rarely woke us up. It was more of an annoyance. The second noise factor was the pipes banging. On a regualr basis we would hear loud bangs from the bathroom. In my room, we simply kept the bathroom door closed to cut off the sound, in our friends' room, they got more creative: they turned off the water supply to the toilet, and that stopped the problem - you just have to remember to turn the knob and get the water flowing to it again before flushing! As others have said, the elevators are slow, but it wasn't a problem. As I said, we were on the top floor, and we never had to wait long for an elevator. The only advice I can give is this: If you can, try to avoid a room by the elevators. My friends' room was next to the elevator, and the doors close loudly and woke them up often during the night. Other than these few problems, the hotel was fantastic. It is near a subway stop, and walkable to many places (the view out our window was the Empire State Building - just a block away!) As a group, we always felt safe walking about at night, though I don't know if I would feel comfortable walking alone in the middle of the night.) I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff let down hotel”
Reviews.Author: SVT
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 double rooms for 2 couples via the Red Roof website for the Labour Day weekend Fri, Sat and Sunday. On the advice of other Tripadvisor users I requested higher rooms, which we were allocated. The rooms were fine - a good size for such a great location in NYC; comfortable, well-appointed and, this is where the higher floors come in, with a reasonable degree of light. Unfortunately the staff here let down an otherwise pleasant experience. On arrival I presented my booking confirmation only to be told that the rate ($159 per room) could not be honoured beyond the Friday night and it would rise to $219 on the Saturday. I challenged this and was told by the duty manager that I had made a booking error on line by suggesting that there would be 4 people per room, which I knew was not true. I pointed out that my confirmation clearly stated 2 rooms, booked for a total of 4 people, for 3 nights but he continued to argue. I stood my ground and he grudgingly accepted my booking but grumbled the booking had not been made through the hotel directly - I thought central Red Roof reservations would be good enough! We did not require any further services from the front desk staff until the evening before we checked out. We needed to leave for JFK at 5.00am on Labour Day, so went to settle our bills on the Sunday night at around 11pm - we were first told we would have to wait until the following morning but, when we pressed, the clerk was able to complete the billing without a problem; we got the impression he could not be bothered, despite the desk being deserted at that time. The conclusion is, by all means use this hotel if you want good value, pleasant rooms in a central location in NYC, but make sure that your rate will be honoured and that you will not require any front desk services other than check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a good and secure stay in NYC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, my girlfriend and i stayed at this hotel last week for a 5 nights stay! It was my third visit to this amazing city (always stayed at 'the Belvedere') so i allready knew were and were not to search! After 3days off searching on the net, i found the Red Roof and we loved it! It is part off the Apple Core hotels chaine so nasty surprises are really not part off the hotel! It is located between Madison Square Garden and the empire state on 32nd, and Times Square is a '15' min walk (except if you are travelling with a women, the stores along side the streets are a women's dream ;-) We always felt safe around the hotel, in fact whole Manhattan is safe so really not to worry about! The rooms are big for NY standard's so is the tv with all the biggest channels available (internet and games are availble 2)! Our room was cleanded every day and fresh towels hanged daily also! The king size bed has a great matras 2! It is true 32nd street can be smelly sometimes, but is due to the Korean restaurants located on it, but you get used to it! The complimentary breakfast is good but not huge (donuts, bagels and 2 sort's off juice + coffy), around 8.30 am the breakfast room can be pretty full so early birds have more chances to actually sit at a table! The staff is friendlly, we were given 4hours more time to check out, and the lobby service is fast! The 2 elevator's instead are not slow but wait time can be long around peak hours! Ask for a 32nd street vieuw (amazing vieuw off the empire state building) and above 10th floor, street noise can be loud sometimes! It is a great value for what you pay for in New York, believe me, if you not 'The Waldorf Astoria' kind off person, the Red Roof Inn is really a plesant hotel to stay, bussines or travel!! We would certainly go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK amenities”
Reviews.Author: pbfarfallina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend in September 2005. The location is good, very close to the Empire State Building and other sites. The rooms were clean, cleaner than some other places I've stayed in New York City, and the price is good for the city. The air conditioning worked well. However, it is not a luxury hotel. There is a complimentary breakfast, but it is mobbed during the two or so hours in the morning that it is served, and not great -- weak coffee, watered-down OJ, dollar-store teabags, oatmeal, a few donuts and bagels. One concern is that we wanted to store a laptop computer in the hotel safe during the days, but the staff told us that the safe was too small to hold a computer. Next time we'll probably try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Frances-in-France
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights. Hotel is clean, comfortable, and well placed for Penn Station, lots of Subway lines, MACY'S, Times Square and above all the Empire State Building which was outside our window with the Chrysler away to the right. Breakfast was a buffet of bagels, apples, bananas 2 kinds of bread to toast, Quaker oats, fruit juice coffee and tea and a free neswpaper. The staff efficient and friendly. Although the price was sort of lowish, the additional taxes (x8) bumped up the final bill considerably. The street is in Korea Town, so all shops and commerce were Korean, including take away meals and grocery stores. Many stayed open until midnight, but there was a tendancy for large piles of slightly smelly rubbish waiting to be cleared each night. Generally a safe area for late night night strolls. One block in any direction and all the more usual eateries were in evidence.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in Room 1406 (family of 4 arrived Sept. 2 and checked out on Sept. 9, 2005). The room was very quiet; we didn't hear guests in any room above/below or next door (even though the room next to ours was occupied). The room wasn't very large but it was adequate...we were so tired at the end of each full day and it was nice to come back to a clean room with a nice TV. The only drawback was the slow draining shower and sink (minor inconveniences). The room was immaculate…cleaning staff service was excellent. Air conditioner worked fine, and the beds were comfortable (firm mattresses). Be prepared to pay 15% in taxes in addition to the quoted room price; these taxes added about $32 each night to the lodging rate (shown on receipt for each night: state tax-$17.82; occupancy tax $2; City Tax $10.64; Javits Convention Fee $1.50). The location of the hotel can’t be beat, and there are good restaurants in the area. Macy’s is nearby and Manhattan Mall (with a food court, coffee stand and shopping) is only a block away, as is the subway station. The wait for the elevators was never more than a couple of minutes – no problem. The breakfast was more than adequate and much appreciated (and staffed by an efficient and polite young man). It included bananas, apples, donuts, sliced white/wheat bread, 2 kinds of bagels, roll, cream cheese/jelly, oatmeal, orange and apple juices, milk (whole & 2%), coffee/tea, and cappuccino. If you come to breakfast early or late, there are places to sit, but wait until the ‘rush hour’ and you’re out of luck. We went to 3 plays (Producers, Phantom of the Opera, and Lion King). Any tickets purchased at TKTS must be paid for in cash. A lot of the restaurants and attractions (including the trip to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island) only accept cash so be prepared by stopping at an ATM in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but few amenities”
Reviews.Author: mlred99
Reviews.Content: For the price ($135/night) and location (just near the Empire State Building), Red Roof Inn is hard to beat, especially at the last minute. The neighborhood is a bit shady - it's in Korea town, which is interesting, but not the safest part of New York - but is very central. There are lots of delis and groceries around for a quick snack if needed. The subway stop is about a block away (32nd and Broadway) and the hotel is only 2 blocks from Penn Station. This is especially convenient if you come in from Newark Airport on the NJ Transit train - it's a very quick walk! As far as the room went, it was average size. Everything was clean and the walls were very soundproofed. We were right by the elevator (1412) and heard nothing all night. If you can - request a low floor because the elevators can take FOREVER! Especially at busy times like breakfast you should factor in at least 10-15 minutes to wait. Once we had to wait through 3 cycles of the same elevator due to the long line in the lobby and the fact that the other elevator was being used by maintenance. Speaking of breakfast - that was a nightmare! It was probably our fault for waiting until 9:30 to go, but there were tons of people and though the staff was desperately trying to keep the place clean, it was a bit of a disaster. We decided to just buy a bagel at the shop on 32nd and 5th on subsequent mornings. The staff was generally knowledgable and professional, if not overly friendly. The concierge (a girl of about 20) didn't seem to know all that much - including the fact that you could take a train directly from Newark airport to Penn Station! Overall, I'm not sure if I'd stay in this hotel again (I would probably opt for a more fun neighborhood such as West Village, etc) but for someone looking for a value it's not bad. Just be ready to walk up the stairs to avoid the elevator!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable comfort, great price”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen_Reston
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from 2 nights at the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan. We arrived before noon and left our bags for a short wander up to Times Square; when we returned at 12.30, the upgraded room that had been blocked for us was not yet ready, but a standard room was available. We checked it out and signed on the dotted line. It was a reasonable size for NYC, with dresser, large TV, desk, and 2 chairs as well as a comfortable king bed; bathroom was clean, functional, and perfectly adequate. Our breakfast experience was fine, unlike other posts; we got there early and had ample choice of food and places to sit. The coffee wasn't great, but that's not why we came to New York! The location, just a block from Empire State Bldg and 2 blocks from Penn Station, was perfect for us; we could walk to some of our sights and taxis were readily available for longer excursions. Our room, on the 11th floor, got little street noise, and we never heard a sound from neighbors on the floor. I did not interact with the concierge, but the front desk and bellman were helpful when needed. I booked through Applecore Hotels online. With our AAA discount, the rate was $170/night--a great price for a first visit to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Solid and very reasonable NYC accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In a city where average hotel room prices soar up to $300 a night, this is a find! Basic chain hotel accomodations, very clean - basically, no worries regarding shadiness or cleanliness here. Just a dependable hotel room with solid, clean facilities. Bed was not too hard. Sheets were clean. Extra pillows and general housekeeping facilities. Bathrooms look new and clean. No dark and dank mysterious "corners" - hallways are brightly lit. Good size rooms overall. We had the smallest room type possible in the hotel (any room number that ends with 10) - and even that was fine for us. The only thing we probably didn't have was a desk. All rooms, even people's homes are very cramped in NYC - so don't expect too much with space in this city - unless your'e willing to pay for it...dearly. Air conditioner worked very well with controls. Full TV service. They also have a free breakfast - which we didn't have. Safe, secure, clean and comfortable. What more could one ask for $120 a night in Manhattan? Area is Korea Town/Herald Square - great tourist area (near Macy's, Empire State etc). As a New Yorker myself (Brooklynite), I try to avoid this area with my life (too crazy and filled with tourists, and honestly, not the prettiest). If you want to be in the thick of it...it's perfect. If you're the kind of tourist who likes to avoid touristy areas, you may not like the area. Still, it's such a deal that I would still suggest it - getting out of the area is easy anyway - with 2 of the most convenient subway lines located on the very same block to get you anywhere! Highly recommended for the budget minded traveller who does not want to sacrifice comfort, convenience and cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find Under $200”
Reviews.Author: anwahs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan near Korea Town and the Garment District for two nights August 9 and 10. The hotel is in a good location and a short walk to 6th avenue where one can catch the N,Q,R, W line. The simply furnished rooms and bathrooms are clean, and larger than most hotel rooms in the city, that I have paid $100 more for. The front desk staff was pleasant and accomodating, as was the bell staff. Although the hotel is located amidst the "hub-bub" of the city, there was surprisingly little noise at night. Maybe this was due to staying on the top floor. The Red Roof offers a free continental brekfast (rare in NYC) but unfortunately the other guests took full advantage of this and horded food like it was the last meal that they were going to eat. One woman had a huge plate of jelly donuts that she must have been saving for a snack later since I can't imagine anyone eating 6 donuts at one sitting. The guests filling the breakfast area were rude and pushy, and many did not have the common courtesy to clean up after themselves. Another drawback was that there was a sign posted that stated "All Food Musy Be Eaten on Premises". I have no idea what purpose that suits, and I refused to follow that rule after seeing so many guests that were rude and obnoxious. Overall, it was a good choice for the $172 per night.

Reviews.Title: “A dive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a tired-out dive - despite the glowing reviews in the 2005 Frommer's New York City guide. From arrival to departure there is nothing that says welcome and we care. Yes it is cheaper than some other hotels, but use it only if you don't care about where you sleep. The front desk person was more interested in her benifits package; the so-called "Concierge" was making extra money selling tour packages after working the nail bar and was not very helpful . Carpets have come off of their backing in waves. Ice machine didn't work on our floor (it was over 100 degrees outside!) despite calls to the desk and the usual reassurances it would be fixed. You cannot adjust the heat in your room. The mattress saw better days many years ago. Access to the hotel safety deposit box is not controlled and it is open to anyone. The continental breakfast consists of lots of donuts, bad coffee, a few bannnas and apples, oatmeal, bagels and grape jelly. In short if $180 per night (including all the taxes) is better than the youth hostel - this is a find. I don't know what they paid Frommer's to hype this place.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TaliL
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel. However it is clean, friendly staff, and sitiated in an excellent location (30 seconds from 5th Ave. and 2 minutes from the Empire State Building). We stayed there for 3 nights and couldn't have asked for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient in the Garmet District - Times Sq Macys”
Reviews.Author: woodsy_al
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights. They had to add a roll away bed to the king and that made the room REALLY cramped, but not impossible. We were just sleeping there anyway. Charged us an additional $32 per night for the 3rd person and roll away. Otherwise it was clean and very nice. Other reviewers have mentioned the slow elevators, there are only 2 for about 16 floors. We did not feel like they were really inconvenient, but sometimes you had to wait for what seemed like a minute or two for one to arrive. The breakfast is basic, nothing to brag about, no eggs, no decaf, etc. The company that ownes this hotel ownes several others like it in Manhattan including the La Quinta Inn across the street. Not sure how the prices compare.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ambergirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was perfect for me. The internet cafe was 2 doors down, I was able to buy a Yankee baseball hat just down the corner for a good price. The choices of places to eat were endless. The bellman was very helpful with directions to the Yankee game by subway. Every employee we encountered either in the elevator or at the front desk had a smile and a greeting. I never got the chance to eat breakfast there because I slept in, but fruit vendors are everywhere. It was very hot and humid, but the room was cool and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - just what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: MSTravelWithKids
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Tripadvisor, I booked this hotel. This hotel lived up to the reviews and to my expectations. I was looking for a clean, comfortable, safe hotel in a good location and a good value. This hotel met all those expectations. If you want luxury, go somewhere else! This place is perfect for the visitor to New York who wants a good value and will do a lot of site seeing. The subway lines are within one block and the location is excellent for walking to many places such as Times Square, Grand Central Station, Empire State Buidling, Macy's, Madison Square Garden...etc. If you are going to the Yankee games, like I did, the subway line to the game is one block away. For breakfast try the Bagel Cafe down the street. It was everything I expected a New York cafe to be. Hope you have as much fun as I did! For the location and value you cannot go wrong...I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: antshe
Reviews.Content: I had read the comments and reviews of this location before I made my reservation. For the most part, all are correct. This hotel is a 10 minute walk from Penn Station, there are numerous good restaurants in the area, the rooms are clean and larger than expected and the elevators are incredibly slow. The elevators are also very small and therefore, you get to be up close and personal with the other guests of the hotel... NOT a good thing on a 100 degree day! I would definitely stay here again due to the pleasant room, location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: varney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn 19 July for 4 nights, good size rooms, front desk staff are helpfull. Continental Breakfast is reasonable, toast, bagels, coffee, juice and two choices of fresh fruit and doughnuts. Be aware that there is a $20.00 per night supplement for an extra bed. There is a bar, you can't charge back to the room, and they do have a happy hour if you want to chill after some hard shopping / sightseeing. Good location to explore New York, right by Macy's, Gap, H&M, Zara. For food its located right in the Korean area, we didn't get a chance to check out the restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a Short Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Errigalclimber
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and in a great location. Stayed here for four nights for the May 2005 U2 concert at Madison Square Garden. This hotel is ideally located for Madison Square Garden. It is also literally around the corner from the Empire State Building. Good size room and bathroom. Only reason it doesn't get an 'excellent' is the breakfast, which is poor, served in a cramped breakfast room with no natural light. But this is a minor quibble, really. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for a short stay in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: adventurousAng
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic and if you are worried about location don't be. This is perfect. Walking distance to Empire state building and some of the best shops in NYC. eg. The biggest department store in the world. Macy's 11 stories high!! The rooms were a decent size. The breakfast was fine. The front desk staff were not that friendly though - but this doesn't really affect your stay. The lifts are very slow though - so if you are staying over a wknd stay on a lower floor so you can take the stairs!! This hotel is definitely the best value for money that you will find in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It was excellent value including the breakfast which saved us from running around looking for something to eat in the morning. Very clean hotel. Staff were helpful and even though the elevators were slow at times, it was manageable. The breakfast room is way too small for the number of guests, but it is very clean and by the time you go through the self-serve, there was always a table for us. The area is convenient and safe, but on the July 4th weekend (don't know if this is typical) very very crowded in the immediate vicinity. The rooms are large by NY city standards. There are larger and smaller rooms and ours faced the Empire State Building and was very quiet. Also, if you stay several nights-- like we did and spend $500 you can join their "loyalty" club and apply to get a certificate for afuture night at a Red Roof Inn for free!! This is pretty amazing value for a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall--especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: kmbrlykat1
Reviews.Content: My friend from out of own made the reservation and I wasn't thrilled w/ the thought of staying at a 2-star hotel. No, I'm not a snob, however, I admittedly prefer a NICE hotel when traveling. Anyway, I didn't want to be difficult so I figured I'd "suck it up"--afterall it was only for 2 nights and we'd basically just be sleeping there. This place was definitely worth the $159/night (AAA discount) --"above average" for the price and I would stay here again. I found the staff to be accomodating...They let us check in a few hours early and gave us a room facing the Empire State Building. Overly friendly? No, but what do you REALLY expect from someone living in NYC and working at a Red Roof Inn??? After some of the comments I read on this sight I wasn't quite sure what to expect. We called down for extra towels soon after we got in the room and they sent 4 more up withing 5 minutes--no problem and no attitude. Also, they let us check out an hour late (no charge) and we appreciated that. We didn't have much more contact with the staff other than what I just listed. The room appeared clean with a slightly strong bleach-like odor but it dissipated after a while. Air conditioner worked well (that's one I worried about w/ the 90 degree weather)...The mattress was quite comfortable, although I read an earlier comment that it was really hard--I totally disagree...I can see where it could be noisy if your room is by the elevator or the ice/vending machines, but "NYC never sleeps" so it'd be ridiculous to complain about outdoor noise--which wasn't bad from the 14th floor...The elevators were somewhat slow but never had to wait more than a minute or two--except Sunday morning during what was presumably the breakfast rush" around 9:45. The so-called "breakfast" is fine if you want to grab a quick bagel [good] and coffee [mediocre] early before you head out. The "cappucino" was actually pretty good if you like the taste of instant hot chocolate. A couple of other things: 1) Pizza Pete's has EXCELLENT pizza--right out the hotel then right around the 1st corner. 2) Take cabs if it isn't during weekday rush-hour traffic--they're almost always quicker than the subway and barely more costly if you're not going too-too far. As many others have stated, this is a good deal for a 2-star hotel in a convenient location--and we felt safe, too. If you want fluffy robes, soft towels and easy-to-reach toilet paper (ha-ha) then it's going to cost you a lot more some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife as part of our honeymoon because it was reasonably priced and had a great location. It is situated 5 mins walk from Penn Station and 15 from Times Square / 42nd Street which was perfect for us. The room was basic but very clean and worth the price we paid. The lifts were stupidly slow but you are not exactly going to choose a hotel because of its lift speed so I wouldn't worry about it. Lobby bar had 2 for 1 from 4pm - 7pm which was nice. Hotel staff were very courteous but I think some were on exchange from somewhere and their english was a bit patchy but we got there in the end. Overall great hotel on a budget and brilliantly located. Recommended for the average traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice (but Nothing Special) in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Cubzter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a week on business and found it to be clean and perfectly suitable if you aren't looking for anything fancy. The Red Roof brand is a budget-type hotel and this property reflects that. I'm a bit surprised by the many "4-Star" ratings as that would indicate that this hotel is "Above Average" which in my opinion it is not in any way at all. It's just a good, basic hotel. It has some shortcomings, but overall I felt it was a good enough bargain to warrant an "Average" rating. This hotel is in a fantastic location very near Macy's, the Empire State Building (just one short block away) with a subway station at the end of the block. Times Square is a quick 15 minute walk north. The lobby is small but nicely appointed. It could, however, benefit greatly from better air conditioning as the lobby was always on the warm side (and I'm from Texas so I'm used to heat). The rooms aren't going to make the pages of Architectural Digest anytime soon but the furniture, while outdated, is in good shape. The room was average to a bit larger than many NYC hotel rooms (which are notoriously small). There were plenty of clothes hangers in the small closet and a generous amount of drawer space to store my things. I was, however, disappointed by the lack of an in-room safe. The bedding is of modest quality and the mattress incredibly hard. If you like firm mattresses you'll be fine, but I really missed my pillow-top mattress back home. Towels were a bit thin and small. Toiletries are of budget quality and I was happy that I'd brought my own soap and shampoo. The water pressure was very good and hot water was abundant. Like the lobby, the air conditioner in the room really needed some help. The room never did cool off adequately even with the unit on high. The unit also switched itself off a couple of times requiring a call to the front desk. I guess they must have thrown a breaker or something because it would come back on after my call without requiring an engineer to come to the room. The hotel claims to have free wireless Internet access in all rooms and while this is technically accurate, the service leaves much to be desired. Unfortunately the signal was terribly weak and the transmission rate was pathetic, often dropping out entirely. The hotel staff member I spoke to about this indicated that this was a typical problem but that there was nothing he could do about it. If you have much work to do on your trip that requires Internet connectivity I would recommend seeking a hotel more adequately equipped to handle the needs of business travelers. My biggest peeve was how slow the elevators were. Truly the wait was often ridiculous. Housekeeping was perfectly fine. Overall I would recommend the hotel provided you get a good enough rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: manorgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice now, once with my parents and another time with my boyfriend. Both times have been great. This hotel is reasonable (AAA discount accepted), clean and the staff are very friendly. You also get continental brekkie included in the price. The location is excellent. If you are looking for somewhere with no frills, that is clean and convenieint this is the place for you. Will book here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from June 1-7 and found the hotel to be more than adequate. The only negative was the noisy water pipes, had to shut the bathroom door when sleeping and the basin and tub were both a little slow to drain. Other than that, the hotel was clean, the elevator was a little slow but not as bad as they're made out to be. Room was a little small, but, loved the decent sized bathroom. The location was terrific, close to Penn Station and Bally's gym. Nice little bar and friendly staff. Couldn't ask for more at $149/night. I love NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BCGirlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Jun 4 - 9, 2005. I booked it for $149 US after seeing the reviews on here. The complimentary breakfast really helped with our expenses. Bagels, danishes, toast, oatmeal, apples, bananas, orange/apple juice, tea, coffee and milk. We stayed in 1211. Good size room, very clean, well kept. The bathroom was a good size although counter space a minimum. Not sure why the toilet roll holder was so low but we weren't inconvenienced any. Everyone complains about the elevator? The 2 elevators are older and the service staff do use them but I never had to wait longer than a couple minutes? I found the reception staff to be of a happy disposition and helpful although we didn't really need them for anything. The hotel is in Little Korea (Garment district), very busy dirty street but get used to that, there are a lot of them. Lots of delivery trucks/cabs zooming by, high emissions from vehicles but only 2 blocks to Penn Station and 1 block from Empire State. Felt very safe in the neighborhood. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after extensive research on TripAdvisor. I found this to be cheapest in the category I was looking for. The room was clean and large. The front-side is bit noisey due to the construction work and general NY noise. I found the staff to be polite and helpful. The area is not as plush as the central-park district , however, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn-Manhattan is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for New York City if you need a centrally located hotel, and a safe place to sleep that is very clean. The room we had was two double beds and the room was about the same size as other Red Roof Inns I have stayed in around the country. Most importantly, the hotel was true to its descriptions and I would stay there again. The staff was helpful when I needed them. In fact, on the drive home I deliberately sought another Red Roof Inn on the interstate based on the good expeirnece in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RedRoof Inn in NYC, at the end of April, 2005. We paid a Senior rate of $139.99. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms were fairly large, had nice amenities and were comfortable. The hotel served a complimentary breakfast, which offered a nice variety of choices. The staff was excellent to deal with. There was a bar on the second floor and concierge service in the lobby. The hotel is one block away from the Empire State Building, right west of 5th Avenue. We found the location to be just fine, as the walk up to 42nd street and surrounding sights was no problem. The subway was easily accessible at Herald Square, on Broadway. The hotel is fairly narrow, which isn't a problem save for not looking expansive. It is in the Korean district, which is a plus if you like Korean Food. Most of the businesses on 32nd St between 5th Ave and Broadway are Korean, but outside that defined area there are the normal mix of businesses. The disadvantage of the hotel was no on-site parking. We had to pay $24 per day to park in a facility on Broadway and 32nd Street, with no in-and-out priviledges. We had counted on reviews at Trip Advisor and in Fodor's, which rated the hotel highly. We found the reviews to be true and accurate. The Red Roof Inn is a nice bargain in the NYC sea of overpriced, mainline hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but agree with some of previous negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: BluCheetah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay in NYC, and for location and the what you get for your dollar you cannot go better than this hotel. The housecleaning was first class, the kingsize bed was great and the room size was ok, there are larger ones on each floor, try and request floor level ie. 801 or 805. All this for a two star hotel, alright. However, eventhough we didnt have any troubles with staff, I do feel of you crossed them, you would be in for a fight. One night I needed some extra towels, and after waiting half an hour, I made another reminding phone call, and the front desk, took my call and hung up fairly rudely when I questioned him! The towel eventuately came..... Also the lift is really slow, and if you are near the ice dispenser, it is loud when you are asleep. Overall, this hotel was great for the price, and you have to expect you are paying only for a two star in prime location that is clean and nice.
