Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ncdoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan recently and was very happy with the accomodations. Everything was very clean and the front desk was very nice. We arrived on a very early flight and were able to drop our luggage off at the hotel and they actually have a very nice system of handling your luggage. The breakfast room was also maintained throughout the morning very nicely and everything was replenished very often. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having read many reviews of this hotel, thought I should add one myself. Spent 4 days here and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel- was very impressed with the cleanliness of the lobby, room and hallways. The location is wonderful- couldn't have asked for better! It is approx 10 minute walk to Times Sq, 5 minutes to empire state building, subway right on the corner, and front desk staff was always helpful for us. The room was larger then anticipated with fridge too! The elevators were not bad as I have read on here plus get free breakfast- bagels, bananas, oatmeal, toast, coffeee tea juices. All in all, I would stay here again for the wonderful location and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Central Location”
Reviews.Author: CatsWhiskars
Reviews.Content: Having heard horrible things about Manhatten hotel rooms- was surprised that this was cheap, clean and spacious. The lifts were slow- I did pity the people on the 15th floor. For the proce of the hotel the breakfast was very good with a decent choice- the breakfast room did get busy but we were always able to get a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but I got a Bad room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The day that I was schedule to arrive in NYC was chaotic. Ran errands all over DC, missed my shuttle to NYC. I had to take a later shuttle (a 4.5 hour ride). I called the Red Roof Inn and told them that I would be delayed. The representative was courteous and put me at ease. She assured me that my room would be available when I arrived. Finally arrive around 10:30 pm. Got on the subway and got off at the wrong stop. walked several blocks in the rain to the hotel. I was given a room without a bathtub and it was a meeting room that was converted into a hotel room, i.e., huge room with a bed and a desk in it. There was no closet or dressers to place my clothes. I could not take a shower because the meeting room/bedroom did not have a bathtub/shower. They were going to charge me the full weekend rate until I complained. The next day I was sent to another room. It was a nice room but the bathtub drain didn't work. I was in a rush and didn't have time to wait for the engineer to fix it. I went out int the city not feeling to fresh. In fact, I skipped a few things that I had schedule because I was smelly. At check-out, I complained again and was only told to contact the manager when I return to NYC and he would insure that I receive a better room the next that I stay with them. Granted, it is one of the better Red Room Inns, but I could have been treated better or given a significant discount for the make-shift room with no bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, rude staff, but be careful with debit cards!”
Reviews.Author: Örs
Reviews.Content: It would have been an amazing stay in the heart of Manhattan in a very clean, nice hotel (big + for the breakfast). Our room actually had an excellent view on the Empire State Building. But... the receptionist accidentally made a triple (!!!!!!) authorization on my debit card, so as I left and arrived in Washington DC five hours later, there was no accessible money on my account. Fortunately I had another card on me with which i was able to pay, but it was a nightmare realizing that more than 1000$ disappeared from my account... As we returned to NY i tried to make the front desk staff clear, that they made a mistake and i actually have no money left. The manager was cooperative but very rude (just like the other front desk people), at the end he told me that it is common to happen to foreign debit cards and my money should be released in two weeks... Excuse me? Advise : Be very-very careful with your card at all time, if possible pay everything by cash, or be prepared...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: keharty
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to NYC and I've stayed at different hotels each time. First in Hicksville on Long Island, with one night at the Essex House as a treat and then at two different Comfort Inns. Aside from the luxury of the Essex House (along with a high price) the Red Roof Inn was the best place I've stayed. I primarily picked this hotel because my husband and I wanted a king sized bed like at home. The other hotels we stayed at all had tiny doubles. The price was good too, $139 a night which is a bargain for NYC. We booked directly through Red Roof Inns website. The hotel is located in Little Korea with lots of Korean restaurants in the neighborhood. We found one place right down the street that looked like a market at first but they had a great buffet in the back. They had some American food like meatloaf, mac & cheese and mashed potatoes, some Korean choices like kimchee, etc. and some really good Chinese food. It's a pay by the pound buffet. They also had a deli counter with sandwiches and other choices. It was really great but I can't remember the name. When you come out the the hotel it's to the left, a few doors down. The hotel lobby is nice sized and check in was easy. The staff is efficient but not overly friendly. We stayed in room 1407. The elevators are a little slow especially in the mornings when everyone is leaving their rooms. They must not have a service elevator because we frequently encountered staff taking the elevators. The people we spoke to were nice and very polite. Our room was quite big by NYC standards. Good sized bathroom with a tub and shower and plently of space to put toiletries. There is a blow dryer but no full length mirror. Complimentary shampoo, soap, etc. The bathroom was nice and clean. In the room was a closet with plenty of hangers, an ironing board and iron and a stand for a suitcase. Furnishings were in good shape with plenty of drawer space, two nightstands, a dresser, a desk with a chair and an extra chair. Very nice king sized bed with two extra pillows in the closet. There was one phone on the nightstand along with an alarm clock and another phone on the desk. Two big windows that do open and nice black out curtains. We did have a little trouble with the room temperature the first night. We like to sleep with the fan on for white noise but the room got pretty warm. The next day we called down to the front desk and asked that the heat be turned off. Less than a half hour we were called back and said it had been taken care of. We slept much cooler and more comfortably after that. Even though there was construction going on next door we could not hear it with the windows closed and the fan going. Not much noise in the hallways either. The maid service was good and they were very accomadating with us not leaving the room sometimes until almost noon. The TV worked fine. We never used the Nintendo stuff or the internet that you can do through the TV. I did notice that there was no safe in the room which I think would be a good idea. I feel much better leaving stuff in my room if it's locked up. Subway is close as well as plenty of non-Korean food, fast food, pizza, etc. The Empire State Building is right around the corner, Macy's an easy walk. If you like Irish bars, try Foley's around the corner on W. 33rd. Generous drinks at good prices. Gareth the bartender was great. As mentioned in other reviews, rooms ending in 10 are very small. We saw a diagram of the room layouts and you can definately tell that they are much smaller. Looks like rooms ending in 7 or 6 are the largest. The smaller rooms are the ones in the front, facing the Empire State Building. I would definately stay at the Red Roof Inn again and highly recommend it if you are looking for an affordable, clean hotel with larger than average NYC sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: dinky
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in the Red Roof Inn in Manhattan, 20/04/2005 to 24/04/2005 I payed $593.44 for four nights which was brilliant, as the hotel is clean, especially after the reviews i read about some hotels and they were more expensive. The room was spacious and clean and the bathroom was small but clean. It was really convenient for what we wanted as we did not spend any time in the room anyway (couple hours of sleep). Continental breakfast (bagels, apples and bananas, tea and coffee and juice, doughnuts) was included in the price and there was also a gym on the second floor (a couple of running and cycling machines). The staff were friendly and were happy to help if you asked. The maid was really nice and friendly and the rooms were maintained every day. My window view was not very good but hey thats not important, i did hear that there are some rooms with a good view. The Empire State Building is just around the corner, its a two minute walk and we went up at 1130pm it was amazing at night!!! The subway station is also very close, a two minute walk from the hotel and Times Square is about a ten minute walk. There is just one problem we were on the 12th floor and the lifts are ssssooooooo slow!! but the other things make up for it. I would like to also thank a great website and all the great people that contribute to this site, it really was a big help!! THANK YOU ALL!! Manhattan a must see place and i will visit again as it is huge!!! plenty of things to do!! shuttle service is very good too. drop off right outside the hotel around $17 single trip, shop around there are so many!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love”
Reviews.Author: Hannah16_10
Reviews.Content: Together with my 12-year old daughter, I stayed in the Red Roof Inn for one night and just fell in love with it. Great view (room on 15th floor) with Chrysler Building and Met Life, spacious room, windows to open (!), absolutly clean, breakfast included, and the subway only steps away. In the Lobby you can buy tickets for the Empire State Building so that you don´t have to stand in line afterwards. Plus you can order a cab in the morning for the trip to the airport same evening, so you don´t get in trouble when you are short in time. And you can store your luggage safely when you already checked out. On the opposite side of the hotel entrance there is a 24 hrs. Sushi-buffet - I wish we had something like that in Germany! All in all: Perfect room (we payed 179 plus taxes) with fridge and coffeemate, and perfect location. We will definitly come back as often as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Stop-Over For A Family Trip To Shea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are from Sussex County, New Jersey and decieded that a nice spring trip to see the N.Y. Mets at Shea Stadium was just what we needed after a long and cold winter. We decieded in advance to make a weekend out of it and spend the night in the city. The Red Roof Inn on 6 W. 32nd Street is centrally located and easy to take the subways uptown or downtown. The hotel was clean and the front desk staff was pleasant and courteous. The room we stayed in was a little on the small side (third floor) but it suited our needs when we went back to the room to relax after the game. Our view was less then terrific as they are doing construction on an ajoining building. One thing that I did find a little wierd and I dont know if it is the same in other rooms, but...the roll that held the toilet paper was so far away from the toilet seat that it was impossible to reach while seated. I had to take the paper off the roll and keep it on the vanity. I have no idea why it's like this, just bad design planning. We had 4 people and we paid $160.00. I thought the price was fair after looking up other hotels in Manhatten on Trip Advisor. We would definitley stay there again. We had a great weekend and are looking forward to going back again. (And the Mets Won!!!!!!!!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paid $139/night booking about a month in advance. Got a reasonable location near the Empire State, close to subway and Macy's, but in a Korean neighbourhood with the characteristic piles of rubbish bags outside the restaurants every day. First room we were given, despite having rung the hotel in advance to request a quiet room with a decent view, was small and cramped with a terrible view, made worse by the constant racket from the ice machine just outside - to add insult to injury, it didn't even dispense any ice, so we had to go 2 floors down to get some, and the hotel staff said they couldn't switch it off! Moved next day to another room on the same floor with view of the Empire State - much larger and better furnished, really quite comfortable, and we could only just hear the ice machine. Free breakfast comprised good quality orange juice, tea/coffee, doughnuts, bagels, toast, porridge and fruit - downside was that the breakfast room was far too small, so there was often standing room only, with a dash for a table as soon as one became free. Also too hot, as the air con was invariably switched off. Apparently there is free wireless high-speed internet access in the rooms, although they don't advertise it very well so I didn't bother taking my laptop. There are a couple of cheap internet cafes virtually next door, so don't use the TV-based system in the rooms, which is expensive. Staff were OK - moved our luggage to the new room for us while we were out, concierge booked us on the minibus shuttle back to JFK for $21/person, which only took 40 minutes (30 from picking up the last passengers) leaving at 7.30 pm - taxi would have been $55 plus tolls and couldn't have been any quicker. Didn't find any decent restaurants nearby, just loads of fast-food places, although I guess there was a good choice of Korean, which we didn't try as we had no idea what to expect. Very convenient for going up the Empire State at night - after an aborted attempt at 7.30, when the wait would have been 60-75 minutes, we went at about 10.30 pm, when there was absolutely nobody in the queue and the views were spectacular. All in all, better to stay at a reasonably priced place like this in a fairly convenient location than spend twice as much for a better room, but where you will just spend a few hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Yes and A Little No”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof Inn for five nights last week. Although the room wasn't what I had asked for, the front desk was accomodating and gave me several room choices. The hotel is very clean from the public areas to the individual rooms. I had room 406 which I was told one of the larger rooms. The Good: Clean, basically quiet except due to the marble hallway floors outside the rooms, the smallest sounds are magnified. Very central location, within walking distance to subways ect. Friendly staff for the most part and reasonably priced too. Th Bad: It took three calls to have a maintainence person fix the A/C. He finally got it to blow some coolish air. No view, and next to a construction site. (though they only worked between 7:00am-6:00pm). Sadly, those things could have been overlooked if not for the problem encountered at check out. It was very uncomfortable. The manager actually agrivated the situation by becoming verbally hostile when I questioned what I thought was to have been a discount. He finally and very reluctantly made an adjustment, but how embarasing in front of other guests and what a poor example in front of his staff. The discount may have been my misunderstanding but the situation wasn't handled professionally by the manager. Overall, the hotel is a good valus as long as you don't expect too much. I would possibly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find”
Reviews.Author: Tahiti
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Red Roof Inn Manhattan over April 22-25, 2005. It is located on 32 Street near Greeley Sq. Korean stores and restaurants all long street. Were had requested a non-smoking room but that had not been guaranteed. Upon arrival, the staff arranged it so that we got the non-smoking room. The room very nice , clean and everything worked properly. The hotel was quiet. The staff was very accommodating to us. For the money this is a great place to stay. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “7. New York Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at Red Roof Inn for 4 days. The Location from the Hotel is great, the Hotel and the Room was very clean. The continental breakfast was good. My wife and i have hat a great time in New York and the hotel made our Trip more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: summersky
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Red Roof Manhattan, as I was travelling with 3 senior ladies over the age of 75 (my mum, and 2 aunts from England). The front desk staff were very friendly...upgraded the rooms so that he could put us next to each other. Both rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast was more than we expected -- donuts, bagels, toast, oatmeal, cold cereal, fruit, juice. It is an old, renovated building so unfortunately the elevators were very slow. The only complaint I would have is that everyday I spoke to the concierge for information on sightseeing, and only one of them was friendly. The others weren't interested once they knew I wouldn't be booking anything with them. The hotel is in a great location, on W32nd between 5th Ave and Broadway, and there is lots to do within walking distance. I highly recommend the 48 hour hop-on, hop-off bus tour, and the free ferry ride to Staten Island (takes an hour and goes by the Statue of Liberty, while giving a great view of Manhattan skyline). The room rates were also much cheaper than anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: LJsuperW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Red Roof Inn for five nights in November and were very pleased. I was a little leery when I made the booking as I had stayed at another hotel in the same area a few years prior for a much higher rate and ended up being given a horrible, dirty room. I took a chance based on the reviews on this site and the location and am I ever glad I did. With our AAA discount the room averaged about $140 US a night (which was about $60 a night less than most of the other hotels I was considering) The room and bathroom was large, clean and pleasantly decorated. Not being a huge breakfast eaters, the included breakfast of bagels and fruit was perfect to tide us over until lunch. The only probelm - if you can call it that - was that the ice maker on our floor was super noisy. We solved that problem by unplugging it on our way back to our room in the evening and plugging it back in when we went for breakfast. We are planning on returning to New York this fall and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paddy's Day!!”
Reviews.Author: romas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn for the week March 12 - 19, as we were there for St Patrick's Day, and would definately recommend this bargain hotel to anyone visiting New York!! We read up on tripadvisor as we were told that you can get a small room for a lot of money in New York, so based on the reviews for the Red Roof thought we'd give it a go. Our room was clean and tidy, serviced every day, located at the back of the hotel on the 16th floor so was nice and quiet. What more could you want? We were however disappointed with the breakfast room as it was simply too small for the number of guests in the hotel, so went up 5th Ave to a cafe each morning (the Oxford Cafe I think) - perfect!! And for those after the Irish pubs they're all on 2nd and 3rd Ave around 32nd and up so was not too far to stagger home after the parade parties :) and perfect for Macy's, Times Square and of course the Empire State Building! All in all a bargain if you want to be assured of a clean hotel with standards above its 2 star rating. romas and Colleen

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel !”
Reviews.Author: nvickers22
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel over the weekend of the 9th of April. I was rather apprehesive, but was most pleasently surprised! Room was a nice size, bathroom clean and large, large tv, complimentary breakfast and perfect location. Staff was pleasant and most effecient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over Easter”
Reviews.Author: thecaramia
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8 : 2 forty-something mums, 2 thirty something friends and 19, 17. 13 and 11 year olds. We booked well in advance to get 4 twin bedded rooms and were delighted with price, location, quality and value. The complimentary breakfast was a big hit and the central location meant we never waited more than a couple of minutes for cabs/had lots of sights & shopping in easy walking distance. PS - a small tip: if you are going in a large group like ours - a limo costs about the same as two taxis and you get extra comfort and a free bar!

Reviews.Title: “Book It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: free1
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for 10days in Nov 2004. Everything about this hotel was perfect - location, staff, room, cleanliness, breakfast!! Had looked at every hotel possible in every price range before booking. It was definitely worth all the effort because I think I picked the perfect place. Our room was HUGE! Thought all rooms in NYC were supposed to be tiny! Huge king size bed, microwave, fridge, tv and loads of storage space for all the shopping!!! Had asked for a view of empire state if possible and didnt get it but had a view of chrysler building which was lovely! Cant recommend this hotel highly enough. Definitely will stay there again on next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Gauchos
Reviews.Content: I saw a few 3 star hotels that were far less desirable than this 2 star bargain. Size was plenty big for 2 of us with a King bed and adequate bathroom. Staff was friendly as they needed to be, but more importantly, rooms were cleaned thoroughly on a daily basis. Could get to all areas of Manhattan within a matter of minutes via subway, or walking distance to Times Square/Theatre District and any spot in midtown. There are better neighborhoods to be sure, but half the fun of visiting New York is the exploration of different areas and neighborhoods. Who really stays within a 10 block radius of their hotel in NYC? Will not hesitate to stay here upon my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid $113.00 AAA rate during our stay from March 1st through the 7th. Ive stayed at many 4 star and 5 star properties in Manhattan and chose to stay here for we werent going to be in our room much this stay. It stated that it was a 2 star property. I would give it a solid 3 stars. Where in Manhattan do u get a complimentary continental breakfast. It was great..Great New York Bagels, terrific donuts, my waist thanks you! Hot oatmeal, juice, some fresh fruit, coffee, tea, milk and juice..Just what we needed. Theres a bar on the mezzanine level. The property has a small gym to keep u in shape. The location is terrific. Its midtown which is smack in the middle of all of the subways. You are a couple of blocks from the eastside 4,5,and 6 trains, 1 block from the 5th ave line which is the N,R,Q, and W and a few more blocks you get to Penn station where the west side lines are 1,2,3,9,A,C and E.. One block from Macys. Close to restauarants. The room was fine . It had a king bed and a desk. Local calls to the 212 area code are free. Thats unheard of in New York. Decent size bathrooms, iron and board and cable TV. Coffee maker in the room too....Worth the money and I would recommend it to anyone who is on a budget but doesnt have to sacrifice...

Reviews.Title: “Our apprehension was totally unwarranted”
Reviews.Author: BohemianWay
Reviews.Content: This Red Roof Inn located at 6 W. 32nd Street was exactly what we wanted. We stayed in a room with two double beds, and the room was larger than most NYC hotels in this price range. The room was not fancy, but clean and comfortable. It was not old and dingy. The only objectionable part was there was a little grime around the doorknob on the bathroom door, but that was easily taken care of with a wet wipe! Upon check in, the desk attendant gladly offered us a room with a small (clean) refrigerator and microwave when we told her it was a special mother/daughters weekend celebrating a 40th birthday. It was early December, and the refrigerator came in handy for holiday treats, wine, cheeses, leftover food items, and milk for coffee. There were 4 women in the room, and we never felt terribly cramped, but we are all seasoned travelers, and very agreeable regarding sharing space and shower rotations. The continental breakfast consisted of several different breads for toast, English muffins, bagels and condiments, orange juice, coffee, milk, oatmeal, and fresh bananas and apples. We were glad we had taken our own healthy cereal for variety, and we used the milk from the breakfast room. You cannot beat the price or location for accomodations. The hotel staff was professional, and we felt like they would have fixed any problems, had we encountered any. We are eager to try one of the three sister hotels in this Apple Core chain on our next visit, but we might just stay here again, because we know it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Last Time....”
Reviews.Author: fw1505
Reviews.Content: Have stayed once before so I thought I knew what to expect. The late check in was painless and curt and at first glance the room seemed satisfactory and clean. But soon the smell of some cleaning solution became very noticeable. The next morning my face was puffy and my eyes were swollen. I went outside in search of a newspaper and noticed that in the 15 minutes that I was out of the room, the symptoms were dissipating. Upon returning to the room the symptoms began to reappear. Perhaps I have a sensitivity or allergy to that cleaner, but the odor was pungent like too much cheap perfume! The internet kiosk in the lobby was not working and the concierge was unaware and indifferent as were were the night desk clerks. I would not return if the room was complimentary, but for others without the sensitivity I just described, the room is overpriced. It might be a Manhattan value at around $130-140 tops...but for almost $200 per night it is out of line. I moved to a 4 star hotel in the Midtown east section of the city for $35 more per night and it was more than worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_native
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel is getting a 4 is because of its price and location. Put this hotel anywhere else and it would be a 2 or a 3 at best. For the price the hotel is excellent, and its locations is great. Its only 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, a short walk from the subways station and Times Square. Its located in Korea Town so there's lots of Asian restaurants near by if you like that kinda stuff. Lots of good cheap ones and some really good expensive ones. As for the hotel itself, its VERY clean. The price again is great but the cleaning service is more then excellent. The rooms were always cleaned by the time we got back. The contineltal breakfast room was also very clean, but very small which makes it very busy. The hotel does have some problems like no working ice machines on any floor, which was rather irritating. The elevators were VERY slow and there's no way to use the stairs. We were on the 15th floor and tried to get to the lobby from it but the stairs lead to the staff area. We later asked the front desk how to get to the lobby from the stairs he said you couldn't. Overall the hotel is great again because of price and location, so if you don't mind not having the perfect hotel staying here is a sure bet. I definately would consider staying agian, adn I"m sure you will to if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 times so far, at around $130+TAX, which can be ordered through the internet. Rooms are clean, relatively new, and equipped (table and two chairs in a 2-star hotel are not so common, not to mention the electric kettle). Bathroom is in a very good shape, and there is a lot of place near the sink to put your personal stuff on. The rooms I had were also quiet (facing little Korea), at the cost of an always closed window. Staff is OK - handled my requests without any problem. The breakfast is very basic (toast, apples, bananas, tea and coffee). The gym is also a basic one, but it was never crowded at nights, and the equipment was in good condition. The only major problem I had was with the elevators - there are only 2 for the whole hotel, and they tend to be over-crowded, slow or under repair.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -- reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: aDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and find it is a very good value. A room at $99 in NYC city usually has a problem, but not at Red Roof. There is nothing fancy here but the rooms look new, and are nicely kept. It is quiet. If you are arriving by train, it is walking distance from Penn Station -- just two long blocks from the 7th Ave/32nd St exit of Penn Station. It is also close to the subways and to many tourist sites(Empire State Building) and shopping (Macy's, 5th Ave, and speciality shops). There are many Korean restaurants in the block of the hotel--some are open 24 hrs. Free breakfast is good -- bagels, donuts, oatmeal (no cold cereal), bananas and apples. Opens at 7am. Other nearby coffee shops open earlier. Bar has high priced drinks -- try some where else in the neighborhood. Some front desk staff were more helpful than others.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to rest our weary legs!”
Reviews.Author: wooz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Red Roof Inn. For a low cost hotel, it had everything we were looking for, it was clean, it was close to the subway, it was quiet, and the price quoted $99.00 per night was what we paid. When we first arrived we were shown to a room that was tiny! I went back to the front desk and was immediately given a much better room on a higher floor ( try to stay out of the rooms that end in 10) The breakfast room was well stocked and busy, it allowed a great opportunity to meet fellow travellers. Although the front desk staff were not overly friendly the rest of the staff were wonderful. We are hoping to return to NY in April and will definately book back into the Red Roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaitQuando
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just arrived back from a week in NYC. We had originally reserved a room at the Hotel Pensylvania but after reading the reviews here we changed our minds and booked the Red Roof Inn Manhattan. We were really glad that we did, it was an excellent hotel - really good value for money. The rooms were small but spotlessly clean and serviced every day. The location was really really great, our room looked out on the Empire State Building and with the subway close by you could get to anywhere in the city quickly. The complimentary breakfast was great - doughnuts, bagels, toast, fruit, coffee, tea, porridge and fruit juice. The food was really fresh and the buffet was kept well stocked. The staff were nice and helpful. Its not the Four Seasons so don't expect a top class hotel, but its everything you need and the price is very reasonable. There are so many ways to spend your money in New York - it really doesn't make sense to waste it on a hotel that you won't spend much time in anyway. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will definitely be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Roof Inn? YES!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I saw "Red Roof Inn" in the reviews, all I could think of was that ubiquitous Motel with the giant Red Roof. But I trusted my TripAdvisor pals and took a chance. And it was far better than we expected. The location was great. The room was actually a very decent size. Tehre was plenty of hot water. We needed 2 beds so we had to get the smoking room. The room didn't even have a hint of smoke smell in it! The hallways did have a slight smokey smell, but nothing offensive. The room was clean. The hotel staff was Very friendly and helpful. The price was very reasonable and even included a continental breakfast! In January we paid about $126 including taxes. And breakfast! I hope this place stays the same b/c we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: caroleherb
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel was amazingly nice. Stayed here three times, in three different rooms over the course of a few weeks. Each room was spotlessly clean, of decent size and pleasantly decorated. The front desk staff and concierge could be a bit more friendly, but overall were acceptably helpful. I would recommend this hotel to others who were looking for an economical choice in Manhattan and will stay here again on my next visit to the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Spacious Rooms, The photos don't lie”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this hotel for two weeks on late November. I read all the reviews and compared all the prices and locations. I gave it a shot. The location is good. The service is acceptable (don't expect Disney's hospitality on Manhattan). The rooms are clean and big almost spotless. The beds are big and very comfortabel. Look at the pictures on their website they don't lie, trust me. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Use their website to make reservations its easy and fast its user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deb2311
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days between Christmas and New Year 04. It was absolutely great. The location was first class, the staff were polite and helpful, the room was a good size and clean, the bar was small but cozy and the breakfast had something for everyone. Will definitely go back next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: JasonSam
Reviews.Content: While the Red Roof Inn will never be confused with the Four Seasons, the hotel is very clean, comfortable, and the rooms are nice sized. The bathrooms are full sized and each room has a hair dresser and wireless internet. The people in the lobby were very easy to deal with. The breakfast was coffee, orange juice, bagels, apples, and oatmeal. A very quick grab on the way out. The health club had three cardio machines. I would stay at this hotel again and would not have a problem recommeding it to people.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms, new and clean”
Reviews.Author: ackart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for christmas week and loved the service and location. It was not in the thick of things so you could get away from the crowds. The rooms were large and huge bathrooms that were just remodeled. There was some construction work right outside our window so you might bring a headset for the early morning. There was parking a block away you had to park yourself but you get a discount staying at the hotel. The breakfast was great, oatmeal, bagels, donuts, fruit and juice. The only problem was the size of the eating area. We learned to get down there before 8 to avoid the elevator traffic jams. The street is Little Korea so we took advantage of an authentic Koren meal one night. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: 23_co_durham
Reviews.Content: my mam and i stayed here for 4 nights starting on the 1st dec and we loved it. the rooms were huge, very clean and we had a great view of the empire state building. we had maid service every day we were there. the receptionists were friendly, and the girls selling tours in the lobby area were great! complimentary breakfast consisted of fruit & fruit juice, tea & coffee, toast, bagels, doughnuts & porridge. it was kept well stocked. the hotels location is fab! just around the corner from macys & empire state building. there is a subway station just at the end of the street. hoewever we actually walked from central park back to the hotel! i will def be staying here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location for the family!”
Reviews.Author: nicole2512
Reviews.Content: Me, my brother and my mum and dad stayed here sharing a room for my 18th Birthday. It was plenty big enough except the beds were rather small, our view consisted of the construction of a building, but this did not bother us as we were up early anyway and by the time we were back they had gone. (It was quite interesting to watch them work anyway!) We thought the soundproofing of the rooms was really good because we hardly heard anything that was going on outside. Even during the day when we went up to our room to drop stuff off we could hardly hear any of the hustle and bustle outside. Location was excellent for us, we couldnt fault it, really close to Macys, The Empire state building and the metro. Breakfast was ok, quite basic but nice! We found shopping early to be the answer to beat crowds as they get really busy in the afternoon and evening. Century 21 nr. ground zero is def worth a visit . Some electrical shops are closed friday pm and saturdays. We found walking the best way to get around, took us about 10-15 mins to get to Times Square and about 25 mins to get to central park (i recommend the ice-skating). We went to watch Christmas spectacular at radio city, this was really good! We found eating out to be different as everything is disposable and on the move! New york was amazing, had to buy an extra suitcase to fit all our new goodies in! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, superb location, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the very moment I booked the room(s) I knew I was on to a winner. The reservations line advisor, Victor, was an angel. He managed to work the boookings so that we were able to stay in the hotel all through the stay despite the hotel being fully booked. Yes I had to move rooms twice but it was a very minor inconvenience to keep the whole party of 5 together. The rooms were very clean and functional. The bathroom suites were exceptionally clean - typical hotel bath, not very deep, but I prefer to shower after a long day walking round Manhattan Island - clean sheets every day, sounds like a silly thing to say, but if you're used to English hotels then you'll know what a novelty this is. Breakfast was simple and filling. Bagels, oats (porridge), lots of fruit juice, fresh fruit, tea coffee. The staff were amazingly helpful, especially during the two minor emergencies we had during the stay. The hotel is less than spitting distance from 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. Manhattan Mall and Macy's are only 5 minutes away. Madison Square Garden less than 10 minutes away. At only around $200 (115 GBP) per night for two adults and two children to stay this close to the centre of New York, I really can't recommend this hotel enough. Get your booking in early though as it fills up very quickly. When I go back to New York to visit all the places I missed the first time, I will definitely be booking this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Service, CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: degriffith
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the big apple and I was scared booking a hotel online. However I was so plesantly suprised by The Red Roof Inn Manhattan. It was affordable, clean, service was wonderful, they could not have been nicer. The room was a bit small but by New York standards very adaquate. A nice king size bed, dresser, desk, chairs, I didn't feel cramped even after staying a week. Excellent free breakfast every day. Very Clean and everything worked well. I was very pleased and we plan on staying there again. Not far from Macy's department store, sub way or buses. A great vlaue. Save your money and stay at The Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location near to Empire Sate, Macy's and Time Square. Safe area in 'Little Korea'. Clean rooms, internet access in room, really nice hotel. Breakfast ok but on 2nd floor, so be prepared to use the lifts.....you'll see what I mean ! Also great location, as it's so close to the Empire State, you can use it to navigate back to your hotel wherever you are in Manhattan !!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: tamsha
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this property from September 18-24. It was our first visit to New York. We found this hotel to be very clean, quiet, the staff accommodating and helpful, and the location great. The free breakfast in the morning was a perfect way to start the day - fresh fruit, bagels, donuts, oatmeal, toast, coffee, juice - all you need to get going in the morning. Be warned though that the breakfast room is very busy and sometimes you have to wait for a table. They also close PROMPTLY at 10:00 am. We had a double-bed room on the 6th floor. Rooms are clean, beds were comfortable however the rooms are VERY small. Absolutely no place to store your luggage. I would not recommend these rooms for any more than 2 people. We asked for extra pillows and our request was looked after immediately. There are only 2 elevators and they were really slow when busy but nothing to be overly concerned about. Subway station is within half a block and the best way to get around the city. We were leery at first of taking it but the people in NY were very helpful and we had no problems getting around after the first couple of times of using it. Cab drivers are CRAZY so we opted to use the subway wherever possible. With the hotel being on Korea street, there aren't many American restaurants closeby - there is a Burger King and Wendys just up the street and around the corner though for a quick meal. Hotel is really close to Macys (a great place to shop) and about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Take the double decker bus tour around the city - a great way to see all the sites. Don't ask the concierge to book a Broadway show for you - they charge an extra $20 per ticket. Much cheaper just to call Ticketmaster and do it yourself. I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in May 04 (our main hotel were booked out that night and booked us in). We had no problems with cleanliness and even though we were forced to share a bed (no twins left) as mother and daughter the bed was so huge that we still slept well. Be warned make sure you get to breakfast well before it finishes - they clear everything away bang on the dot of closing time. Great location for Empire State Building and Maceys less dining opportunities however though we had an enjoyable if different Korean meal in the same streeet

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe this property is grungy. Will never stay again. Found a cockroach in the bed. Very rundown. Not the Red Roof quality we are accustomed to in other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: Hi-Guys
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a different chain hotel and changed it just before our trip after reading an article in the Telegraph. We are so glad we did. We reserved two rooms as we are a family of 5 with 3 teenaged children. The hotel was ideally situated close to subway, Times Square and Empire State Building. It was very clean and appeared to have been refurbished. The rooms were not as large as others we stayed in, but for NY we were pleasantly surprised. Although we had requested a King and one with 2 doubles, we wanted to be adjacent to the children so opted for 2 rooms with 2 doubles. One of the rooms was slightly larger with a fridge and microwave. The rooms were cleaned daily, towels replaced daily and tea/coffe maker in each room replenished. Although there was construction outside we did not notice any noise. Breakfast was better than we expected with bagels, doughnuts, fruit, toast, juice, coffee/tea and oatmeal cereal. We paid $106 per room per night in August - great value! We used the hotel to book theatre tickets and pick up for the airport and got good seats and prompt service.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: kellyon4
Reviews.Content: I chose the Red Roof Inn Manhattan after getting some information from other reviews. I have often stayed at Red Roof Inns, and had a Loyalty Certificate (free night's stay) which I was (supposed to) be able to use there. We were booked for two nights. Days before my trip, I suffered a serious car accident, and could not go. My girlfriends could still go, so I sent them with a letter stating the events that had occurred, sent my credit card, etc., and thought that it should be honored considering the circumstances. Not only did they not allow use of the certificate, they charged my friends almost DOUBLE the rate of the second night (about $190.00 on a Monday night, original price should have been $102.00) Because my friends were weary from the travel, they did not search out an alternate location. The people at the desk were very rude to them. When I spoke to Red Roof representative directly afterwards, the lady I spoke to was sympathetic, but explained that this particular hotel is franchise owned, so basically, they go by their own rules. Not a customer service oriented property.

HotelInfo.Name: nyma, the New York Manhattan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6 W 32nd St, New York City, NY 10001
